              norm_cast
              rw [show (1 : ‚Ñù) = 1 * (1 : ‚Ñ§) by norm_num]
              apply mul_le_mul this
              . refine (Int.floor_le x).trans ?_
                norm_cast
              . positivity
              . norm_num
            . positivity
            . norm_num
          . positivity
          . norm_num
        . positivity
        . norm_num
      linarith
    -- Show that x ‚â§ 122 / 41 and x ‚â• 122 / 41.
    apply le_antisymm
    . by_contra!
      -- If not, then f(122 / 41) < f(x).
      specialize h‚ÇÇ (122 / 41) x (by norm_num) this
      linarith
    . -- If not, then f(x) < f(122 / 41).
      by_contra!
      specialize h‚ÇÇ x (122 / 41) (le_of_lt h‚ÇÅ) this
      linarith       
  . -- Show that 122 / 41 is indeed a solution.
    intro hx
    -- Direct calculations.
    norm_num [hx]

soln_description:
First, we note that on the right side, a number smaller than 2 cannot be written. If indeed \( a_{m}=\frac{1}{m} \) for any index \( m \), then

\[
a_{1}=\frac{2}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}}+\cdots+\frac{n}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{a_{n}}}=\sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{k}{1+2+\cdots+k}=\sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{2}{k+1}
\]

therefore

\[
2 \sum_{k=1}^{n} a_{k}-\sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{k}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{a_{k}}}=2 \sum_{k=1}^{2} \frac{1}{k}-\sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{2}{k+1}=2-\frac{2}{n+1}<2
\]

Moreover, as is well known, the sum \( \sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{1}{k} \) can be arbitrarily large as \( n \) increases.

Next, let's write the equality between the weighted harmonic and arithmetic means for the numbers \( a_{1}, 2 a_{2}, 3 a_{3}, \ldots, k a_{k} \) with weights \( 1,2, \ldots, k \):

\[
\begin{gathered}
\frac{1+2+\cdots+k}{1 \cdot \frac{1}{a_{1}}+2 \cdot \frac{1}{2 a_{2}}+\cdots+k \cdot \frac{1}{k a_{k}}}=\frac{\frac{k(k+1)}{2}}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{a_{k}}} \leq \\
\leq \frac{a_{1}+2 \cdot 2 a_{2}+\cdots+k \cdot k a_{k}}{1+2+\cdots+k}=\frac{1^{2} \cdot a_{1}+2^{2} \cdot a_{2}+\cdots+k^{2} a_{k}}{\frac{k(k+1)}{2}}
\end{gathered}
\]

thus

\[
\frac{k}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{a_{k}}} \leq \frac{4}{k(k+1)^{2}}\left(1^{2} \cdot a_{1}+2^{2} \cdot a_{2}+\cdots+k^{2} \cdot a_{k}\right)
\]

The advantage of this inequality is that equality holds when \( a_{m}=\frac{1}{m} \).

Summing (1) for \( k=1,2, \ldots, n \), and using the easily verifiable inequality \( \frac{4}{k(k+1)^{2}}<\frac{2}{k^{2}}-\frac{2}{(k+1)^{2}} \),

\[
\begin{aligned}
& \sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{k}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{a_{k}}} \leq \sum_{k=1}^{n} \frac{4}{k(k+1)^{2}} \sum_{m=1}^{k} m^{2} a_{m}= \\
& =\sum_{m=1}^{n}\left(\sum_{k=m}^{n} \frac{4}{k(k+1)^{2}}\right) \cdot m^{2} a_{m}<\sum_{m=1}^{n}\left(\sum_{k=m}^{\infty}\left(\frac{2}{k^{2}}-\frac{2}{(k+1)^{2}}\right)\right) \cdot m^{2} a_{m}= \\
& =\sum_{m=1}^{n} \frac{2}{m^{2}} \cdot m^{2} a_{m}=2\left(a_{1}+a_{2}+\cdots+a_{n}\right)
\end{aligned}
\]

This completes the proof of the statement.
informal_statement:
Let's prove that for any positive integers $a_{1}, \ldots, a_{n}$,

$$
a_{1}+\frac{2}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}}+\frac{3}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}+\frac{1}{a_{3}}}+\cdots+\frac{n}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{a_{n}}}<2\left(a_{1}+a_{2}+\cdots+a_{n}\right)
$$
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

open Finset

/- Let's prove that for any positive integers $a_{1}, \ldots, a_{n}$,
$$
a_{1}+\frac{2}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}}+\frac{3}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}+\frac{1}{a_{3}}}+\cdots+\frac{n}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{a_{n}}}<2\left(a_{1}+a_{2}+\cdots+a_{n}\right)

$$
 -/
theorem inequalities_210843 (n : ‚Ñï) (hn : 0 < n) (a : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (ha : ‚àÄ i, 0 < a i) :
    ‚àë i ‚àà Icc 1 n, i / (‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 i, 1 / a j) < 2 * ‚àë i ‚àà Icc 1 n, a i := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

open Finset

/- Let's prove that for any positive integers $a_{1}, \ldots, a_{n}$,
$$
a_{1}+\frac{2}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}}+\frac{3}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}+\frac{1}{a_{3}}}+\cdots+\frac{n}{\frac{1}{a_{1}}+\frac{1}{a_{2}}+\cdots+\frac{1}{a_{n}}}<2\left(a_{1}+a_{2}+\cdots+a_{n}\right)

$$
 -/
theorem inequalities_210843 (n : ‚Ñï) (hn : 0 < n) (a : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (ha : ‚àÄ i, 0 < a i) :
    ‚àë i ‚àà Icc 1 n, i / (‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 i, 1 / a j) < 2 * ‚àë i ‚àà Icc 1 n, a i := by
  -- Prove a lemma missing in Mathlib 4.15:
  -- ‚àë i ‚àà [m, n), (f (i + 1) - f i) = f n - f m.
  have sum_Ico_sub {m n : ‚Ñï} (f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (hmn : m ‚â§ n) : ‚àë i ‚àà Ico m n, (f (i + 1) - f i) = f n - f m := by
    rw [sum_Ico_eq_sub _ hmn, sum_range_sub, sum_range_sub]
    ring
  -- Prove the following inequality:
  -- (‚àë i ‚àà [1, k], i) / (‚àë i ‚àà [1, k], 1 / a i) ‚â§ (‚àë i ‚àà [1, k], i ^ 2 * a i) / (k * (k + 1) / 2).
  have h1 {k : ‚Ñï} (hk : 1 ‚â§ k) : (‚àë i ‚àà Icc (1 : ‚Ñï) k, i : ‚Ñù) / ‚àë i ‚àà Icc (1 : ‚Ñï) k, (1 : ‚Ñù) / a i
      ‚â§ (‚àë i ‚àà Icc (1 : ‚Ñï) k, i ^ 2 * a i) / (k * (k + 1) / 2) := by
    -- Define w(i) = i and z(i) = i * a(i).
    set w : Icc (1 : ‚Ñï) k ‚Üí ‚Ñù := fun i => i
    set z : Icc (1 : ‚Ñï) k ‚Üí ‚Ñù := fun i => i * a i
    -- We have 0 < w(i) for all i ‚àà [1, k].
    have hw : ‚àÄ i ‚àà univ, 0 < w i := by
      simp only [univ_eq_attach, mem_attach, forall_const, Subtype.forall, mem_Icc, w]
      intro i hi
      norm_cast
      linarith
    -- We have 0 < z(i) for all i ‚àà [1, k].
    have hz : ‚àÄ i ‚àà univ, 0 < z i := by
      simp only [univ_eq_attach, mem_attach, forall_const, Subtype.forall, mem_Icc, and_imp, z]
      intro i hi1 hi2
      exact mul_pos (by norm_cast) (ha i)
    -- The set [1, k] is not empty.
    have hne : (univ : Finset (Icc (1 : ‚Ñï) k)).Nonempty := by
      simp only [univ_eq_attach, attach_nonempty_iff, nonempty_Icc, hk]
    calc
      -- We have
      -- (‚àë i ‚àà [1, k], i) / (‚àë i ‚àà [1, k], 1 / a i) = (‚àë i, w i) / ‚àë i, w i / z i.
      (‚àë i ‚àà Icc (1 : ‚Ñï) k, i : ‚Ñù) / ‚àë i ‚àà Icc (1 : ‚Ñï) k, (1 : ‚Ñù) / a i = (‚àë i, w i) / ‚àë i, w i / z i := by
        congr 1
        ¬∑ rw [univ_eq_attach, sum_attach]
        ¬∑ rw [univ_eq_attach, ‚Üê sum_attach]
          apply sum_congr rfl
          simp only [mem_attach, mul_one, forall_const, Subtype.forall, mem_Icc, and_imp, w, z]
          intro i hi1 hi2
          rw [div_mul_cancel_left‚ÇÄ, one_div]
          norm_cast
          linarith
      -- Apply HM-GM inequality and get
      -- (‚àë i, w i) / ‚àë i, w i / z i ‚â§ (‚àè i, z i ^ w i) ^ (‚àë i, w i)‚Åª¬π.
      _ ‚â§ (‚àè i, z i ^ w i) ^ (‚àë i, w i)‚Åª¬π := Real.harm_mean_le_geom_mean _ hne w z hw (sum_pos hw hne) hz
      -- Apply GM-AM inequality and get
      -- (‚àè i, z i ^ w i) ^ (‚àë i, w i)‚Åª¬π ‚â§ (‚àë i, w i * z i) / ‚àë i, w i.
      _ ‚â§ (‚àë i, w i * z i) / ‚àë i, w i := by
        apply Real.geom_mean_le_arith_mean
        ¬∑ intro i hi
          exact le_of_lt (hw i hi)
        ¬∑ exact sum_pos hw hne
        ¬∑ intro i hi
          exact le_of_lt (hz i hi)
      -- It is left to show that
      -- (‚àë i, w i * z i) / ‚àë i, w i = (‚àë i ‚àà [1, k], i^2 * a(i)) / (k * (k + 1) / 2).
      _ = (‚àë i ‚àà Icc (1 : ‚Ñï) k, i ^ 2 * a i) / (k * (k + 1) / 2) := by
          congr 1
          ¬∑ symm
            rw [univ_eq_attach, ‚Üê sum_attach]
            apply sum_congr rfl
            simp only [mem_attach, forall_const, Subtype.forall, mem_Icc, w, z]
            intro i hi
            group
          ¬∑ rw [univ_eq_attach, sum_attach]
            field_simp
            calc
              (‚àë i ‚àà Icc (1 : ‚Ñï) k, (i : ‚Ñù)) * 2 = (((‚àë i ‚àà range (k + 1), i) * 2 : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñù) := by
                simp [sum_range_eq_add_Ico]
                rfl
              _ = (k : ‚Ñù) * (k + 1) := by
                rw [sum_range_id_mul_two, add_tsub_cancel_right]
                push_cast
                group
  -- Prove the following inequality:
  -- k / ‚àë j ‚àà [1, j], 1 / a(j) ‚â§ 4 / (k * (k + 1)^2) * ‚àë j ‚àà [1, k], j^2 * a(j).
  have hineq {k : ‚Ñï} (hk : 1 ‚â§ k) : k / ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 k, 1 / a j ‚â§ 4 / (k * (k + 1)^2) * ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 k, j^2 * a j := calc
    -- We have
    -- k / ‚àë j ‚àà [1, j], 1 / a(j) = ((‚àë j ‚àà [0, k + 1), j) * 2) / (k + 1) / ‚àë j ‚àà [1, k], 1 / a(j).
    -- This equality follows from (‚àë j ‚àà [0, k + 1), j) * 2 = k * (k + 1).
    k / ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 k, 1 / a j = (((‚àë j ‚àà range (k + 1), j) * 2 : ‚Ñï) / (k + 1)) / ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 k, 1 / a j := by
      rw [sum_range_id_mul_two, add_tsub_cancel_right]
      field_simp
    -- ((‚àë j ‚àà [0, k + 1), j) * 2) / (k + 1) / ‚àë j ‚àà [1, k], 1 / a(j)
    --    = 2 / (k + 1) * ((‚àë j ‚àà [1, k], j) / ‚àë j ‚àà [1, k], 1 / a j)
    --    ‚â§ 2 / (k + 1) * ((‚àë j ‚àà [1, k], j^2 * a j) / (k * (k + 1) / 2) (from h1)
    --    = 4 / (k * (k + 1)^2) * ‚àë j ‚àà [1, k], j^2 * a j.
    _ = (2 / (k + 1)) * ((‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 k, j) / ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 k, 1 / a j) := by
      push_cast
      suffices ‚àë j ‚àà range (k + 1), j = ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 k, j by
        rify at this
        rw [this]
        ring
      rw [sum_range_eq_add_Ico _ (by linarith), zero_add]
      rfl
    _ ‚â§ (2 / (k + 1)) * ((‚àë j ‚àà Icc (1 : ‚Ñï) k, j ^ 2 * a j) / (k * (k + 1) / 2)) := by
      push_cast
      gcongr (2 / (k + 1)) * ?_
      exact h1 hk
    _ = 4 / (k * (k + 1)^2) * ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 k, j^2 * a j := by
      field_simp
      ring
  calc
    -- We have
    -- ‚àë i ‚àà [1, n], i / ‚àë j ‚àà [1, i], 1 / a j
    --    ‚â§ ‚àë i ‚àà [1, n], 4 / (i * (i + 1)^2) * ‚àë j ‚àà [1, i], j^2 * a j (from hineq)
    --    = ‚àë j ‚àà [1, n], (‚àë i ‚àà [j, n], 4 / (i * (i + 1)^2)) * j^2 * a j
    ‚àë i ‚àà Icc 1 n, i / ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 i, 1 / a j ‚â§ ‚àë i ‚àà Icc 1 n, 4 / (i * (i + 1)^2) * ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 i, j^2 * a j := by
      apply sum_le_sum
      intro i hi
      simp only [mem_Icc] at hi
      exact hineq hi.1
    _ = ‚àë i ‚àà Ico 1 (n + 1), ‚àë j ‚àà Ico 1 (i + 1), 4 / (i * (i + 1)^2) * (j^2 * a j) := by
      simp_rw [mul_sum]
      rfl
    _ = ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 n, (‚àë i ‚àà Icc j n, (4 : ‚Ñù) / (i * (i + 1)^2)) * j^2 * a j := by
      rw [‚Üê sum_Ico_Ico_comm]
      simp_rw [sum_mul, mul_assoc]
      rfl
    -- Show that 4 / (i * (i + 1)^2) ‚â§ (4 * i + 2) / (i^2 + (i + 1)^2) for all i ‚àà [1, n].
    _ ‚â§ ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 n, (‚àë i ‚àà Icc j n, (4 * i + 2 : ‚Ñù) / (i^2 * (i + 1)^2)) * j^2 * a j := by
      apply sum_le_sum
      intro i hi
      gcongr ?_ * i^2 * a i
      ¬∑ exact le_of_lt (ha i)
      apply sum_le_sum
      intro k hk
      simp only [mem_Icc] at hk hi
      rw [div_le_div_iff‚ÇÄ]
      ¬∑ rw [‚Üê sub_nonneg]
        ring_nf
        positivity
      ¬∑ norm_cast
        apply mul_pos (by linarith) (by positivity)
      ¬∑ norm_cast
        apply mul_pos (by nlinarith) (by positivity)
    -- We have
    -- (4 * i + 2) / (i^2 * (i + 1)^2) = 2 / i^2 - 2 / (i + 1)^2.
    -- So ‚àë i ‚àà [j, n], (4 * i + 2) / (i^2 * (i + 1)^2) = 2 / j^2 - 2 / (n + 1)^2.
    _ = ‚àë j ‚àà Icc 1 n, ((2 : ‚Ñù) / j^2 - 2 / (n + 1)^2) * j^2 * a j := by
      apply sum_congr rfl
      intro k hk
      congr
      calc
        ‚àë i ‚àà Icc k n, (4 * i + 2 : ‚Ñù) / (i ^ 2 * (i + 1) ^ 2) = -‚àë i ‚àà Ico k (n + 1), ((2 : ‚Ñù) / (i + 1 : ‚Ñï)^2 - 2 / i^2) := by
          rw [‚Üê sum_neg_distrib]
          apply sum_congr rfl
          intro i hi
          have hi0 : (i : ‚Ñù) ‚â† 0 := by
            norm_cast
            simp only [mem_Icc] at hi hk
            linarith
          field_simp [hi0]
          ring
        _ = (2 : ‚Ñù) / k^2 - 2 / (n + 1)^2 := by
          rw [sum_Ico_sub (f := fun i => (2 : ‚Ñù) / i^2)]
          ¬∑ push_cast
            ring
          ¬∑ simp only [mem_Icc] at hk
            linarith
    -- We have
    -- (2 / j^2 - 2 / (n + 1)^2) * j^2 * a j = (2 - 2 * j^2 / (n + 1)^2) * a j < 2 * a j.
    _ < 2 * ‚àë i ‚àà Icc 1 n, a i := by
      rw [mul_sum]
      have h {k : ‚Ñï} (hk : k ‚àà Icc 1 n) : ((2 : ‚Ñù) / k^2 - 2 / (n + 1)^2) * k^2 * a k < 2 * a k := by
        rw [sub_mul, mul_lt_mul_right (ha k)]
        have hk0 : 0 < k := by
          simp only [mem_Icc] at hk
          linarith
        rw [div_mul_cancel‚ÇÄ _ (by norm_cast; nlinarith), sub_lt_self_iff]
        positivity
      apply sum_lt_sum
      ¬∑ intro k hk
        exact le_of_lt (h hk)
      ¬∑ use 1
        refine ‚ü®by simp; linarith, ?_‚ü©
        apply h
        simp
        linarith

soln_description:
## Solution

Taking the limit, we must have $\left(\mathrm{Ak}^{2}+\mathrm{Bk}+\mathrm{C}\right)=\mathrm{k}\left(\mathrm{ak}^{2}+\mathrm{bk}+\mathrm{c}\right)$, so $\mathrm{A}=\mathrm{b}, \mathrm{B}=\mathrm{c}, \mathrm{C}=2 \mathrm{a}$. Now notice that $\left(b x^{2}+c x+2 a\right)-k\left(a x^{2}+b x+c\right)=(b-a k) x^{2}+(c-b k) x+(2 a-c k)=(x-k)\left((b-a k) x+c-a k^{2}\right)$. So we require $\left|(b-a k) x+c-\mathrm{ak}^{2}\right|<\left|a x^{2}+b x+c\right|$ for all $x \geq 0$.

There are many ways to satisfy this. For example, take $\mathrm{a}=1, \mathrm{~b}=\mathrm{c}=2$. Then ( $\mathrm{b}-\mathrm{ak}) \mathrm{x}$ is always positive and less than $\mathrm{bx}$ for positive $\mathrm{x}$, and $\mathrm{c}-\mathrm{ak}^{2}$ is positive and less than $\mathrm{c}$.
informal_statement:
## Problem 4

Let $k$ be the real cube root of 2. Find integers A, B, C, a, b, c such that $\left|\left(A x^{2}+B x+C\right) /\left(a x^{2}+b x+c\right)-k\right|<\mid$ $\mathrm{x}-\mathrm{k} \mid$ for all non-negative rational $\mathrm{x}$.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

set_option linter.style.longLine true

/- ## Problem 4

Let $k$ be the real cube root of 2.
Find integers A, B, C, a, b, c such that
$\left|\left(A x^{2}+B x+C\right) /\left(a x^{2}+b x+c\right)-k\right|< \left| x- k \right|$
for all non-negative rational $x$.
 -/
theorem algebra_208751 (k : ‚Ñù) (hk : k^3 = 2) :
    ‚àÉ A B C a b c : ‚Ñ§, ‚àÄ (x : ‚Ñö), 0 ‚â§ x ‚Üí
      |(A * x^2 + B * x + C) / (a * x^2 + b * x + c) - k| < |x - k| := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

set_option linter.style.longLine true

/- ## Problem 4

Let $k$ be the real cube root of 2.
Find integers A, B, C, a, b, c such that
$\left|\left(A x^{2}+B x+C\right) /\left(a x^{2}+b x+c\right)-k\right|< \left| x- k \right|$
for all non-negative rational $x$.
 -/
theorem algebra_208751 (k : ‚Ñù) (hk : k^3 = 2) :
    ‚àÉ A B C a b c : ‚Ñ§, ‚àÄ (x : ‚Ñö), 0 ‚â§ x ‚Üí
      |(A * x^2 + B * x + C) / (a * x^2 + b * x + c) - k| < |x - k| := by
    let a : ‚Ñ§ := 1
    let b : ‚Ñ§ := 2
    let c : ‚Ñ§ := 2
    let A := b
    let B := c
    let C := 2 * a
    use A, B, C, a, b, c
    intro x x_nonneg
    field_simp [div_sub', C, a]
    rw [abs_div, div_lt_iff‚ÇÄ ?pos]
    -- We can factor out the term $(x - k)$
    have key := calc
      (b * x^2 + c * x + 2 * a) - k * (a * x^2 + b * x + c) =
        (b - a * k) * x^2 + (c - b * k) * x + (2 * a - c * k) := by ring
      _ = (x - k) * ((b - a * k) * x + c - a * k^2) := by
        ring_nf
        simp [hk]
        ring_nf
    have pos : 0 < (x : ‚Ñù) ^ 2 + ‚Üë2 * ‚Üëx + ‚Üë2 := by
      simp [(by ring : (x : ‚Ñù) ^ 2 + 2 * ‚Üëx + ‚Üë2 = (x + 1)^2 + 1)]
      nlinarith
    simp [A, B, C, a, b, c] at key ‚ä¢
    rw [mul_comm _ k, key, abs_mul, mul_lt_mul_left ?abs_pos]
    have two_ne_zero : ((2 : ‚Ñ§) : ‚Ñù) ‚â† 0 := by norm_num
    ¬∑ have k_lt_two : k < 2 := by nlinarith
      have k_pos : 0 < k := by nlinarith
      calc
      |(2 - k) * ‚Üëx + 2 - k ^ 2| = (2 - k) * ‚Üëx + 2 - k ^ 2 := by
        rw [abs_of_pos ?_]
        simp [sub_eq_add_neg, add_assoc]
        apply lt_add_of_le_of_pos
        ¬∑ apply mul_nonneg (by linarith) (Rat.cast_nonneg.mpr x_nonneg)
        ¬∑ nlinarith
      _ < ‚Üëx ^ 2 + 2 * ‚Üëx + 2 := by
        simp [sub_eq_add_neg, add_assoc]
        nth_rewrite 1 [‚Üê zero_add ((2 + -k) *x)]
        simp only [add_assoc]
        apply add_lt_add_of_le_of_lt (sq_nonneg _)
        apply add_lt_add_of_le_of_lt
        apply mul_le_mul (by linarith) (le_refl _) (Rat.cast_nonneg.mpr x_nonneg) (by norm_num)
        apply sub_lt_self
        nlinarith
      _ = |‚Üëx ^ 2 + 2 * ‚Üëx + 2| := by
        rw [abs_of_pos pos]
    -- We show that $|x - k| > 0$ by showing $x \ne k$ since $k $ is irrational
    ¬∑ have irrational_k : Irrational k := by
        apply @irrational_nrt_of_n_not_dvd_multiplicity k 3 2 (by norm_num) 2 _ (by simp [hk])
        simp [multiplicity_self]
      rw [abs_pos, sub_ne_zero]
      symm
      exact irrational_k.ne_rat x
    ¬∑ have pos : 0 < (x : ‚Ñù) ^ 2 + ‚Üë2 * ‚Üëx + ‚Üë2 := by
        have helper : (x + 1)^2 + 1 = (x : ‚Ñù) ^ 2 + 2 * ‚Üëx + ‚Üë2 := by ring
        simp [‚Üê helper]
        nlinarith
      rw [abs_of_pos]
      ¬∑ exact pos
      ¬∑ exact pos

informal_statement: The coefficients of the polynomial $P(x)$ are nonnegative integers, each less than 100 . Given that $P(10)=331633$ and $P(-10)=273373$, compute $P(1)$.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

theorem algebra_610096
    (P : Polynomial ‚Ñ§)
    (h_coeffs_nonneg : ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, 0 ‚â§ P.coeff n)
    (h_coeffs_lt_100 : ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, P.coeff n < 100)
    (hP10 : P.eval (10 : ‚Ñ§) = 331633)
    (hPneg10 : P.eval (-10 : ‚Ñ§) = 273373)
    : P.eval (1 : ‚Ñ§) = 100 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

theorem algebra_610096
    (P : Polynomial ‚Ñ§)
    (h_coeffs_nonneg : ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, 0 ‚â§ P.coeff n)
    (h_coeffs_lt_100 : ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, P.coeff n < 100)
    (hP10 : P.eval (10 : ‚Ñ§) = 331633)
    (hPneg10 : P.eval (-10 : ‚Ñ§) = 273373)
    : P.eval (1 : ‚Ñ§) = 100 := by

  -- Calculate S = P(10) + P(-10) and D = P(10) - P(-10)
  let S := P.eval 10 + P.eval (-10)
  let D := P.eval 10 - P.eval (-10)

  have hS : S / 2 = ‚àë i ‚àà Finset.range (P.natDegree + 1), (if Even i then P.coeff i * 10^i else 0) := by
    have hS_even : ‚àÄ i : ‚Ñï, Even i ‚Üí P.coeff i * 10 ^ i + P.coeff i * (-10) ^ i = 2 * P.coeff i * 10 ^ i := by
      intro i h_even
      have := Even.neg_pow h_even (-10)
      simp at this
      rw [‚Üêthis]
      linarith

    have hS_odd : ‚àÄ i : ‚Ñï, Odd i ‚Üí P.coeff i * 10 ^ i + P.coeff i * (-10) ^ i = 0 := by
      intro i h_odd
      have := Odd.neg_pow h_odd (-10)
      simp at this
      rw [this]
      linarith

    have : S = 2 * (‚àë i ‚àà Finset.range (P.natDegree + 1), (if Even i then P.coeff i * 10^i else 0)) := by
      rw [Finset.mul_sum]
      unfold S
      simp only [Polynomial.eval_eq_sum_range]
      rw [‚Üê Finset.sum_add_distrib, Finset.sum_congr rfl]
      intro x hx
      split_ifs with h_even
      . rw [hS_even x h_even]
        linarith
      . simp at h_even
        rw [hS_odd x h_even]
        linarith

    rw [this]
    simp

  have hD : D / 2 = ‚àë i ‚àà Finset.range (P.natDegree + 1), (if Odd i then P.coeff i * 10^i else 0) := by
    have hD_even : ‚àÄ i : ‚Ñï, Even i ‚Üí P.coeff i * 10 ^ i - P.coeff i * (-10) ^ i = 0 := by
      intro i h_even
      have := Even.neg_pow h_even (-10)
      simp at this
      rw [‚Üêthis]
      linarith

    have hD_odd : ‚àÄ i : ‚Ñï, Odd i ‚Üí P.coeff i * 10 ^ i - P.coeff i * (-10) ^ i = 2 * P.coeff i * 10 ^ i := by
      intro i h_odd
      have := Odd.neg_pow h_odd (-10)
      simp at this
      rw [this]
      linarith

    have : D = 2 * (‚àë i ‚àà Finset.range (P.natDegree + 1), (if Odd i then P.coeff i * 10^i else 0)) := by
      rw [Finset.mul_sum]
      unfold D
      simp only [Polynomial.eval_eq_sum_range]
      rw [‚Üê Finset.sum_sub_distrib, Finset.sum_congr rfl]
      intro x hx
      split_ifs with h_odd
      . rw [hD_odd x h_odd]
        linarith
      . simp at h_odd
        rw [hD_even x h_odd]
        linarith

    rw [this]
    simp

  have hS_ge : ‚àÄ i : ‚Ñï, S / 2 ‚â• (if Even i then P.coeff i * 10^i else 0) := by
    intro i
    by_cases h : P.natDegree < i
    . rw [Polynomial.coeff_eq_zero_of_natDegree_lt h]
      omega
    . push_neg at h
      rw [hS]
      have hf : ‚àÄ j ‚àà Finset.range (P.natDegree + 1), 0 ‚â§ (if Even j then P.coeff j * 10^j else 0) := by
        intro j hj
        split_ifs with h_even
        . apply mul_nonneg
          . apply h_coeffs_nonneg j
          . apply pow_nonneg (by positivity)
        . omega
      have ha : i ‚àà Finset.range (P.natDegree + 1) := by simp; omega
      exact Finset.single_le_sum hf ha

  have hD_ge : ‚àÄ i : ‚Ñï, D / 2 ‚â• (if Odd i then P.coeff i * 10^i else 0) := by
    intro i
    by_cases h : P.natDegree < i
    . rw [Polynomial.coeff_eq_zero_of_natDegree_lt h]
      omega
    . push_neg at h
      rw [hD]
      have hf : ‚àÄ j ‚àà Finset.range (P.natDegree + 1), 0 ‚â§ (if Odd j then P.coeff j * 10^j else 0) := by
        intro j hj
        split_ifs with h_odd
        . apply mul_nonneg
          . apply h_coeffs_nonneg j
          . apply pow_nonneg (by positivity)
        . omega
      have ha : i ‚àà Finset.range (P.natDegree + 1) := by simp; omega
      exact Finset.single_le_sum hf ha

  -- Prove that all even coefficients ‚â• 6 are zero
  have higher_even_coeffs_zero : ‚àÄ k : ‚Ñï, k ‚â• 3 ‚Üí P.coeff (2 * k) = 0 := by
    intro k hk
    by_contra h_pos
    push_neg at h_pos
    have : P.coeff (2 * k) >= 0 := h_coeffs_nonneg (2 * k)
    have : P.coeff (2 * k) >= 1 := by omega
    have : S / 2 >= P.coeff (2*k) * (10 ^ (2*k)) := by
      have := hS_ge (2*k)
      simp at this
      exact this
    have : 10 ^ (2*k) >= 10 ^ 6 := by
      apply Nat.pow_le_pow_right
      . positivity
      . omega
    have : S / 2 ‚â• 10 ^ 6 := by nlinarith
    omega

  have higher_odd_coeffs_zero : ‚àÄ k : ‚Ñï, k ‚â• 2 ‚Üí P.coeff (2 * k + 1) = 0 := by
    intro k hk
    by_contra h_pos
    push_neg at h_pos
    have : P.coeff (2 * k + 1) >= 0 := h_coeffs_nonneg (2 * k + 1)
    have : P.coeff (2 * k + 1) >= 1 := by omega
    have : D / 2 >= P.coeff (2*k+1) * (10 ^ (2*k+1)) := by
      have := hD_ge (2*k+1)
      simp at this
      exact this
    have : 10^(2*k+1)>=10^5 := by
      apply Nat.pow_le_pow_right
      . positivity
      . omega
    have : D / 2 >= 10^5 := by nlinarith
    omega

  have higher_coeffs_zero : ‚àÄ k : ‚Ñï, 5 ‚â§ k ‚Üí P.coeff k = 0 :=
    fun k hk => by
      -- Case analysis: k is either even or odd
      by_cases h : Even k
      ¬∑ -- Case: k is even (k = 2j for some j)
        -- Get the definition of evenness
        rcases h with ‚ü®j, hj‚ü©
        rw [hj, ‚Üê two_mul]
        -- Use higher_even_coeffs_zero
        apply higher_even_coeffs_zero j
        linarith
      ¬∑ -- Case: k is odd (k = 2j + 1 for some j)
        -- If k is not even, it's odd
        simp at h
        -- Express k in terms of j
        rcases h with ‚ü®j, hj‚ü©
        rw [hj]

        -- Use higher_odd_coeffs_zero
        apply higher_odd_coeffs_zero j
        linarith

  have hn: P.natDegree < 5 := by
    by_contra h_contra
    simp at h_contra
    have := higher_coeffs_zero P.natDegree h_contra
    simp at this
    have : P.eval 10 = 0 := by
      rw [this]
      simp
    linarith

  have : P.coeff 0 < 100 := h_coeffs_lt_100 0
  have : P.coeff 1 < 100 := h_coeffs_lt_100 1
  have : P.coeff 2 < 100 := h_coeffs_lt_100 2
  -- have : P.coeff 3 < 100 := h_coeffs_lt_100 3
  -- have : P.coeff 4 < 100 := h_coeffs_lt_100 4

  have : P.coeff 0 ‚â• 0 := h_coeffs_nonneg 0
  have : P.coeff 1 ‚â• 0 := h_coeffs_nonneg 1
  have : P.coeff 2 ‚â• 0 := h_coeffs_nonneg 2
  -- have : P.coeff 3 ‚â• 0 := h_coeffs_nonneg 3
  -- have : P.coeff 4 ‚â• 0 := h_coeffs_nonneg 4

  have h2: Even 2 := by simp
  have h2': ¬¨ Odd 2 := by simp
  have h3: Odd 3 := by exact odd_two_mul_add_one 1
  have h3': ¬¨ Even 3 := by simp; exact h3
  have h4: Even 4 := by exact even_two_mul 2
  have h4': ¬¨ Odd 4 := by simp; exact h4

  have hn4: P.natDegree = 4 := by
    by_contra h_contra
    simp at h_contra
    have : S / 2 <= ‚àë i ‚àà Finset.range (4), if Even i then P.coeff i * 10 ^ i else 0 := by
      rw [hS]
      have h : Finset.range (P.natDegree + 1) ‚äÜ Finset.range (4) := by simp; omega
      have hf : ‚àÄ i ‚àà Finset.range (4), i ‚àâ Finset.range (P.natDegree + 1) -> 0 ‚â§ (if Even i then P.coeff i * 10 ^ i else 0) := by
        intro i hi hi'
        split_ifs with h_even
        . have := h_coeffs_nonneg i
          positivity
        . omega
      exact Finset.sum_le_sum_of_subset_of_nonneg h hf

    repeat rw [Finset.sum_range_succ] at this
    simp [h3'] at this
    omega

  have : S/2 = P.coeff 0 + P.coeff 2 * 100 + P.coeff 4 * 10000 := by
    rw [hS, hn4]
    simp
    repeat rw [Finset.sum_range_succ]
    simp [h3, h4]

  have : D / 2 = P.coeff 1 * 10 + P.coeff 3 * 1000 := by
    rw [hD, hn4]
    simp
    repeat rw [Finset.sum_range_succ]
    simp [h2', h3, h4]

  have : D / 20 = P.coeff 1 + P.coeff 3 * 100 := by omega

  have hc0 : P.coeff 0 = 3 := by omega
  have hc1 : P.coeff 1 = 13 := by omega
  have hc2 : P.coeff 2 = 25 := by omega
  have hc3 : P.coeff 3 = 29 := by omega
  have hc4 : P.coeff 4 = 30 := by omega

  -- Now we know that P(x) = 3 + 13x + 25x¬≤ + 29x¬≥ + 30x‚Å¥
  -- Compute P(1) by summing all coefficients
  have h_P_expr : P.eval 1 = P.coeff 0 + P.coeff 1 + P.coeff 2 + P.coeff 3 + P.coeff 4 := by
    rw [Polynomial.eval_eq_sum_range' hn]
    have h_mul_one : ‚àÄ i ‚àà Finset.range (5), P.coeff i * 1 ^ i = P.coeff i := by
      intro i hi
      rw [one_pow, mul_one]
    rw [Finset.sum_congr rfl h_mul_one]
    simp [Finset.sum_range_succ]

  -- Calculate the sum
  have h_sum : P.coeff 0 + P.coeff 1 + P.coeff 2 + P.coeff 3 + P.coeff 4 = 100 := by
    rw [hc0, hc1, hc2, hc3, hc4]
    norm_num

  -- Conclude the proof
  rw [h_P_expr, h_sum]

soln_description: The prime number $r$ that satisfies the condition is only one, which is 5. In fact, the sum and difference of two odd primes are even numbers, so $r=p+2=q-2$, where $p$ and $q$ are odd primes. Thus, $p, r=p+2, q=r+2$ are three consecutive odd primes. At this point, there is only one unique set: $3,5,7$ (since among any two consecutive odd numbers, one must be divisible by 3). Therefore, $r=5=3+2=7-2$.
informal_statement: 14.4.27 ** Find all prime numbers that can be expressed both as the sum of two prime numbers and as the difference of two prime numbers.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

/-
14.4.27 ** Find all prime numbers that can be expressed both as the sum of two prime numbers and as the difference of two prime numbers.
-/

theorem number_theory_212714 (p : ‚Ñï) (hp : p.Prime): 
(‚àÉa:‚Ñï, ‚àÉb:‚Ñï, (a.Prime ‚àß b.Prime ‚àß p = a + b)) ‚àß (‚àÉc:‚Ñï, ‚àÉd:‚Ñï, (c.Prime ‚àß d.Prime ‚àß p = c- d)) 
‚Üî  
p = 5 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

/-
14.4.27 ** Find all prime numbers that can be expressed both as the sum of two prime numbers and as the difference of two prime numbers.
-/

theorem number_theory_212714 (p : ‚Ñï) (hp : p.Prime): 
(‚àÉa:‚Ñï, ‚àÉb:‚Ñï, (a.Prime ‚àß b.Prime ‚àß p = a + b)) ‚àß (‚àÉc:‚Ñï, ‚àÉd:‚Ñï, (c.Prime ‚àß d.Prime ‚àß p = c- d)) 
‚Üî  
p = 5 := by
  
  constructor
  
  --From left to right.
  intro ‚ü®h1,h2‚ü© 

  obtain ‚ü®a,b,ap,bp,hab‚ü© := h1
  --Wlog we can assume that a ‚â§ b.
  wlog aleb : a ‚â§ b
  have blea: b ‚â§ a := by omega
  apply this
  exact hp
  exact h2
  exact bp
  exact ap
  omega
  exact blea

  --We have a = 2 by checking the parity and a and b.
  have ae : a = 2 := by 
    by_contra anne2
    have : 2 ‚â§ a := by exact Nat.Prime.two_le ap
    have : 2 < a := by omega
    have : 2 < b := by omega
    have : ¬¨ b = 2 := by omega
    have oa : Odd a := by exact Nat.Prime.odd_of_ne_two ap anne2
    have ob : Odd b := by exact Nat.Prime.odd_of_ne_two bp this
    have : Even p := by
      have : Even (a+b) := by exact Odd.add_odd oa ob
      rw [‚Üê hab] at this
      exact this
    have : p = 2 := by exact (Nat.Prime.even_iff hp).mp this
    omega

  obtain ‚ü®c,d,cp,dp,hcd‚ü© := h2
  --We have d = 2 by checking the parity and c and d.
  have de : d = 2 := by 
    by_contra dne2
    have : 2 ‚â§ d := by exact Nat.Prime.two_le dp
    have : 2 < d := by omega
    have : 2 < c := by omega
    have : ¬¨ c=2 := by omega
    have oc : Odd c := by exact Nat.Prime.odd_of_ne_two cp this
    have od : Odd d := by exact Nat.Prime.odd_of_ne_two dp dne2
    have : Even p := by 
      have : Even (c-d) := by exact Nat.Odd.sub_odd oc od
      rw [‚Üê hcd] at this
      exact this
    have : p = 2 := by exact (Nat.Prime.even_iff hp).mp this
    omega
  
  rw [ae] at hab
  rw [de] at hcd

  rw [add_comm] at hab
  have cebp4: c = b + 4 := by omega

  --Then, b, b+2, b+4 are all prime numbers. The only possibilities is b = 3.
  have be : b = 3 := by 
    
    by_cases bm1 : b % 3 = 1
    have : (b+2)%3 = 0 := by omega
    rw [‚Üêhab] at this
    have d3p: 3 ‚à£ p := by exact Nat.dvd_of_mod_eq_zero this
    have pe: p = 3 := by rw [Nat.Prime.dvd_iff_eq] at d3p; exact d3p; exact hp; norm_num
    rw [pe] at hab
    have : b = 1 := by linarith
    rw [this] at bp
    norm_num at bp

    by_cases bm2 : b % 3 = 2
    have : (b+4)%3 = 0 := by omega
    rw [‚Üê cebp4] at this
    have d3c : 3 ‚à£ c := by exact Nat.dvd_of_mod_eq_zero this
    have ce : c = 3 := by 
      rw [Nat.Prime.dvd_iff_eq] at d3c
      exact d3c
      exact cp
      norm_num
    have : p = 1 := by linarith
    rw [this] at hp
    norm_num at hp

    have b3d : b % 3 = 0 := by omega
    have : 3 ‚à£ b := by exact Nat.dvd_of_mod_eq_zero b3d
    have : b = 3 := by 
      rw [Nat.Prime.dvd_iff_eq] at this; 
      exact this
      exact bp
      norm_num
    assumption
  
  linarith

  --From right to left
  --Just let a=2, b=3, c=7, d=2.
  intro pe
  constructor
  use 2,3
  simp [pe]
  norm_num
  use 7,2
  simp [pe]
  norm_num

informal_statement:
Given that $x$ is a positive real, find the maximum possible value of

$$
\sin \left(\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{x}{9}\right)-\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{x}{16}\right)\right)
$$
formal_statement:
import Mathlib
open Real Set

/-Given that $x$ is a positive real, find the maximum possible value of

$$
\sin \left(\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{x}{9}\right)-\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{x}{16}\right)\right)
$$-/
theorem algebra_609823 : IsGreatest {y : ‚Ñù | ‚àÉ x : ‚Ñù, 0 < x ‚àß y = sin (arctan (x / 9) - arctan (x / 16))} (7 / 25) := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib
open Real Set

/-Given that $x$ is a positive real, find the maximum possible value of

$$
\sin \left(\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{x}{9}\right)-\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{x}{16}\right)\right)
$$-/
theorem algebra_609823 : IsGreatest {y : ‚Ñù | ‚àÉ x : ‚Ñù, 0 < x ‚àß y = sin (arctan (x / 9) - arctan (x / 16))} (7 / 25) := by
  constructor
  ¬∑ -- When x = 12, the value is 7/25
    simp only [mem_setOf_eq]
    use 12
    field_simp [Nat.ofNat_pos, true_and, sin_sub, sin_arctan, cos_arctan]
    rw [show (9 ^ 2 + 12 ^ 2 : ‚Ñù) = 15 ^ 2 by norm_num, show (16 ^ 2 + 12 ^ 2 : ‚Ñù) = 20 ^ 2 by norm_num]
    simp only [Nat.ofNat_nonneg, sqrt_sq]
    ring_nf
  ¬∑ rintro _ ‚ü®x, hx‚ÇÅ, rfl‚ü©
    field_simp [sin_sub, sin_arctan, cos_arctan, div_le_div_iff‚ÇÄ]
    suffices 25 * x ‚â§ ‚àö(9 ^ 2 + x ^ 2) * ‚àö(16 ^ 2 + x ^ 2) by linarith
    rw [‚Üêsqrt_mul (by positivity), le_sqrt (by positivity) (by positivity)]
    linarith [sq_nonneg (x^2 - 144)]

soln_description:
The third property implies that the function $f$ is symmetric, meaning it takes the same value for any permutation of the variables $x, y, z$.

Thus, for any real number $d$,

$$
f(-d, 0, d)=f(d, 0, -d)
$$

On the other hand, applying the second property for $t=-1$,

$$
f(-d, 0, d)=-f(d, 0, -d)
$$

Comparing the two results,

$$
f(-d, 0, d)=0.
$$

Using the first property, we finally get

$$
f(2000, 2001, 2002)=2001+f(-1, 0, 1)=2001.
$$

Remarks. 1. Similarly, it can be shown that if $x, y$, and $z$ are consecutive terms of an arithmetic sequence such that $y=\frac{x+z}{2}$, then $f(x, y, z)=y$.

2. A function with the properties given in the problem exists, for example, $f(x, y, z)=\frac{x+y+z}{3}$. However, it is not true that the given properties are satisfied only by this function. R√°cz B√©la Andr√°s (Fazekas M. F≈ëv. Gyak. Gimn.) found infinitely many such functions. It is easy to verify that for any real $a$, the following functions have the given properties:

$$
f(x, y, z)=\frac{x+y+z}{3}, \text{ if } x, y, z \text{ are not equal; } ax+(1-a)z, \text{ if } x=y; ay+(1-a)x, \text{ if } y=z; az+(1-a)y, \text{ if } x=z.
$$
informal_statement:
For the function $\mathrm{Az} f(x, y, z)$, it holds for any real number $t$ that

$$
f(x+t, y+t, z+t)=t+f(x, y, z) ; f(t x, t y, t z)=t f(x, y, z) ; f(x, y, z)=f(y, x, z)=f(x, z, y)
$$

What is $f(2000,2001,2002) ?$
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

/- For the function $\mathrm{Az} f(x, y, z)$, it holds for any real number $t$ that

$$
f(x+t, y+t, z+t)=t+f(x, y, z) ; f(t x, t y, t z)=t f(x, y, z) ; f(x, y, z)=f(y, x, z)=f(x, z, y)
$$

What is $f(2000,2001,2002) ?$ -/
theorem algebra_208283 (f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù)
    (h‚ÇÄ : ‚àÄ x y z t, f (x + t) (y + t) (z + t) = t + f x y z)
    (h‚ÇÅ : ‚àÄ x y z t, f (t * x) (t * y) (t * z) = t * f x y z)
    (h‚ÇÇ : ‚àÄ x y z, f x y z = f y x z) (h‚ÇÉ : ‚àÄ y x z, f y x z = f x z y) :
    f 2000 2001 2002 = 2001 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

theorem algebra_208283 (f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù)
    (h‚ÇÄ : ‚àÄ x y z t, f (x + t) (y + t) (z + t) = t + f x y z)
    (h‚ÇÅ : ‚àÄ x y z t, f (t * x) (t * y) (t * z) = t * f x y z)
    (h‚ÇÇ : ‚àÄ x y z, f x y z = f y x z) (h‚ÇÉ : ‚àÄ y x z, f y x z = f x z y) :
    f 2000 2001 2002 = 2001 := by 
  have h4 : f 0 0 0 = 0 := by 
    specialize h‚ÇÅ 0 0 0 (0 : ‚Ñù)
    norm_num at h‚ÇÅ 
    linarith
  -- Calculate f 1 1 1 
  have h5 : f 1 1 1 = 1 := by 
    specialize h‚ÇÄ 0 0 0 (1 : ‚Ñù)
    norm_num [h4] at h‚ÇÄ 
    linarith 
  have eq1 : f (-1 : ‚Ñù) (0 : ‚Ñù) (1 : ‚Ñù) = -1 + f 0 1 2 := by 
    specialize h‚ÇÄ 0 1 2 (-1)
    norm_num at h‚ÇÄ 
    linarith 
  have eq2 : f 1 (0 : ‚Ñù) (-1 : ‚Ñù) = - f (-1 : ‚Ñù) (0 : ‚Ñù) (1 : ‚Ñù) := by 
    specialize h‚ÇÅ (-1 : ‚Ñù) (0 : ‚Ñù) (1 : ‚Ñù) (-1 : ‚Ñù)
    norm_num at h‚ÇÅ 
    linarith 
  have eq3 : f 1 (0 : ‚Ñù) (-1 : ‚Ñù) = f (-1 : ‚Ñù) (0 : ‚Ñù) (1 : ‚Ñù) := by 
    have h8 : f 1 (0 : ‚Ñù) (-1 : ‚Ñù) = f 0 1 (-1 : ‚Ñù) := by 
      specialize h‚ÇÇ 1 (0 : ‚Ñù) (-1 : ‚Ñù)
      linarith 
    have h9 : f 0 1 (-1 : ‚Ñù) = f (-1 : ‚Ñù) (0 : ‚Ñù) (1 : ‚Ñù) := by 
      have h11 : f 0 1 (-1 : ‚Ñù) = f 1 0 (-1 : ‚Ñù) := by 
        specialize h‚ÇÇ 0 1 (-1 : ‚Ñù)
        linarith 
      have h12 : f 1 0 (-1 : ‚Ñù) = f (-1 : ‚Ñù) (0 : ‚Ñù) (1 : ‚Ñù) := by 
        have h13 : f 1 (0 : ‚Ñù) (-1 : ‚Ñù) = f 0 (-1 : ‚Ñù) (1 : ‚Ñù) := by 
          specialize h‚ÇÉ 1 (0 : ‚Ñù) (-1 : ‚Ñù) 
          linarith 
        have h14 : f 0 (-1 : ‚Ñù) (1 : ‚Ñù) = f (-1 : ‚Ñù) (0 : ‚Ñù) (1 : ‚Ñù) := by 
          specialize h‚ÇÇ 0 (-1 : ‚Ñù) (1 : ‚Ñù)
          linarith 
        linarith [h13, h14]
      linarith [h11, h12]
    linarith 
  -- Now using eq1 eq3 eq2, solving equaions, getting eq4 
  have eq4 : f (-1 : ‚Ñù) (0 : ‚Ñù) (1 : ‚Ñù) = 0 := by 
    linarith [eq1, eq2, eq3]
  -- Solving f 0 1 2 = 1 
  have h11 : f 0 1 2 = 1 := by 
    linarith [eq1, eq4]
  -- Calculate $f(2000, 2001, 2002) = 2000 +1 =2001$. 
  have h12 : f 2000 2001 2002 = 2000 + f 0 1 2 := by 
    specialize h‚ÇÄ 0 1 2 (2000 : ‚Ñù)
    norm_num at h‚ÇÄ 
    linarith 
  -- Substitute h11 into h12, getting the final result 
  linarith [h12, h11]

informal_statement: Let $a_{1}, a_{2}, \ldots$ be an arithmetic sequence and $b_{1}, b_{2}, \ldots$ be a geometric sequence. Suppose that $a_{1} b_{1}=20$, $a_{2} b_{2}=19$, and $a_{3} b_{3}=14$. Find the greatest possible value of $a_{4} b_{4}$.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

/-
Let $a_{1}, a_{2}, \ldots$ be an arithmetic sequence and
$b_{1}, b_{2}, \ldots$ be a geometric sequence.
Suppose that $a_{1} b_{1}=20$, $a_{2} b_{2}=19$, and $a_{3} b_{3}=14$.
Find the greatest possible value of $a_{4} b_{4}$.
-/
theorem algebra_609947 (a : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñö) (b : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñö)
    (ha : ‚àÉ c d : ‚Ñö, c ‚â† 0 ‚àß d ‚â† 0 ‚àß ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, (a n) = c + n*d) -- $a_n$ is arithmetic
    (hb : ‚àÉ e r : ‚Ñö, e ‚â† 0 ‚àß r ‚â† 0 ‚àß ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, (b n) = e * r^n) -- $b_n$ is geometric
    (h0 : (a 0) * (b 0) = 20) -- Formalization uses zero-indexed sequences
    (h1 : (a 1) * (b 1) = 19)
    (h2 : (a 2) * (b 2) = 14)
  : (a 3) * (b 3) ‚â§ 37 / 4 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

/-
Let $a_{1}, a_{2}, \ldots$ be an arithmetic sequence and
$b_{1}, b_{2}, \ldots$ be a geometric sequence.
Suppose that $a_{1} b_{1}=20$, $a_{2} b_{2}=19$, and $a_{3} b_{3}=14$.
Find the greatest possible value of $a_{4} b_{4}$.
-/
theorem algebra_609947 (a : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñö) (b : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñö)
    (ha : ‚àÉ c d : ‚Ñö, c ‚â† 0 ‚àß d ‚â† 0 ‚àß ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, (a n) = c + n*d) -- $a_n$ is arithmetic
    (hb : ‚àÉ e r : ‚Ñö, e ‚â† 0 ‚àß r ‚â† 0 ‚àß ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, (b n) = e * r^n) -- $b_n$ is geometric
    (h0 : (a 0) * (b 0) = 20) -- Formalization uses zero-indexed sequences
    (h1 : (a 1) * (b 1) = 19)
    (h2 : (a 2) * (b 2) = 14)
  : (a 3) * (b 3) ‚â§ 37 / 4 := by
  -- Unfold the definitions of arithmetic and geometric sequence.
  obtain ‚ü®c, d, cnz, dnz, an_eqn‚ü© := ha
  obtain ‚ü®e, r, enz, rnz, bn_eqn‚ü© := hb

  -- By using the first equation $a_0b_0 = 20$ we can get $ce = 20$.
  have a0c  : a 0   = c  := by simp [an_eqn 0]
  have b0e  : b 0   = e  := by simp [bn_eqn 0]
  have ce20 : c * e = 20 := by simp [a0c, b0e] at h0; exact h0

  -- Using the second equation $a_1b_1 = 19$ we can get $(c+d)er = 19$.
  have a1 : a 1 = c + d := by simp [an_eqn 1]
  have b1 : b 1 = e * r := by simp [bn_eqn 1]
  have cder19 : (c + d) * (e * r) = 19 := by simp [a1, b1] at h1; exact h1

  -- Now we solve for $c$ in the first, then substitute that into the second.
  have c20e : c = 20 / e := (eq_div_iff_mul_eq enz).mpr ce20

  -- Substitute:
  have eqn1 : (20 / e + d) * (e * r)     = 19 := by rw [c20e] at cder19; exact cder19
  have eqn2 : ((20 / e + d) * e) * r     = 19 := by linarith
  have eqn3 : ((20 / e) * e + d * e) * r = 19 := by linarith
  have eqn4 : (20 + d * e) * r           = 19 := by simp_all
  have eqn5 : 20 * r + d * e * r         = 19 := by linarith
  have eqn6 : d * e * r = 19 - 20 * r         := by linarith

  -- Using the third equation $a_2b_2 = 14$, we obtain a quadratic in $r$.
  -- We eliminate other terms by replacing $(c + d)er = 19$ and $der = 19 - 20r$.
  -- We factor the quadratic and solve for $r$, which gets us two values.
  have a2    : a 2 = c + 2 * d := by simp [an_eqn 2]
  have b2    : b 2 = e * r^2   := by simp [bn_eqn 2]
  have eqn7  : (c + 2 * d) * (e * r^2)   = 14 := by simp [a2, b2] at h2; exact h2
  have eqn8  : (c + d + d) * (e * r) * r = 14 := by linarith
  have eqn9  : ((c+d)*(e*r)+(d*e*r))*r   = 14 := by linarith
  have eqn10 : (19 + (d * e * r)) * r    = 14 := by rw [cder19] at eqn9; exact eqn9
  have eqn11 : (19 + (19 - 20 * r)) * r  = 14 := by rw [eqn6] at eqn10; exact eqn10
  have eqn12 : 38 * r - 20 * r * r       = 14 := by linarith
  have eqn13 : 10 * r * r - 19 * r + 7   = 0  := by linarith -- cancel the 2
  have eqn14 : (2 * r - 1) * (5 * r - 7) = 0  := by linarith -- factor
  have eqn15 : 2 * r - 1 = 0 ‚à® 5 * r - 7 = 0  := mul_eq_zero.mp eqn14
  have r_roots : r = 1/2 ‚à® r = 7/5            := by
    rcases eqn15 with h | h
    . left ; linarith
    . right; linarith

  -- Now we calculate $a_3b_3$ and use the roots of $r$ and $de$ from above.
  have a3 : a 3 = c + 3 * d := an_eqn 3
  have b3 : b 3 = e * r^3   := bn_eqn 3
  have a3b3 : (a 3) * (b 3) = 57 * r^2 - 40 * r^3 := by
    calc (a 3) * (b 3)
      _ = (c + 3 * d) * (e * r^3)                     := by simp [a3, b3]
      _ = (c + 3 * d) * (e * r) * r^2                 := by linarith
      _ = ((c + d) + 2 * d) * (e * r) * r^2           := by linarith
      _ = ((c + d) * (e * r) + 2 * d * (e * r)) * r^2 := by linarith
      _ = (19 + 2 * (d * e * r)) * r^2                := by rw [cder19]; ring
      _ = (19 + 2 * (19 - 20 * r)) * r^2              := by rw [eqn6]
      _ = (57 - 40 * r) * r^2                         := by linarith
      _ = 57 * r^2 - 40 * r^3                         := by linarith

  -- Using above equation $a_3b_3 = 57r^2 - 40r^3$ and possible values of $r$,
  -- we get the two possible values of $a_3b_3$:
  have possible_values : (a 3) * (b 3) = 37/4 ‚à® (a 3) * (b 3) = 49/25 := by
    rcases r_roots with h | h
    . left ; rw [h] at a3b3; group at a3b3; exact a3b3
    . right; rw [h] at a3b3; group at a3b3; exact a3b3

  -- It is easy to show that 49/25 < 37/4, so the max value is 37/4.
  rcases possible_values with h | h <;> linarith

soln_description:
30.9. 919
Let $a b c$ be a three-digit number such that difference between the number and the sum of its digits is a perfect square; that is,
$$
(100 a+10 b+c)-(a+b+c)=99 a+9 b=9(11 a+b)
$$
is a perfect square. To maximize the number $100 a+10 b+c$, we set $a=9, b=1$, and $c=9$.
informal_statement: 30.9. Find the largest three-digit number such that the number minus the sum of its digits is a perfect square.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

/- if n is a number of three digits, then its digits is as follows -/
lemma l_digits_three_digit_number {n:‚Ñï} (nge: n ‚â• 100) (nle: n ‚â§ 999):
  Nat.digits 10 n = [n % 10, (n / 10 % 10), n / 100] := by
  have h1: 1 < 10 := by norm_num
  have h2: 0 < n := by linarith only [nge]
  have h3: 0 < n / 10 := by
    refine Nat.div_pos ?_ (by norm_num)
    linarith only [nge]
  have h4: 0 < n / 10 / 10 := by
    rw [Nat.div_div_eq_div_mul]
    refine Nat.div_pos ?_ (by norm_num)
    linarith only [nge]
  have h5: n / 10 / 10 / 10 = 0 := by
    simp only [Nat.div_div_eq_div_mul]
    refine Nat.div_eq_of_lt ?_
    exact Order.lt_add_one_iff.mpr nle
  rw [Nat.digits_def' h1 h2,
  Nat.digits_def' h1 h3, Nat.digits_def' h1 h4,
  h5, Nat.div_div_eq_div_mul]
  simp only [Nat.reduceMul, Nat.reduceLeDiff, Nat.digits_zero,
  List.cons.injEq, Nat.mod_succ_eq_iff_lt, Nat.succ_eq_add_one,
  Nat.reduceAdd, and_true, true_and, gt_iff_lt]
  refine Nat.div_lt_of_lt_mul ?_
  exact Order.lt_add_one_iff.mpr nle


/- 30.9. Find the largest three-digit number such that
the number minus the sum of its digits is a perfect square. -/
theorem number_theory_214653:
  IsGreatest {n:‚Ñï | n ‚àà Finset.Icc 100 999 ‚àß
    IsSquare (n - (Nat.digits 10 n).sum)} 919 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

/- if n is a number of three digits, then its digits is as follows -/
lemma l_digits_three_digit_number {n:‚Ñï} (nge: n ‚â• 100) (nle: n ‚â§ 999):
  Nat.digits 10 n = [n % 10, (n / 10 % 10), n / 100] := by
  have h1: 1 < 10 := by norm_num
  have h2: 0 < n := by linarith only [nge]
  have h3: 0 < n / 10 := by
    refine Nat.div_pos ?_ (by norm_num)
    linarith only [nge]
  have h4: 0 < n / 10 / 10 := by
    rw [Nat.div_div_eq_div_mul]
    refine Nat.div_pos ?_ (by norm_num)
    linarith only [nge]
  have h5: n / 10 / 10 / 10 = 0 := by
    simp only [Nat.div_div_eq_div_mul]
    refine Nat.div_eq_of_lt ?_
    exact Order.lt_add_one_iff.mpr nle
  rw [Nat.digits_def' h1 h2,
  Nat.digits_def' h1 h3, Nat.digits_def' h1 h4,
  h5, Nat.div_div_eq_div_mul]
  simp only [Nat.reduceMul, Nat.reduceLeDiff, Nat.digits_zero,
  List.cons.injEq, Nat.mod_succ_eq_iff_lt, Nat.succ_eq_add_one,
  Nat.reduceAdd, and_true, true_and, gt_iff_lt]
  refine Nat.div_lt_of_lt_mul ?_
  exact Order.lt_add_one_iff.mpr nle


/- 30.9. Find the largest three-digit number such that
the number minus the sum of its digits is a perfect square. -/
theorem number_theory_214653:
  IsGreatest {n:‚Ñï | n ‚àà Finset.Icc 100 999 ‚àß
    IsSquare (n - (Nat.digits 10 n).sum)} 919 := by

  rw [IsGreatest, upperBounds]
  constructor

  ¬∑ -- verify 919 satisfy the condition
    have: IsSquare 900 := by
      use 30
    simp [this]

  ¬∑ -- prove 919 is an upper bound.
    simp only [Finset.mem_Icc, Nat.reduceLeDiff,
    Set.mem_setOf_eq, and_imp]
    intro n nge nle hsq

    -- consider digits of n.
    have h1 := l_digits_three_digit_number nge nle
    have h2: n = 100 * (n/100) + 10 * (n/10 % 10) + n % 10 := by
      nth_rw 1 [‚Üê Nat.ofDigits_digits 10 n, h1]
      simp only [Nat.ofDigits, Nat.cast_id, mul_zero, add_zero]
      ring
    -- each digit ‚â§ 9
    have h3: n % 10 < 10 := Nat.mod_lt n (by norm_num)
    have h4: n / 10 % 10 < 10 := Nat.mod_lt _ (by norm_num)
    replace h3: n % 10 ‚â§ 9 := Order.lt_add_one_iff.mp h3
    replace h4: n / 10 % 10 ‚â§ 9 := Order.lt_add_one_iff.mp h4

    -- if hundreds-digit is not 9, then n obviously < 900 < 919.
    by_cases h5: n / 100 ‚â† 9
    ¬∑ have: n / 100 < 10 := by
        refine Nat.div_lt_of_lt_mul ?_
        exact Order.lt_add_one_iff.mpr nle
      replace: n / 100 ‚â§ 9 := Order.lt_add_one_iff.mp this
      replace := lt_of_le_of_ne this h5
      replace: n / 100 ‚â§ 8 := Order.lt_add_one_iff.mp this
      rw [h2]
      linarith only [h3, h4, this]
    push_neg at h5

    -- then fix hundreds_digit is 9, consider n - digits-sum is square
    -- (100a+10b+c) - (a+b+c) = 9 (11a+b)
    have h6: n - (Nat.digits 10 n).sum =
      9 * (11* (n/100) + (n/10 % 10)) := by
      nth_rw 1 [h2]
      refine (Nat.eq_sub_of_add_eq ?_).symm
      simp only [h1, List.sum_cons, List.sum_nil, add_zero]
      ring
    rw [h6, h5] at hsq

    -- 9 (99 + n/10 % 10) is square.
    -- 9 is square, so 99 + n/10 % 10 = 99,100,101,...,108 must be square.
    -- only possible answer is 100, or, n/10%10 = 1.
    replace hsq: n / 10 % 10 = 1 := by
      generalize (n / 10 % 10) = k at h4 hsq ‚ä¢
      clear * - hsq h4
      revert hsq
      native_decide +revert

    -- then max of last digit is 9, n ‚â§ 919.
    rw [h2, hsq, h5]
    linarith only [h3]

informal_statement: There is a unique quadruple of positive integers $(a, b, c, k)$ such that $c$ is not a perfect square and $a+\sqrt{b+\sqrt{c}}$ is a root of the polynomial $x^{4}-20 x^{3}+108 x^{2}-k x+9$. Compute $c$.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

-- we write the verification of the root as a lemma
lemma lemma_1: (5 + ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7)) ^ 4 - 20 * (5 + ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7)) ^ 3 +
  108 * (5 + ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7)) ^ 2 - 80 * (5 + ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7)) + 9 = 0 := by
      
      ring_nf
      have o1: ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7) ^ 2 = 21 + ‚àö7 := by
        symm
        rw [‚Üê Real.sqrt_eq_iff_eq_sq]
        have o: 0 ‚â§ ‚àö7 := by
          apply Real.sqrt_nonneg
        nlinarith
        apply Real.sqrt_nonneg
      rw [show ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7) ^ 4 = (‚àö(21 + ‚àö7) ^ 2) ^ 2 by ring]
      simp [o1]
      clear o1
      ring_nf
      have o2: ‚àö7 ^ 2 = 7 := by
        symm
        rw [‚Üê Real.sqrt_eq_iff_eq_sq]
        norm_num
        apply Real.sqrt_nonneg
      simp [o2] 

/-There is a unique quadruple of positive integers
(a,b,c,k) such that c is not a perfect square and
a + ‚àö(b + ‚àöc) is a root of the polynomial
x ^ 4 - 20 x ^ 3 + 108 x ^ 2 -kx + 9. Compute c.-/

theorem algebra_610663 (a b c k: ‚Ñ§)
(h: ‚àÄ a' b' c' k': ‚Ñ§, 0 < a' ‚àß 0 < b' ‚àß 0 < c' ‚àß 0 < k' ‚àß ¬¨ IsSquare c' ‚àß
  (a' + ‚àö(b' + ‚àöc')) ^ 4 - 20 * (a' + ‚àö(b' + ‚àöc')) ^ 3 + 108 * (a' + ‚àö(b' + ‚àöc')) ^ 2 - k' * (a' + ‚àö(b' + ‚àöc')) + 9 = 0 ‚Üí
  a = a' ‚àß b = b' ‚àß c = c' ‚àß k = k') : c = 7 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

-- we write the verification of the root as a lemma
lemma lemma_1: (5 + ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7)) ^ 4 - 20 * (5 + ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7)) ^ 3 +
  108 * (5 + ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7)) ^ 2 - 80 * (5 + ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7)) + 9 = 0 := by
      
      ring_nf
      have o1: ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7) ^ 2 = 21 + ‚àö7 := by
        symm
        rw [‚Üê Real.sqrt_eq_iff_eq_sq]
        have o: 0 ‚â§ ‚àö7 := by
          apply Real.sqrt_nonneg
        nlinarith
        apply Real.sqrt_nonneg
      rw [show ‚àö(21 + ‚àö7) ^ 4 = (‚àö(21 + ‚àö7) ^ 2) ^ 2 by ring]
      simp [o1]
      clear o1
      ring_nf
      have o2: ‚àö7 ^ 2 = 7 := by
        symm
        rw [‚Üê Real.sqrt_eq_iff_eq_sq]
        norm_num
        apply Real.sqrt_nonneg
      simp [o2] 

/-There is a unique quadruple of positive integers
(a,b,c,k) such that c is not a perfect square and
a + ‚àö(b + ‚àöc) is a root of the polynomial
x ^ 4 - 20 x ^ 3 + 108 x ^ 2 -kx + 9. Compute c.-/

theorem algebra_610663 (a b c k: ‚Ñ§)
(h: ‚àÄ a' b' c' k': ‚Ñ§, 0 < a' ‚àß 0 < b' ‚àß 0 < c' ‚àß 0 < k' ‚àß ¬¨ IsSquare c' ‚àß
  (a' + ‚àö(b' + ‚àöc')) ^ 4 - 20 * (a' + ‚àö(b' + ‚àöc')) ^ 3 + 108 * (a' + ‚àö(b' + ‚àöc')) ^ 2 - k' * (a' + ‚àö(b' + ‚àöc')) + 9 = 0 ‚Üí
  a = a' ‚àß b = b' ‚àß c = c' ‚àß k = k') : c = 7 := by

  set a':= (5: ‚Ñ§)
  set b':= (21: ‚Ñ§)
  set c':= (7: ‚Ñ§)
  set k':= (80: ‚Ñ§)
  have u: a = a' ‚àß b = b' ‚àß c = c' ‚àß k = k':= by
    specialize h a' b' c' k'
    apply h
    simp [a', b', c', k']
    clear *-
    constructor
    .
      native_decide
    .
      exact lemma_1

  simp [u]

soln_description: Suppose the conclusion is false. This means that for every $K \in\{1,2, \ldots, n\}$, there exists a $k \leq K$ such that the arithmetic mean of $x_{k}, x_{k+1}, \ldots, x_{K}$ exceeds $X$. We now define a decreasing sequence $b_{1} \geq a_{1}>a_{1}-1=b_{2} \geq a_{2}>\cdots$ as follows: Put $b_{1}=n$, and for each $i$, let $a_{i}$ be the largest largest $k \leq b_{i}$ such that the arithmetic mean of $x_{a_{i}}, \ldots, x_{b_{i}}$ exceeds $X$; then put $b_{i+1}=a_{i}-1$ and repeat. Clearly for some $m, a_{m}=1$. Now, by construction, each of the sets $\left\{x_{a_{m}}, \ldots, x_{b_{m}}\right\},\left\{x_{a_{m-1}}, \ldots, x_{b_{m-1}}\right\}, \ldots,\left\{x_{a_{1}}, \ldots, x_{b_{1}}\right\}$ has arithmetic mean strictly greater than $X$, but then the union $\left\{x_{1}, x_{2}, \ldots, x_{n}\right\}$ of these sets has arithmetic mean strictly greater than $X$; a contradiction.
informal_statement: Let $x_{1}, x_{2}, \ldots, x_{n}$ be real numbers with arithmetic mean $X$. Prove that there is a positive integer $K$ such that the arithmetic mean of each of the lists $\left\{x_{1}, x_{2}, \ldots, x_{K}\right\},\left\{x_{2}, x_{3}, \ldots, x_{K}\right\}$, $\ldots,\left\{x_{K-1}, x_{K}\right\},\left\{x_{K}\right\}$ is not greater than $X$.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

/- Let $x_{1}, x_{2}, \ldots, x_{n}$ be real numbers with arithmetic mean $X$. Prove that there is a positive integer $K$ such that the arithmetic mean of each of the lists $\left\{x_{1}, x_{2}, \ldots, x_{K}\right\},\left\{x_{2}, x_{3}, \ldots, x_{K}\right\}$, $\ldots,\left\{x_{K-1}, x_{K}\right\},\left\{x_{K}\right\}$ is not greater than $X$. -/

noncomputable def splitList
  (original : List ‚Ñù)
  (h‚ÇÅ : ‚àÄ k ‚â§ original.length,
  ‚àÉ j ‚àà Finset.range k, original.sum / original.length <
    (List.drop j (List.take k original)).sum / (k - j)
  )
   :=
  let rec splitListHelper := Œª (m : ‚Ñï) (m_le_len : m ‚â§ original.length) => by
    choose j j_le j_mean using h‚ÇÅ m m_le_len
    let part := List.drop j (List.take m original)
    exact if j = 0
    then [part]
    else part :: splitListHelper j (by
      apply Nat.le_of_succ_le
      exact Nat.le_trans (List.mem_range.mp j_le) m_le_len
    )
    termination_by l => l
    decreasing_by
      simp_all [Finset.range]

  splitListHelper original.length (Nat.le_refl original.length)

theorem algebra_239355 :
  ‚àÄ list : List ‚Ñù,
  ‚àÉ k ‚â§ list.length,
  ‚àÄ j ‚àà Finset.range k,
  ((list.take k).drop j).sum / (k - j) ‚â§ list.sum / list.length
    := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

/- Let $x_{1}, x_{2}, \ldots, x_{n}$ be real numbers with arithmetic mean $X$. Prove that there is a positive integer $K$ such that the arithmetic mean of each of the lists $\left\{x_{1}, x_{2}, \ldots, x_{K}\right\},\left\{x_{2}, x_{3}, \ldots, x_{K}\right\}$, $\ldots,\left\{x_{K-1}, x_{K}\right\},\left\{x_{K}\right\}$ is not greater than $X$. -/

noncomputable def splitList
  (original : List ‚Ñù)
  (h‚ÇÅ : ‚àÄ k ‚â§ original.length,
  ‚àÉ j ‚àà Finset.range k, original.sum / original.length <
    (List.drop j (List.take k original)).sum / (k - j)
  )
   :=
  let rec splitListHelper := Œª (m : ‚Ñï) (m_le_len : m ‚â§ original.length) => by
    choose j j_le j_mean using h‚ÇÅ m m_le_len
    let part := List.drop j (List.take m original)
    exact if j = 0
    then [part]
    else part :: splitListHelper j (by
      apply Nat.le_of_succ_le
      exact Nat.le_trans (List.mem_range.mp j_le) m_le_len
    )
    termination_by l => l
    decreasing_by
      simp_all [Finset.range]

  splitListHelper original.length (Nat.le_refl original.length)

theorem algebra_239355 :
  ‚àÄ list : List ‚Ñù,
  ‚àÉ k ‚â§ list.length,
  ‚àÄ j ‚àà Finset.range k,
  ((list.take k).drop j).sum / (k - j) ‚â§ list.sum / list.length
    := by
  intro original
  by_contra! h‚ÇÅ

  have splitListRfl : (splitList original h‚ÇÅ).flatten = original := by
    unfold splitList
    -- Proof by function induction here:
    sorry

  have forallParts : ‚àÄ part ‚àà splitList original h‚ÇÅ,
    original.sum / original.length < part.sum / part.length := by
    intro part part_in
    unfold splitList at part_in
    specialize h‚ÇÅ original.length (Nat.le_refl original.length)
    sorry

  let original' := (splitList original h‚ÇÅ).flatten
  have : original'.sum / original'.length < original.sum / original.length := by
    unfold original'
    rw [splitListRfl]
    sorry

  unfold original' at this
  simp_all

informal_statement: If $a$ and $b$ are positive integers that can each be written as a sum of two squares, then $a b$ is also a sum of two squares. Find the smallest positive integer $c$ such that $c=a b$, where $a=x^{3}+y^{3}$ and $b=x^{3}+y^{3}$ each have solutions in integers $(x, y)$, but $c=x^{3}+y^{3}$ does not.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

/-Find the smallest positive integer c such that c=ab, where a=x^3+y^3 and
b=x^3+y ^3each have solutions in integers (x,y), but c=x^3+y^3 does not. -/
theorem number_theory_611141: IsLeast {c: ‚Ñ§ | c > 0 ‚àß ¬¨ (‚àÉ x y: ‚Ñ§, c = x^3 + y^3) ‚àß
 (‚àÉ a b : ‚Ñ§, c = a * b ‚àß ‚àÉ x1 y1: ‚Ñ§, a = x1 ^ 3 + y1 ^ 3 ‚àß ‚àÉ x2 y2, b = x2 ^ 3 + y2 ^ 3)} 4:= by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

/-Find the smallest positive integer c such that c=ab, where a=x^3+y^3 and
b=x^3+y ^3each have solutions in integers (x,y), but c=x^3+y^3 does not. -/
theorem number_theory_611141: IsLeast {c: ‚Ñ§ | c > 0 ‚àß ¬¨ (‚àÉ x y: ‚Ñ§, c = x^3 + y^3) ‚àß
 (‚àÉ a b : ‚Ñ§, c = a * b ‚àß ‚àÉ x1 y1: ‚Ñ§, a = x1 ^ 3 + y1 ^ 3 ‚àß ‚àÉ x2 y2, b = x2 ^ 3 + y2 ^ 3)} 4:= by
  -- we first show a lemma which will be used many times
  have ne_3: ¬¨ ‚àÉ x y: ‚Ñ§, 3 = x^3 + y^3 := by
      by_contra! h
      obtain ‚ü®x,y,h‚ü© := h
      have hx: x > 0 := by
          by_contra! hx
          have hy: y > 0 := by
            by_contra! hy
            have contra: (3: ‚Ñ§) ‚â§ 0 := by
              rw [h]
              replace hx: x ^ 3 ‚â§ 0 := by
                have o: x ^ 3 = x ^ 2 * x := by
                  rw [show 3 = 2 + 1 by norm_num]
                  rw [pow_add]
                  ring
                rw [o]
                have o1: 0 ‚â§ x ^ 2 := by
                  apply sq_nonneg
                apply Int.mul_nonpos_of_nonneg_of_nonpos
                all_goals omega
              replace hy: y ^ 3 ‚â§ 0 := by
                have o: y ^ 3 = y ^ 2 * y := by
                  rw [show 3 = 2 + 1 by norm_num]
                  rw [pow_add]
                  ring
                rw [o]
                have o1: 0 ‚â§ y ^ 2 := by
                  apply sq_nonneg
                apply Int.mul_nonpos_of_nonneg_of_nonpos
                all_goals omega
              omega
            tauto
          set a:= -x with ha
          replace ha: x = -a := by omega
          simp [ha] at h
          simp [ha] at hx
          rw [show (-a) ^ 3 = - (a ^ 3) by ring] at h
          rw [show -a ^ 3 + y ^ 3 = (y - a) * (y ^ 2 + a * y + a ^ 2) by ring_nf] at h
          have o1: 0 ‚â§ y ^ 2 + a * y + a ^ 2 := by nlinarith
          have o: y - a ‚â• 0 := by nlinarith
          have o2: y - a ‚â† 0 := by nlinarith
          replace o2: y - a ‚â• 1 := by omega
          have h2: 4 ‚â• y ^ 2 + a * y + a ^ 2 := by
            nlinarith
          by_cases l: a = 0
          -- a = 0
          . simp [l] at h
            have t: y < 2 := by
              by_contra! t
              have contra: (8: ‚Ñ§) ‚â§ 3 := by
                have s: 2 ^ 2 ‚â§ y ^ 2 := by nlinarith
                calc
                  8 = 2 * 2 ^ 2 := by norm_num
                  _ ‚â§ y * 2 ^ 2 := by omega
                  _ ‚â§ y * y ^ 2 := by nlinarith
                  _ = 3 := by omega
              tauto
            replace t: y = 1 := by omega
            simp [t] at h
          -- a ‚â† 0
          . replace l: 1 ‚â§ a := by omega
            replace hy: 2 ‚â§ y := by linarith
            have contra: y ^ 2 + a * y + a ^ 2 ‚â• 5 := by nlinarith
            nlinarith

        -- we show we must have y > 0 by the similar argument
      have hy: y > 0 := by
          by_contra! hy
          have hx: x > 0 := by
            by_contra! hx
            have contra: (3: ‚Ñ§) ‚â§ 0 := by
              rw [h]
              replace hy: y ^ 3 ‚â§ 0 := by
                have o: y ^ 3 = y ^ 2 * y := by
                  rw [show 3 = 2 + 1 by norm_num]
                  rw [pow_add]
                  ring
                rw [o]
                have o1: 0 ‚â§ y ^ 2 := by
                  apply sq_nonneg
                apply Int.mul_nonpos_of_nonneg_of_nonpos
                all_goals omega
              replace hy: x ^ 3 ‚â§ 0 := by
                have o: x ^ 3 = x ^ 2 * x := by
                  rw [show 3 = 2 + 1 by norm_num]
                  rw [pow_add]
                  ring
                rw [o]
                have o1: 0 ‚â§ x ^ 2 := by
                  apply sq_nonneg
                apply Int.mul_nonpos_of_nonneg_of_nonpos
                all_goals omega
              omega
            tauto
          set a:= -y with ha
          replace ha: y = -a := by omega
          simp [ha] at h
          simp [ha] at hy
          rw [show (-a) ^ 3 = - (a ^ 3) by ring] at h
          rw [show x ^ 3 + -a ^ 3 = (x - a) * (x ^ 2 + a * x + a ^ 2) by ring_nf] at h
          have o1: 0 ‚â§ x ^ 2 + a * x + a ^ 2 := by nlinarith
          have o: x - a ‚â• 0 := by nlinarith
          have o2: x - a ‚â† 0 := by nlinarith
          replace o2: x - a ‚â• 1 := by omega
          have h2: 4 ‚â• x ^ 2 + a * x + a ^ 2 := by
            nlinarith
          by_cases l: a = 0
          -- a = 0
          . simp [l] at h
            have t: x < 2 := by
              by_contra! t
              have contra: (8: ‚Ñ§) ‚â§ 3 := by
                have s: 2 ^ 2 ‚â§ x ^ 2 := by nlinarith
                calc
                  8 = 2 * 2 ^ 2 := by norm_num
                  _ ‚â§ x * 2 ^ 2 := by omega
                  _ ‚â§ x * x ^ 2 := by nlinarith
                  _ = 3 := by omega
              tauto
            replace t: x = 1 := by omega
            simp [t] at h
          -- a ‚â† 0
          . replace l: 1 ‚â§ a := by omega
            replace hy: 2 ‚â§ x := by linarith
            have contra: x ^ 2 + a * x + a ^ 2 ‚â• 5 := by nlinarith
            nlinarith

      have hx2: x < 2 := by
          by_contra! hx2
          have contra: x ^ 3 + y ^ 3 ‚â• 8 := by
            have o: y ^ 3 ‚â• 0 := by
              apply pow_nonneg
              omega
            calc
              x ^ 3 + y ^ 3 ‚â• x ^ 3 := by nlinarith
                          _ ‚â• 2 ^ 3 := by simp; rw [show (8: ‚Ñ§) = 2 ^ 3 by norm_num]; rw [pow_le_pow_iff_left‚ÇÄ]; omega; omega; omega; omega
                          _ = 8 := by norm_num
          nlinarith
      replace hx2: x = 1 := by omega
      simp [hx2] at h
      replace h: y ^ 3 = 2 := by nlinarith
      have hy2: y < 2 := by
          by_contra! hy2
          have contra: 8 ‚â§ y ^ 3 := by
            calc
              8 = 2 ^ 3 := by norm_num
              _ ‚â§ y ^ 3 := by rw [pow_le_pow_iff_left‚ÇÄ]; omega; omega; omega; omega
          nlinarith
      replace hy2: y = 1 := by omega
      rw [hy2] at h
      tauto

  -- we now show the main theorem
  constructor
  -- the forward direction
  . simp only [Set.mem_setOf_eq]
    constructor
    . norm_num
    . constructor
      . simp
        intro x y h
        -- similar with the proof of lemma
        -- we show we must have x > 0
        have hx: x > 0 := by
          by_contra! hx
          have hy: y > 0 := by
            by_contra! hy
            have contra: (4: ‚Ñ§) ‚â§ 0 := by
              rw [h]
              replace hx: x ^ 3 ‚â§ 0 := by
                have o: x ^ 3 = x ^ 2 * x := by
                  rw [show 3 = 2 + 1 by norm_num]
                  rw [pow_add]
                  ring
                rw [o]
                have o1: 0 ‚â§ x ^ 2 := by
                  apply sq_nonneg
                apply Int.mul_nonpos_of_nonneg_of_nonpos
                all_goals omega
              replace hy: y ^ 3 ‚â§ 0 := by
                have o: y ^ 3 = y ^ 2 * y := by
                  rw [show 3 = 2 + 1 by norm_num]
                  rw [pow_add]
                  ring
                rw [o]
                have o1: 0 ‚â§ y ^ 2 := by
                  apply sq_nonneg
                apply Int.mul_nonpos_of_nonneg_of_nonpos
                all_goals omega
              omega
            tauto
          set a:= -x with ha
          replace ha: x = -a := by omega
          simp [ha] at h
          simp [ha] at hx
          rw [show (-a) ^ 3 = - (a ^ 3) by ring] at h
          rw [show -a ^ 3 + y ^ 3 = (y - a) * (y ^ 2 + a * y + a ^ 2) by ring_nf] at h
          have o1: 0 ‚â§ y ^ 2 + a * y + a ^ 2 := by nlinarith
          have o: y - a ‚â• 0 := by nlinarith
          have o2: y - a ‚â† 0 := by nlinarith
          replace o2: y - a ‚â• 1 := by omega
          have h2: 4 ‚â• y ^ 2 + a * y + a ^ 2 := by
            nlinarith
          by_cases l: a = 0
          -- a = 0
          . simp [l] at h
            have t: y < 2 := by
              by_contra! t
              have contra: (8: ‚Ñ§) ‚â§ 4 := by
                have s: 2 ^ 2 ‚â§ y ^ 2 := by nlinarith
                calc
                  8 = 2 * 2 ^ 2 := by norm_num
                  _ ‚â§ y * 2 ^ 2 := by omega
                  _ ‚â§ y * y ^ 2 := by nlinarith
                  _ = 4 := by omega
              tauto
            replace t: y = 1 := by omega
            simp [t] at h
          -- a ‚â† 0
          . replace l: 1 ‚â§ a := by omega
            replace hy: 2 ‚â§ y := by linarith
            have contra: y ^ 2 + a * y + a ^ 2 ‚â• 5 := by nlinarith
            nlinarith

        -- we show we must have y > 0 by the similar argument
        have hy: y > 0 := by
          by_contra! hy
          have hx: x > 0 := by
            by_contra! hx
            have contra: (4: ‚Ñ§) ‚â§ 0 := by
              rw [h]
              replace hy: y ^ 3 ‚â§ 0 := by
                have o: y ^ 3 = y ^ 2 * y := by
                  rw [show 3 = 2 + 1 by norm_num]
                  rw [pow_add]
                  ring
                rw [o]
                have o1: 0 ‚â§ y ^ 2 := by
                  apply sq_nonneg
                apply Int.mul_nonpos_of_nonneg_of_nonpos
                all_goals omega
              replace hy: x ^ 3 ‚â§ 0 := by
                have o: x ^ 3 = x ^ 2 * x := by
                  rw [show 3 = 2 + 1 by norm_num]
                  rw [pow_add]
                  ring
                rw [o]
                have o1: 0 ‚â§ x ^ 2 := by
                  apply sq_nonneg
                apply Int.mul_nonpos_of_nonneg_of_nonpos
                all_goals omega
              omega
            tauto
          set a:= -y with ha
          replace ha: y = -a := by omega
          simp [ha] at h
          simp [ha] at hy
          rw [show (-a) ^ 3 = - (a ^ 3) by ring] at h
          rw [show x ^ 3 + -a ^ 3 = (x - a) * (x ^ 2 + a * x + a ^ 2) by ring_nf] at h
          have o1: 0 ‚â§ x ^ 2 + a * x + a ^ 2 := by nlinarith
          have o: x - a ‚â• 0 := by nlinarith
          have o2: x - a ‚â† 0 := by nlinarith
          replace o2: x - a ‚â• 1 := by omega
          have h2: 4 ‚â• x ^ 2 + a * x + a ^ 2 := by
            nlinarith
          by_cases l: a = 0
          -- a = 0
          . simp [l] at h
            have t: x < 2 := by
              by_contra! t
              have contra: (8: ‚Ñ§) ‚â§ 4 := by
                have s: 2 ^ 2 ‚â§ x ^ 2 := by nlinarith
                calc
                  8 = 2 * 2 ^ 2 := by norm_num
                  _ ‚â§ x * 2 ^ 2 := by omega
                  _ ‚â§ x * x ^ 2 := by nlinarith
                  _ = 4 := by omega
              tauto
            replace t: x = 1 := by omega
            simp [t] at h
          -- a ‚â† 0
          . replace l: 1 ‚â§ a := by omega
            replace hy: 2 ‚â§ x := by linarith
            have contra: x ^ 2 + a * x + a ^ 2 ‚â• 5 := by nlinarith
            nlinarith

        have hx2: x < 2 := by
          by_contra! hx2
          have contra: x ^ 3 + y ^ 3 ‚â• 8 := by
            have o: y ^ 3 ‚â• 0 := by
              apply pow_nonneg
              omega
            calc
              x ^ 3 + y ^ 3 ‚â• x ^ 3 := by nlinarith
                          _ ‚â• 2 ^ 3 := by simp; rw [show (8: ‚Ñ§) = 2 ^ 3 by norm_num]; rw [pow_le_pow_iff_left‚ÇÄ]; omega; omega; omega; omega
                          _ = 8 := by norm_num
          nlinarith
        replace hx2: x = 1 := by omega
        simp [hx2] at h
        replace h: y ^ 3 = 3 := by nlinarith
        have hy2: y < 2 := by
          by_contra! hy2
          have contra: 8 ‚â§ y ^ 3 := by
            calc
              8 = 2 ^ 3 := by norm_num
              _ ‚â§ y ^ 3 := by rw [pow_le_pow_iff_left‚ÇÄ]; omega; omega; omega; omega
          nlinarith
        replace hy2: y = 1 := by omega
        rw [hy2] at h
        tauto

      . use 2
        use 2
        constructor
        . norm_num
        . use 1
          use 1
          norm_num
          use 1
          use 1
          norm_num

    -- the backward direction
  . intro c
    intro h
    by_contra! no
    simp at h
    rcases h with ‚ü®hc,h‚ü©
    have c_val: c = 1 ‚à® c = 2 ‚à® c = 3 := by omega
    rcases c_val with l | l | l
    -- c = 1
    . simp [l] at h
      rcases h with ‚ü®h1,h2‚ü©
      absurd h1
      simp
      use 1
      use 0
      norm_num
    -- c = 2
    . simp [l] at h
      rcases h with ‚ü®h1,h2‚ü©
      absurd h1
      simp
      use 1
      use 1
      norm_num
    -- c = 3
    . simp [l] at h
      rcases h with ‚ü®h1,h2‚ü©
      absurd h2
      simp
      intro a b h
      intro x1 y1 h3
      clear no hc l h1 h2
      have o: a = 3 ‚àß b = 1 ‚à® a = 1 ‚àß b = 3 ‚à® a = -1 ‚àß b = -3 ‚à® a = -3 ‚àß b = -1 := by
        clear * - h
        have l: a ‚â• 0 ‚àß b > 0 ‚à® a < 0 ‚àß b < 0 := by
          by_contra! no
          rcases no with ‚ü®l1,l2‚ü©
          by_cases g: a ‚â• 0
          . simp [g] at l1
            nlinarith
          . simp at g
            simp [g] at l2
            nlinarith
        rcases l with ‚ü®l1,l2‚ü© | ‚ü®l1,l2‚ü©
        . have ha: a < 4 := by nlinarith
          interval_cases a
          all_goals omega
        . have ha: a > -4 := by nlinarith
          interval_cases a
          all_goals omega
      rcases o with ‚ü®o1,o2‚ü© | ‚ü®o1,o2‚ü© | ‚ü®o1,o2‚ü© | ‚ü®o1,o2‚ü©
      -- a = 3, b = 1
      . simp [o2]
        simp [o1] at h3
        absurd ne_3
        use x1
        use y1
      -- a = 1, b = 3
      . simp [o2]
        by_contra! no
        simp [ne_3] at no
      -- a = -1, b = -3
      . simp [o2]
        by_contra! no
        obtain ‚ü®x,y,no‚ü© := no
        set t:= -x with ht
        set s:= -y with hs
        replace ht: x = -t := by omega
        replace hs: y = -s := by omega
        simp [ht,hs] at no
        rw [show (-t) ^ 3 = - (t ^ 3) by ring] at no
        rw [show (-s) ^ 3 = - (s ^ 3) by ring] at no
        replace no: 3 = t ^ 3 + s ^ 3 := by omega
        absurd ne_3
        use t
        use s
      -- a = -3, b = -1
      . simp [o1] at h3
        set t:= -x1 with ht
        set s:= -y1 with hs
        replace ht: x1 = -t := by omega
        replace hs: y1 = -s := by omega
        simp [ht,hs] at h3
        rw [show (-t) ^ 3 = - (t ^ 3) by ring] at h3
        rw [show (-s) ^ 3 = - (s ^ 3) by ring] at h3
        replace no: 3 = t ^ 3 + s ^ 3 := by omega
        absurd ne_3
        use t
        use s

soln_description:
Let the numbers on the faces be $a_{1}, a_{2}, b_{1}, b_{2}, c_{1}, c_{2}$, placed so that $a_{1}$ and $a_{2}$ are on opposite faces etc. Then the sum of the eight products is equal to

$$
\left(a_{1}+a_{2}\right)\left(b_{1}+b_{2}\right)\left(c_{1}+c_{2}\right)=1001=7 \cdot 11 \cdot 13 .
$$

Hence the sum of the numbers on the faces is $a_{1}+a_{2}+b_{1}+b_{2}+c_{1}+c_{2}=7+11+13=$ 31.
informal_statement: A positive integer is written on each of the six faces of a cube. For each vertex of the cube we compute the product of the numbers on the three adjacent faces. The sum of these products is 1001. What is the sum of the six numbers on the faces?
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

set_option maxHeartbeats 400000
/- A positive integer is written on each of the six faces of a cube.
For each vertex of the cube we compute the product of the numbers on the three adjacent faces.
 The sum of these products is 1001. What is the sum of the six numbers on the faces? -/
theorem number_theory_239374 (a1 a2 b1 b2 c1 c2: ‚Ñ§) (ha1 : 0 < a1) (ha2 : 0 < a2) (hb1 : 0 < b1) (hb2 : 0 < b2)
 (hc1 : 0 < c1) (hc2 : 0 < c2) (h: a1 * b1 * c1 + a1 * b2 * c2 + a2 * b1 * c2 + a2 * b2 * c1
 + a1 * b1 * c2 + a2 * b1 * c1 + a1 * b2 * c1 + a2 * b2 * c2 = 1001): a1 + a2 + b1 + b2 + c1 + c2 = 31 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

set_option maxHeartbeats 400000
/- A positive integer is written on each of the six faces of a cube.
For each vertex of the cube we compute the product of the numbers on the three adjacent faces.
 The sum of these products is 1001. What is the sum of the six numbers on the faces? -/
theorem number_theory_239374 (a1 a2 b1 b2 c1 c2: ‚Ñ§) (ha1 : 0 < a1) (ha2 : 0 < a2) (hb1 : 0 < b1) (hb2 : 0 < b2)
 (hc1 : 0 < c1) (hc2 : 0 < c2) (h: a1 * b1 * c1 + a1 * b2 * c2 + a2 * b1 * c2 + a2 * b2 * c1
 + a1 * b1 * c2 + a2 * b1 * c1 + a1 * b2 * c1 + a2 * b2 * c2 = 1001): a1 + a2 + b1 + b2 + c1 + c2 = 31 := by
    -- a1 and a2 are the numbers on the opposite faces, etc. --
    have id: a1 * b1 * c1 + a1 * b2 * c2 + a2 * b1 * c2 + a2 * b2 * c1
 + a1 * b1 * c2 + a2 * b1 * c1 + a1 * b2 * c1 + a2 * b2 * c2 = (a1 + a2) * (b1 + b2) * (c1 + c2) := by
      ring
    rw [id] at h
    -- note that 1001 = 7 * 11 * 13, hence the set {(a1 + a2), (b1 + b2), (c1 + c2)} is a permutation of {7, 11, 13} --
    clear id
    let x := a1 + a2
    have hx: a1 + a2 = x := by rfl
    have xb: 2 ‚â§ x := by omega
    let y := b1 + b2
    have hy: b1 + b2 = y := by rfl
    have yb: 2 ‚â§ y := by omega
    let z := c1 + c2
    have hz: c1 + c2 = z := by rfl
    have zb: 2 ‚â§ z := by omega
    simp [hx, hy, hz] at h
    rw [show a1 + a2 + b1 + b2 + c1 + c2 = x + y + z by simp [x,y,z]; ring]
    clear_value x y z
    clear hx hy hz ha1 ha2 hb1 hb2 hc1 hc2
    -- 7 ‚à£ one of x,y,z --
    have d7: 7 ‚à£ x ‚à® 7 ‚à£ y ‚à® 7 ‚à£ z := by
      have o: 7 ‚à£ x * y * z := by
        rw [h]; omega
      apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at o
      rcases o with o | o
      . apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at o
        rcases o with o | o
        . left; exact o
        . right; left; exact o
        norm_num
      . right
        right
        exact o
      norm_num
    -- 11 ‚à£ one of x,y,z --
    have d11: 11 ‚à£ x ‚à® 11 ‚à£ y ‚à® 11 ‚à£ z := by
      have o: 11 ‚à£ x * y * z := by
        rw [h]; omega
      apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at o
      rcases o with o | o
      . apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at o
        rcases o with o | o
        . left; exact o
        . right; left; exact o
        norm_num
      . right
        right
        exact o
      norm_num
    -- 13 ‚à£ one of x,y,z --
    have d13: 13 ‚à£ x ‚à® 13 ‚à£ y ‚à® 13 ‚à£ z := by
      have o: 13 ‚à£ x * y * z := by
        rw [h]; omega
      apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at o
      rcases o with o | o
      . apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at o
        rcases o with o | o
        . left; exact o
        . right; left; exact o
        norm_num
      . right
        right
        exact o
      norm_num
    -- for convenience, we use by_contra--
    by_contra! no

    -- we show that ¬¨ 13 ‚à£ x --
    have dx: ¬¨ 13 ‚à£ x := by
      by_contra! dx
      clear d13
      apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at dx
      rcases dx with ‚ü®k,dk‚ü©
      simp [dk] at h
      have k_pos: 1 ‚â§ k := by
        omega
      rw [dk] at d11
      rcases d11 with d11 | d11 | d11
      -- 11 ‚à£ x --
      . replace d11: 11 ‚à£ k := by
          apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at d11
          rcases d11 with d11 | d11
          . omega
          . exact d11
          norm_num
        apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d11
        obtain ‚ü®l,dl‚ü© := d11
        have l_pos: 1 ‚â§ l := by
          omega
        simp [dl] at h
        replace dl: l * y * z = 7 := by nlinarith
        have l_val: l = 1 := by
          by_contra! ne
          replace ne: 2 ‚â§ l := by omega
          have contra: 8 ‚â§ l * y * z := by
            calc
              8 = 2 * (2 * 2) := by norm_num
              _ ‚â§ l * (2 * 2) := by apply Int.mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right;omega;omega
              _ = 2 * (l * 2) := by ring
              _ ‚â§ y * (l * 2) := by apply Int.mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right;omega;omega
              _ = 2 * (y * l) := by ring
              _ ‚â§ z * (y * l) := by apply Int.mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right;omega;nlinarith
              _ = l * y * z := by ring
          rw [dl] at contra
          tauto
        simp [l_val] at h
        replace dl: y * z = 7 := by nlinarith
        have o: 7 ‚à£ y * z := by omega
        have dd7: 7 ‚à£ y ‚à® 7 ‚à£ z := by
          apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at o
          exact o
          norm_num
        rcases dd7 with d7 | d7
        -- 7 ‚à£ y --
        . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d7
          obtain ‚ü®m,dm‚ü© := d7
          have m_pos: 1 ‚â§ m := by
            omega
          simp [dm] at h
          replace dm: m * z = 1 := by nlinarith
          absurd dm
          nlinarith
        -- 7 ‚à£ z --
        . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d7
          obtain ‚ü®m,dm‚ü© := d7
          have m_pos: 1 ‚â§ m := by
            omega
          simp [dm] at h
          replace dm: m * y = 1 := by nlinarith
          absurd dm
          nlinarith
      -- 11 ‚à£ y --
      . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d11
        obtain ‚ü®l,dl‚ü© := d11
        have p:= dl
        have l_pos: 1 ‚â§ l := by
          omega
        simp [dl] at h
        replace dl: l * k * z = 7 := by nlinarith
        have o: z ‚à£ 7 := by
          rw[‚Üê dl]
          apply Int.dvd_mul_left
        have oz: z = 1 ‚à® z = 7 := by
          replace o: z.natAbs ‚à£ (7: ‚Ñ§).natAbs := by
            rw [Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]
            exact o
          rw [Nat.dvd_prime] at o
          norm_cast at o
          rcases o with o | o
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          rw [Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_cast
          rw [‚Üê Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_num
        rcases oz with oz | oz
        . omega
        . simp [oz] at dl
          have l_val: l = 1 := by nlinarith
          have k_val: k = 1 := by
            nlinarith
          simp [k_val] at dk
          simp [l_val] at p
          omega
      -- 11 ‚à£ z --
      . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d11
        obtain ‚ü®l,dl‚ü© := d11
        have p:= dl
        have l_pos: 1 ‚â§ l := by
          omega
        simp [dl] at h
        replace dl: l * k * y = 7 := by nlinarith
        have o: y ‚à£ 7 := by
          rw[‚Üê dl]
          apply Int.dvd_mul_left
        have oz: y = 1 ‚à® y = 7 := by
          replace o: y.natAbs ‚à£ (7: ‚Ñ§).natAbs := by
            rw [Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]
            exact o
          rw [Nat.dvd_prime] at o
          norm_cast at o
          rcases o with o | o
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          rw [Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_cast
          rw [‚Üê Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_num
        rcases oz with oz | oz
        . omega
        . simp [oz] at dl
          have l_val: l = 1 := by nlinarith
          have k_val: k = 1 := by
            nlinarith
          simp [k_val] at dk
          simp [l_val] at p
          omega

    -- we show that ¬¨ 13 ‚à£ y --
    have dy: ¬¨ 13 ‚à£ y := by
      by_contra! dy
      clear d13
      apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at dy
      rcases dy with ‚ü®k,dk‚ü©
      simp [dk] at h
      have k_pos: 1 ‚â§ k := by
        omega
      rw [dk] at d11
      rcases d11 with d11 | d11 | d11
      -- 11 ‚à£ x --
      . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d11
        obtain ‚ü®l,dl‚ü© := d11
        have p:= dl
        have l_pos: 1 ‚â§ l := by
          omega
        simp [dl] at h
        replace dl: l * k * z = 7 := by nlinarith
        have o: z ‚à£ 7 := by
          rw[‚Üê dl]
          apply Int.dvd_mul_left
        have oz: z = 1 ‚à® z = 7 := by
          replace o: z.natAbs ‚à£ (7: ‚Ñ§).natAbs := by
            rw [Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]
            exact o
          rw [Nat.dvd_prime] at o
          norm_cast at o
          rcases o with o | o
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          rw [Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_cast
          rw [‚Üê Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_num
        rcases oz with oz | oz
        . omega
        . simp [oz] at dl
          have l_val: l = 1 := by nlinarith
          have k_val: k = 1 := by
            nlinarith
          simp [k_val] at dk
          simp [l_val] at p
          omega
      -- 11 ‚à£ y --
      . replace d11: 11 ‚à£ k := by
          apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at d11
          rcases d11 with d11 | d11
          . omega
          . exact d11
          norm_num
        apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d11
        obtain ‚ü®l,dl‚ü© := d11
        have l_pos: 1 ‚â§ l := by
          omega
        simp [dl] at h
        replace dl: l * x * z = 7 := by nlinarith
        have l_val: l = 1 := by
          by_contra! ne
          replace ne: 2 ‚â§ l := by omega
          have contra: 8 ‚â§ l * x * z := by
            calc
              8 = 2 * (2 * 2) := by norm_num
              _ ‚â§ l * (2 * 2) := by apply Int.mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right;omega;omega
              _ = 2 * (l * 2) := by ring
              _ ‚â§ x * (l * 2) := by apply Int.mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right;omega;omega
              _ = 2 * (x * l) := by ring
              _ ‚â§ z * (x * l) := by apply Int.mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right;omega;nlinarith
              _ = l * x * z := by ring
          rw [dl] at contra
          tauto
        simp [l_val] at h
        replace dl: x * z = 7 := by nlinarith
        have o: 7 ‚à£ x * z := by omega
        have dd7: 7 ‚à£ x ‚à® 7 ‚à£ z := by
          apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at o
          exact o
          norm_num
        rcases dd7 with d7 | d7
        -- 7 ‚à£ x --
        . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d7
          obtain ‚ü®m,dm‚ü© := d7
          have m_pos: 1 ‚â§ m := by
            omega
          simp [dm] at h
          replace dm: m * z = 1 := by nlinarith
          absurd dm
          nlinarith
        -- 7 ‚à£ z --
        . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d7
          obtain ‚ü®m,dm‚ü© := d7
          have m_pos: 1 ‚â§ m := by
            omega
          simp [dm] at h
          replace dm: m * x = 1 := by nlinarith
          absurd dm
          nlinarith

      -- 11 ‚à£ z --
      . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d11
        obtain ‚ü®l,dl‚ü© := d11
        have p:= dl
        have l_pos: 1 ‚â§ l := by
          omega
        simp [dl] at h
        replace dl: l * k * x = 7 := by nlinarith
        have o: x ‚à£ 7 := by
          rw[‚Üê dl]
          apply Int.dvd_mul_left
        have oz: x = 1 ‚à® x = 7 := by
          replace o: x.natAbs ‚à£ (7: ‚Ñ§).natAbs := by
            rw [Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]
            exact o
          rw [Nat.dvd_prime] at o
          norm_cast at o
          rcases o with o | o
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          rw [Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_cast
