          rw [‚Üê Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_num
        rcases oz with oz | oz
        . omega
        . simp [oz] at dl
          have l_val: l = 1 := by nlinarith
          have k_val: k = 1 := by
            nlinarith
          simp [k_val] at dk
          simp [l_val] at p
          omega


    -- we show that ¬¨ 13 ‚à£ z --
    have dz: ¬¨ 13 ‚à£ z := by
      by_contra! dz
      clear d13
      apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at dz
      rcases dz with ‚ü®k,dk‚ü©
      simp [dk] at h
      have k_pos: 1 ‚â§ k := by
        omega
      rw [dk] at d11
      rcases d11 with d11 | d11 | d11
      -- 11 ‚à£ x --
      . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d11
        obtain ‚ü®l,dl‚ü© := d11
        have p:= dl
        have l_pos: 1 ‚â§ l := by
          omega
        simp [dl] at h
        replace dl: l * k * y = 7 := by nlinarith
        have o: y ‚à£ 7 := by
          rw[‚Üê dl]
          apply Int.dvd_mul_left
        have oz: y = 1 ‚à® y = 7 := by
          replace o: y.natAbs ‚à£ (7: ‚Ñ§).natAbs := by
            rw [Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]
            exact o
          rw [Nat.dvd_prime] at o
          norm_cast at o
          rcases o with o | o
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          rw [Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_cast
          rw [‚Üê Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_num
        rcases oz with oz | oz
        . omega
        . simp [oz] at dl
          have l_val: l = 1 := by nlinarith
          have k_val: k = 1 := by
            nlinarith
          simp [k_val] at dk
          simp [l_val] at p
          omega
      -- 11 ‚à£ y --
      . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d11
        obtain ‚ü®l,dl‚ü© := d11
        have p:= dl
        have l_pos: 1 ‚â§ l := by
          omega
        simp [dl] at h
        replace dl: l * k * x = 7 := by nlinarith
        have o: x ‚à£ 7 := by
          rw[‚Üê dl]
          apply Int.dvd_mul_left
        have oz: x = 1 ‚à® x = 7 := by
          replace o: x.natAbs ‚à£ (7: ‚Ñ§).natAbs := by
            rw [Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]
            exact o
          rw [Nat.dvd_prime] at o
          norm_cast at o
          rcases o with o | o
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          . rw [Int.natAbs_eq_iff] at o
            omega
          rw [Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_cast
          rw [‚Üê Nat.prime_iff]
          norm_num
        rcases oz with oz | oz
        . omega
        . simp [oz] at dl
          have l_val: l = 1 := by nlinarith
          have k_val: k = 1 := by
            nlinarith
          simp [k_val] at dk
          simp [l_val] at p
          omega
      -- 11 ‚à£ z --
      . replace d11: 11 ‚à£ k := by
          apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at d11
          rcases d11 with d11 | d11
          . omega
          . exact d11
          norm_num
        apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d11
        obtain ‚ü®l,dl‚ü© := d11
        have l_pos: 1 ‚â§ l := by
          omega
        simp [dl] at h
        replace dl: l * x * y = 7 := by nlinarith
        have l_val: l = 1 := by
          by_contra! ne
          replace ne: 2 ‚â§ l := by omega
          have contra: 8 ‚â§ l * x * y := by
            calc
              8 = 2 * (2 * 2) := by norm_num
              _ ‚â§ l * (2 * 2) := by apply Int.mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right;omega;omega
              _ = 2 * (l * 2) := by ring
              _ ‚â§ x * (l * 2) := by apply Int.mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right;omega;omega
              _ = 2 * (x * l) := by ring
              _ ‚â§ y * (x * l) := by apply Int.mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right;omega;nlinarith
              _ = l * x * y := by ring
          rw [dl] at contra
          tauto
        simp [l_val] at h
        replace dl: x * y = 7 := by nlinarith
        have o: 7 ‚à£ x * y := by omega
        have dd7: 7 ‚à£ x ‚à® 7 ‚à£ y := by
          apply Prime.dvd_or_dvd at o
          exact o
          norm_num
        rcases dd7 with d7 | d7
        -- 7 ‚à£ x --
        . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d7
          obtain ‚ü®m,dm‚ü© := d7
          have m_pos: 1 ‚â§ m := by
            omega
          simp [dm] at h
          replace dm: m * y = 1 := by nlinarith
          absurd dm
          nlinarith
        -- 7 ‚à£ y --
        . apply exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd at d7
          obtain ‚ü®m,dm‚ü© := d7
          have m_pos: 1 ‚â§ m := by
            omega
          simp [dm] at h
          replace dm: m * x = 1 := by nlinarith
          absurd dm
          nlinarith
    -- Finally, we use d13 to arrive at a contradiction --
    tauto

soln_description:
Solution. The equation makes sense only if $1+\cos x>0$, which means $\cos x>-1$, and this is true for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$ except when $\cos x=-1$.

(1 point)

Similarly, the base of the logarithmic function must be positive and different from 1, so we have $\sqrt{2} \sin x>0$ and $\sqrt{2} \sin x \neq 1$, that is,

$$
\sin x>0 \quad \text { and } \quad \sin x \neq \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}
$$

From the equation itself, we get

$$
\begin{aligned}
1+\cos x & =2 \sin ^{2} x \\
1+\cos x & =2\left(1-\cos ^{2} x\right) \\
2 \cos ^{2} x+\cos x-1 & =0
\end{aligned}
$$

thus we obtain $\cos x=\frac{1}{2}$ and $\cos x=-1$.

(1 point)

$\cos x=-1$ is not a solution due to the initial condition, and from $\cos x=\frac{1}{2}$ we get $x=\frac{\pi}{3}+2 k \pi$ or $x=-\frac{\pi}{3}+2 k \pi$. Due to the initial condition, the solution is only $x=\frac{\pi}{3}+2 k \pi$.

(1 point)
informal_statement:
Task B-3.1. Solve the equation

$$
\log _{\sqrt{2} \sin x}(1+\cos x)=2
$$
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

open Real Set
/--
Problem statement (Main theorem of this file):
Task B-3.1. Solve the equation

$$
\log _{\sqrt{2} \sin x}(1+\cos x)=2
$$

Solution:
Rje≈°enje. Jednad≈æba ima smisla jedino ako je $1+\cos x > 0$, odnosno ako je $\cos x > -1$, a to znaƒçi za sve $x \in \mathbb{R}$ osim kada je $\cos x=-1$.

(1 bod)

Isto tako baza logaritamske funkcije mora biti pozitivna i razliƒçita od 1 pa vrijedi $\sqrt{2} \sin x > 0$ i $\sqrt{2} \sin x \neq 1$, odnosno

$$ \sin x > 0 \quad \text { i } \quad \sin x \neq \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} $$

Iz same jednad≈æbe slijedi

$$ \begin{aligned} 1+\cos x & =2 \sin ^{2} x \\ 1+\cos x & =2\left(1-\cos ^{2} x\right) \\ 2 \cos ^{2} x+\cos x-1 & =0 \end{aligned} $$

te dobivamo $\cos x=\frac{1}{2} \mathrm{i} \cos x=-1$.

(1 bod)

$\cos x=-1$ nije rje≈°enje zbog poƒçetnog uvjeta, a iz $\cos x=\frac{1}{2}$ dobivamo $x=\frac{\pi}{3}+2 k \pi$ ili $x=-\frac{\pi}{3}+2 k \pi$. Zbog poƒçetnog uvjeta rje≈°enje je samo $x=\frac{\pi}{3}+2 k \pi$.

(1 bod)

-/

lemma cos_eq_one_div_two (x : ‚Ñù) (h : cos x = 1 / 2) :
    ‚àÉ k : ‚Ñ§, x = œÄ / 3 + 2 * k * œÄ ‚à® x = -œÄ / 3 + 2 * k * œÄ := by
    rw [‚Üê cos_pi_div_three, cos_eq_cos_iff] at h
    rcases h with ‚ü®k, h‚ü©
    cases' h with h1 h2
    . use -k
      left
      rw [h1]
      ring_nf
      simp
      ring_nf
    . use k
      right
      rw [(by ring: -œÄ / 3 = -(œÄ / 3))]
      rw [h2]
      ring_nf

theorem algebra_214233 (x : ‚Ñù):
    (1 + cos x) > 0 ‚Üí (sqrt 2 * sin x) > 0 ‚Üí (sqrt 2 * sin x) ‚â† 1 ‚Üí (logb (sqrt 2 * sin x) (1 + cos x) = 2 ‚Üî (‚àÉ k : ‚Ñ§, x = œÄ / 3 + 2 * k * œÄ )) := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

open Real Set
/--
Problem statement (Main theorem of this file):
Task B-3.1. Solve the equation

$$
\log _{\sqrt{2} \sin x}(1+\cos x)=2
$$

Solution:
Rje≈°enje. Jednad≈æba ima smisla jedino ako je $1+\cos x > 0$, odnosno ako je $\cos x > -1$, a to znaƒçi za sve $x \in \mathbb{R}$ osim kada je $\cos x=-1$.

(1 bod)

Isto tako baza logaritamske funkcije mora biti pozitivna i razliƒçita od 1 pa vrijedi $\sqrt{2} \sin x > 0$ i $\sqrt{2} \sin x \neq 1$, odnosno

$$ \sin x > 0 \quad \text { i } \quad \sin x \neq \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} $$

Iz same jednad≈æbe slijedi

$$ \begin{aligned} 1+\cos x & =2 \sin ^{2} x \\ 1+\cos x & =2\left(1-\cos ^{2} x\right) \\ 2 \cos ^{2} x+\cos x-1 & =0 \end{aligned} $$

te dobivamo $\cos x=\frac{1}{2} \mathrm{i} \cos x=-1$.

(1 bod)

$\cos x=-1$ nije rje≈°enje zbog poƒçetnog uvjeta, a iz $\cos x=\frac{1}{2}$ dobivamo $x=\frac{\pi}{3}+2 k \pi$ ili $x=-\frac{\pi}{3}+2 k \pi$. Zbog poƒçetnog uvjeta rje≈°enje je samo $x=\frac{\pi}{3}+2 k \pi$.

(1 bod)

-/

lemma cos_eq_one_div_two (x : ‚Ñù) (h : cos x = 1 / 2) :
    ‚àÉ k : ‚Ñ§, x = œÄ / 3 + 2 * k * œÄ ‚à® x = -œÄ / 3 + 2 * k * œÄ := by
    rw [‚Üê cos_pi_div_three, cos_eq_cos_iff] at h
    rcases h with ‚ü®k, h‚ü©
    cases' h with h1 h2
    . use -k
      left
      rw [h1]
      ring_nf
      simp
      ring_nf
    . use k
      right
      rw [(by ring: -œÄ / 3 = -(œÄ / 3))]
      rw [h2]
      ring_nf

theorem algebra_214233 (x : ‚Ñù):
    (1 + cos x) > 0 ‚Üí (sqrt 2 * sin x) > 0 ‚Üí (sqrt 2 * sin x) ‚â† 1 ‚Üí (logb (sqrt 2 * sin x) (1 + cos x) = 2 ‚Üî (‚àÉ k : ‚Ñ§, x = œÄ / 3 + 2 * k * œÄ )) := by
    intro h_pos h_base_pos h_base_neq_1
    constructor
    . intro h_log
      rw [logb_eq_iff_rpow_eq h_base_pos h_base_neq_1 h_pos] at h_log
      norm_cast at h_log
      ring_nf at h_log
      field_simp at h_log
      rw [sin_sq] at h_log
      have : cos x = 1 / 2:= by
        rw [(by ring : (1 - cos x ^ 2) = (1 - cos x) * (1 + cos x)), ‚Üê mul_assoc] at h_log
        have : 1 + cos x ‚â† 0 := by positivity
        field_simp at h_log
        linarith

      apply cos_eq_one_div_two x at this
      rcases this with ‚ü®k, hx‚ü©
      cases' hx with hx1 hx2
      . use k
      . have h_sin : sin x = - ‚àö3 / 2 := by
          rw [hx2]
          rw [(by ring : 2 * k * œÄ = k * (2 * œÄ))]
          rw [sin_add_int_mul_two_pi (-œÄ / 3) k]
          rw [(by ring : -œÄ / 3 = -(œÄ / 3))]
          rw [sin_neg, sin_pi_div_three]
          ring_nf

        have : sqrt 2 > 0 := by positivity
        have : sin x > 0 := by
          apply (mul_pos_iff_of_pos_left this).mp
          exact h_base_pos
        have : sin x < 0 := by rw [h_sin]; ring_nf; norm_num
        linarith

    . intro h_exists
      rcases h_exists with ‚ü®k, hx‚ü©
      rw [(by ring : 2 * k * œÄ = k * (2 * œÄ))] at hx
      rw [hx]
      rw [sin_add_int_mul_two_pi (œÄ / 3) k]
      rw [cos_add_int_mul_two_pi (œÄ / 3) k]
      rw [sin_pi_div_three]
      rw [cos_pi_div_three]
      rw [logb_eq_iff_rpow_eq (by positivity) (by aesop) (by positivity)]
      simp
      ring_nf
      norm_num

informal_statement: Positive integers $a, b$, and $c$ are all powers of $k$ for some positive integer $k$. It is known that the equation $a x^{2}-b x+c=0$ has exactly one real solution $r$, and this value $r$ is less than 100 . Compute the maximum possible value of $r$.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib 

/-- Positive integers $a, b$, and $c$ are all powers of $k$ for some positive integer $k$. It is known that the equation $a x^{2}-b x+c=0$ has exactly one real solution $r$, and this value $r$ is less than 100 . Compute the maximum possible value of $r$.-/
theorem Algebra_610402 {a b c : ‚Ñ§} {x y z : ‚Ñï} {k : ‚Ñï} (hk : k > 0) (ha : a = k ^ x ) (hb : b = k ^ y) (hc : c = k ^ z)  
  (h_eq : ‚àÉ! (r : ‚Ñù), (a * (r * r) + (-b) * r + c = 0) ‚àß (r ‚â§ 100)) : 
  let r := Classical.choose h_eq; r ‚â§ 64 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib 

/-- Positive integers $a, b$, and $c$ are all powers of $k$ for some positive integer $k$. It is known that the equation $a x^{2}-b x+c=0$ has exactly one real solution $r$, and this value $r$ is less than 100 . Compute the maximum possible value of $r$.-/
theorem Algebra_610402 {a b c : ‚Ñ§} {x y z : ‚Ñï} {k : ‚Ñï} (hk : k > 0) (ha : a = k ^ x ) (hb : b = k ^ y) (hc : c = k ^ z)  
  (h_eq : ‚àÉ! (r : ‚Ñù), (a * (r * r) + (-b) * r + c = 0) ‚àß (r ‚â§ 100)) : 
  let r := Classical.choose h_eq; r ‚â§ 64 := by 
  -- since the quadratic equation has uniuqe root, then the discriminat of the polynomial is zero, i.e. `b^2-4ac` should be zero.
  have discrim_eq_zero_of_existsUnique {a b c : ‚Ñù} (ha : a ‚â† 0) (h : ‚àÉ! x, a * (x * x) + b * x + c = 0) :
        discrim a b c = 0 := by
        simp_rw [quadratic_eq_zero_iff_discrim_eq_sq ha] at h
        generalize discrim a b c = d at h
        obtain ‚ü®x, rfl, hx‚ü© := h
        specialize hx (-(x + b / a))
        field_simp [ha] at hx
        specialize hx (by ring)
        linear_combination -(2 * a * x + b) * hx
  -- discriminant eq_zero iff there exist unique root
  have discrim_eq_zero_iff {a b c : ‚Ñù} (ha : a ‚â† 0) :
    discrim a b c = 0 ‚Üî (‚àÉ! x, a * (x * x) + b * x + c = 0) := by
      refine ‚ü®fun hd => ?_, discrim_eq_zero_of_existsUnique ha‚ü©
      simp_rw [quadratic_eq_zero_iff_of_discrim_eq_zero ha hd, existsUnique_eq]
  have aneq : a ‚â† 0 := by 
    rw [ha]
    apply pow_ne_zero
    nlinarith
  have aneq' : (a : ‚Ñù) ‚â† 0 := by norm_cast
  have discrim_eq_zero : b ^ 2 - 4 * a * c = 0 := by 
    obtain ‚ü®r, hr, h1‚ü© := h_eq
    have aux : ‚àÉ! (r : ‚Ñù), (a * (r * r) + (-b) * r + c = 0) := by 
      use r
      constructor
      nlinarith
      intro y hy
      simp at h1
      sorry
    have ht1 : discrim (a : ‚Ñù) (-b) c = 0 := (discrim_eq_zero_iff aneq').mpr aux
    unfold discrim at ht1
    ring_nf at ht1
    norm_cast at ht1
    nlinarith
  rw [ha,hb,hc] at discrim_eq_zero
  have eq : (k : ‚Ñ§) ^ (2 * y) = 2 ^ 2 * k ^ (x + z) := by 
    calc 
      _ = ((k : ‚Ñ§) ^ y) ^ 2 := by 
        rw [mul_comm, ‚Üêpow_mul]
      _ = ((k : ‚Ñ§) ^ y) ^ 2 - 4 * (k : ‚Ñ§)^ x * (k : ‚Ñ§) ^ z + 4 * (k : ‚Ñ§) ^ x * (k : ‚Ñ§) ^ z := by 
        ring_nf
      _ = 4 * ((k : ‚Ñ§) ^ x * (k : ‚Ñ§) ^ z) := by 
        rw [discrim_eq_zero]
        simp
        ring
      _ = (2) ^ 2 * (k : ‚Ñ§) ^ (x + z) := by
        simp
        rw [‚Üêpow_add]
  have k_eq : k = (2) := by sorry -- since `2 ‚à£ k`, and only `2 ‚à£ k`
  rw [k_eq] at ha
  rw [k_eq] at hb
  rw [k_eq] at hc
  have k_eq' : k = (2 : ‚Ñù) := by norm_cast
  obtain hx := Classical.choose_spec h_eq
  let r := Classical.choose h_eq
  -- basic property of quadratic equation
  have quadratic_eq : r = b / (2 * a) := by 
    obtain heq' := Classical.choose_spec h_eq
    obtain ‚ü®h1, h2‚ü© := heq'
    obtain ‚ü®hreq, rle‚ü© := h1
    have aneq : (a : ‚Ñù) ‚â† 0 := by 
      rw [ha]
      norm_num
    have dis_eq : discrim a (-b) c = 0 := by 
      unfold discrim
      rw [ha, hb, hc]
      simp
      rw [k_eq] at discrim_eq_zero
      simpa
    have dis_eq' : discrim (a : ‚Ñù) (-b) c = 0 := by 
      unfold discrim
      unfold discrim at dis_eq
      simp
      simp at dis_eq
      norm_cast
    obtain h' := (quadratic_eq_zero_iff_of_discrim_eq_zero aneq dis_eq' (Classical.choose h_eq)).mp hreq
    unfold r
    simpa using h'
  rw [ha, hb] at quadratic_eq
  unfold r at quadratic_eq
  have eq_aux : (((2 : ‚Ñ§) ^ y) : ‚Ñù) / (2 * ‚Üë((2 : ‚Ñ§) ^ x)) = (2 : ‚Ñ§) ^ (y - x - 1) := by 
    calc 
      _ = (((2 : ‚Ñ§) ^ y) : ‚Ñù) / ((2 : ‚Ñ§) ^ (x + 1)) := by 
        simp
        field_simp
        ring
      _ = (2 : ‚Ñ§) ^ (y - x - 1) := by
        simp
        field_simp
        ring_nf
        have yge : y - x - 1 + x = y -1:= by 
          
          sorry
        rw [‚Üêpow_add]
        rw [yge]
        have yeq : y - 1 + 1 = y := by 
          have : y ‚â• 1 := by sorry
          omega
        conv =>
          lhs
          rw [‚Üê yeq]
        ring
  -- the maximal pow of two less than 100 is 64, then the maximal possible r is 64
  have req : r = 2 ^ (y - x - 1) := by sorry
  obtain heq' := Classical.choose_spec h_eq
  obtain ‚ü®h1, h2‚ü© := heq'
  obtain ‚ü®h1, rle‚ü© := h1
  have ineq : r ‚â§ 64 := by 
    rw [req]
    unfold r at req
    rw [req] at rle
    have ineq_aux : y - x - 1 ‚â§ (6) := by sorry
    have eq' : (64 : ‚Ñù) = 2 ^ 6 := by norm_num
    rw [eq']
    sorry

  exact ineq

soln_description:
## Solution

Answer: $\mathrm{a}>\mathrm{b}$.

Note that $\mathrm{a}^{\mathrm{n}}=\mathrm{a}+1>1$ (since $\mathrm{a}$ is positive). Hence $\mathrm{a}>1$. So $\mathrm{a}^{2 \mathrm{n}}=(\mathrm{a}+1)^{2}=\mathrm{a}^{2}+2 \mathrm{a}+1$. Put $\mathrm{a}=1+k$, then $a^{2}=1+2 k+k^{2}>1+2 k$, so $a^{2}+1>2+2 k=2 a$. Hence $a^{2 n}>4 a$. So $(b / a)^{2 n}=(b+3 a) / a^{2 n}<(b+3 a) / 4 a$. If $\mathrm{b} / \mathrm{a} \geq 1$, then $(\mathrm{b}+3 \mathrm{a}) / 4 \mathrm{a} \leq(\mathrm{b}+3 \mathrm{~b}) / 4 \mathrm{a}=\mathrm{b} / \mathrm{a}$, so $(\mathrm{b} / \mathrm{a})^{2 \mathrm{n}}<\mathrm{b} / \mathrm{a}$. Contradiction. Hence $\mathrm{b} / \mathrm{a}<1$.
informal_statement:
## Problem 1

$\mathrm{n}>1$, and $\mathrm{a}$ and $\mathrm{b}$ are positive real numbers such that $\mathrm{a}^{\mathrm{n}}-\mathrm{a}-1=0$ and $\mathrm{b}^{2 \mathrm{n}}-\mathrm{b}-3 \mathrm{a}=0$. Which is larger?
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

/- ## Problem 1

$\mathrm{n}>1$, and $\mathrm{a}$ and $\mathrm{b}$ are positive real numbers such that $\mathrm{a}^{\mathrm{n}}-\mathrm{a}-1=0$ and $\mathrm{b}^{2 \mathrm{n}}-\mathrm{b}-3 \mathrm{a}=0$. Which is larger?

 -/
theorem algebra_210640 (n : ‚Ñï) (a b : ‚Ñù) (h‚ÇÄ : n > 1) (h‚ÇÅ : 0 < a) (h‚ÇÇ : 0 < b)
    (h‚ÇÉ : a ^ n - a - 1 = 0) (h‚ÇÑ : b ^ (2 * n) - b - 3 * a = 0) :
    a > b := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

/- ## Problem 1

$\mathrm{n}>1$, and $\mathrm{a}$ and $\mathrm{b}$ are positive real numbers such that $\mathrm{a}^{\mathrm{n}}-\mathrm{a}-1=0$ and $\mathrm{b}^{2 \mathrm{n}}-\mathrm{b}-3 \mathrm{a}=0$. Which is larger?

 -/
theorem algebra_210640 (n : ‚Ñï) (a b : ‚Ñù) (h‚ÇÄ : n > 1) (h‚ÇÅ : 0 < a) (h‚ÇÇ : 0 < b)
    (h‚ÇÉ : a ^ n - a - 1 = 0) (h‚ÇÑ : b ^ (2 * n) - b - 3 * a = 0) :
    a > b := by
    --assume by contradiction that b > a
    by_contra h
    push_neg at h
    --one has that a ^ 2n = (a ^ n) ^ 2 = (a + 1) ^ 2 = a ^ 2 + 2a * 1
    have a_pow_two_n : a ^ (2 * n) = a ^ 2 + 2 * a + 1 := by
      rw[(by ring_nf : (1 : ‚Ñù) = 1 ^ 2)]
      nth_rw 3 [(by ring_nf : a = a * 1)]
      rw[‚Üê mul_assoc, ‚Üê add_sq a 1, mul_comm, pow_mul]
      suffices a ^ n = a + 1 by
        rw[sq_eq_sq (by linarith) (by linarith)]
        exact this
      linarith
    --moreover a ^ 2n is bounded by 4a because a^2 + 1 is bounded by 2a
    have bound_a : a ^ (2 * n) > 4 * a := by 
      suffices a ^ 2 + 1 > 2 * a by
        rw[a_pow_two_n, add_assoc, add_comm (2 * a), ‚Üê add_assoc]
        rw[(by linarith : 4 * a = 2 * a + 2 * a)]
        linarith
      have a_gt_one : a > 1 := by 
        by_contra kk 
        push_neg at kk
        have : a ^ n > 1 := by
          calc a ^ n
          _ = a + 1 := by linarith
          _ > 1 := by linarith
        by_contra hk
        push_neg at hk
        have contr : a ^ n ‚â§ 1 := by
          exact pow_le_one‚ÇÄ (le_of_lt h‚ÇÅ) kk
        linarith
      --to do so one writes a = 1 + (a + 1) and developes the square of the sum in a ^ 2 + 1, finding the bound
      calc a ^ 2 + 1 
        = 1 + 2 * (a - 1) + (a - 1) ^ 2 + 1 := by nth_rw 1 [(by ring_nf : a = 1 + (a - 1))]; rw[add_sq]; ring_nf
        _ > 2 + 2 * (a - 1) := by
          suffices (a - 1) ^ 2 > 0 by
            linarith
          exact sq_pos_of_pos (by linarith)
        _ = 2 * a := by linarith
    --b ^ 2n = b + 3a by hypotheses
    have b_pow_n : b ^ (2 * n) = b + 3 * a := by linarith
    --then the ratio of b^2n over a ^ 2n is less than the ratio of the two bounds.
    have div_b_a : (b / a) ^ (2 * n) < (b + 3 * a) / (4 * a) := by
      rw[div_pow]
      refine div_lt_div' (by linarith) (by linarith) (by linarith) (by linarith)
    --this leads to (b/a)^2n < b/a via a chain of estimates
    have hyp1 : (b / a) ^ (2 * n) < (b / a) := by
      suffices (b + 3 * a) / (4 * a) ‚â§ (b / a) by
        linarith
      calc (b + 3 * a) / (4 * a)
      _ ‚â§ (b + 3 * b) / (4 * a) := by 
        have : b + 3 * a ‚â§ b + 3 * b := by linarith
        exact (div_le_div_right (by linarith)).mpr this
      _ = b / a := by ring_nf
    --however this is contradiction, because by assumption we had b/a ‚â• 1 leading to b/a^2n ‚â• b/a
    have hyp2 : (b / a) ^ (2 * n) ‚â• (b / a) := by 
      nth_rw 2 [‚Üê pow_one (b / a)]
      exact pow_le_pow_right (by rw[‚Üê one_le_div h‚ÇÅ] at h; exact h) (by linarith)
    linarith

soln_description:
[Proof] If $(a, b, c)=d \neq 1$, then we can instead discuss $\frac{a}{d}, \frac{b}{d}, \frac{c}{d}$. Therefore, without loss of generality, assume $(a, b, c)=1$.

If the conclusion is not true, then at least one of $|a|,|b|,|c|$ is not equal to 1. Without loss of generality, assume $|a| \neq 1$.
Let $P$ be a prime factor of $a$. Then
$$
a b c\left(\frac{a}{b}+\frac{b}{c}+\frac{c}{a}\right)=a^{2} c+b^{2} a+c^{2} b
$$

is divisible by $p$. Therefore, $c^{2} b$ is divisible by $p$, so $c$ or $b$ is divisible by $p$. Without loss of generality, assume $b$ is divisible by $p$. Thus, $c$ cannot be divisible by $p$.

Let $p^{\prime}$ be the highest power of $p$ that divides $a$, and $p^{s}$ be the highest power of $p$ that divides $b$. Without loss of generality, assume $r \leqslant s$. Then
$$
a b c\left(\frac{a}{c}+\frac{c}{b}+\frac{b}{a}\right)=a^{2} b+c^{2} a+b^{2} c
$$

is divisible by $p^{r+s}$. Note that $a^{2} b$ and $b^{2} c$ are both divisible by $p^{r+s}$, so $c^{2} a$ is also divisible by $p^{r+s}$, which implies that $a$ is divisible by $p^{r+s}$, a contradiction.
Therefore, the conclusion holds, and $|a|=|b|=|c|=1$.
informal_statement:
$3 \cdot 89$ integers $a, b, c$ such that
$$
\frac{a}{b}+\frac{b}{c}+\frac{c}{a} \text { and } \frac{a}{c}+\frac{c}{b}+\frac{b}{a}
$$

are both integers, prove: $|a|=|b|=|c|$.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

/-$3 \cdot 89$ integers $a, b, c$ such that
$$
\frac{a}{b}+\frac{b}{c}+\frac{c}{a} \text { and } \frac{a}{c}+\frac{c}{b}+\frac{b}{a}
$$

are both integers, prove: $|a|=|b|=|c|$.-/
theorem number_theory_217451 (a b c : ‚Ñ§) (ane : a ‚â† 0) (bne : b ‚â† 0) (cne : c ‚â† 0)
    (h1 : ‚àÉ k : ‚Ñ§, (a : ‚Ñö) / b + b / c + c / a = k)
    (h2 : ‚àÉ l : ‚Ñ§, (a : ‚Ñö) / c + c / b + b / a = l) : |a| = |b| ‚àß |b| = |c| := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

/-$3 \cdot 89$ integers $a, b, c$ such that
$$
\frac{a}{b}+\frac{b}{c}+\frac{c}{a} \text { and } \frac{a}{c}+\frac{c}{b}+\frac{b}{a}
$$

are both integers, prove: $|a|=|b|=|c|$.-/
theorem number_theory_217451 (a b c : ‚Ñ§) (ane : a ‚â† 0) (bne : b ‚â† 0) (cne : c ‚â† 0)
    (h1 : ‚àÉ k : ‚Ñ§, (a : ‚Ñö) / b + b / c + c / a = k)
    (h2 : ‚àÉ l : ‚Ñ§, (a : ‚Ñö) / c + c / b + b / a = l) : |a| = |b| ‚àß |b| = |c| := by
-- Assume w. l. o. g. that $a.natAbs ‚â• b.natAbs ‚â• c.natAbs$
  wlog cleb : c.natAbs ‚â§ b.natAbs
  ¬∑ specialize this a c b ane cne bne h2 h1 (by omega)
    omega
  wlog clea : c.natAbs ‚â§ a.natAbs
  ¬∑ rw [add_comm, ‚Üê add_assoc] at h1
    rw [add_assoc, add_comm] at h2
    specialize this c b a cne bne ane h2 h1 (by omega) (by omega)
    omega
  wlog blea : b.natAbs ‚â§ a.natAbs
  ¬∑ rw [add_assoc, add_comm] at h1
    rw [add_comm, ‚Üê add_assoc] at h2
    specialize this b a c bne ane cne h2 h1 (by omega) (by omega) (by omega)
    omega
-- Assume w. l. o. g. that the gcd of $a$, $b$ and $c$ is $1$
  wlog h : (a.natAbs.gcd b.natAbs).gcd c.natAbs = 1
  -- Let $d$ be the gcd of $a$, $b$ and $c$ and prove $d‚â†0$
  ¬∑ set d := (a.natAbs.gcd b.natAbs).gcd c.natAbs
    have dne : d ‚â† 0 := by
      simp [d, Nat.gcd_eq_zero_iff]
      intro; contradiction
    have dvd1 : d ‚à£ a.natAbs := by calc
      _ ‚à£ a.natAbs.gcd b.natAbs := Nat.gcd_dvd_left (a.natAbs.gcd b.natAbs) c.natAbs
      _ ‚à£ _ := Nat.gcd_dvd_left a.natAbs b.natAbs
    have dvd2 : d ‚à£ b.natAbs := by calc
      _ ‚à£ a.natAbs.gcd b.natAbs := Nat.gcd_dvd_left (a.natAbs.gcd b.natAbs) c.natAbs
      _ ‚à£ _ := Nat.gcd_dvd_right a.natAbs b.natAbs
    have dvd3 : d ‚à£ c.natAbs := Nat.gcd_dvd_right (a.natAbs.gcd b.natAbs) c.natAbs
  -- Let $a'=a/d$, $b'=b/d$ and $c'=c/d$
    let a' := a / d; let b' := b / d; let c' := c / d
    have ha' : a = a' * d := by
      dsimp [a', d]; rw [Int.ediv_mul_cancel]
      rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]; norm_cast
    have hb' : b = b' * d := by
      dsimp [b', d]; rw [Int.ediv_mul_cancel]
      rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]; norm_cast
    have hc' : c = c' * d := by
      dsimp [c', d]; rw [Int.ediv_mul_cancel]
      rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]; norm_cast
    have a'ne : a' ‚â† 0 := by
      simp [a']; rw [Int.ediv_eq_iff_eq_mul_left, zero_mul]
      exact ane; norm_cast
      rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]; norm_cast
    have b'ne : b' ‚â† 0 := by
      simp [b']; rw [Int.ediv_eq_iff_eq_mul_left, zero_mul]
      exact bne; norm_cast
      rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]; norm_cast
    have c'ne : c' ‚â† 0 := by
      simp [c']; rw [Int.ediv_eq_iff_eq_mul_left, zero_mul]
      exact cne; norm_cast
      rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]; norm_cast
    rw [ha', hb', hc']; repeat rw [abs_mul]
    repeat rw [mul_right_cancel_iff_of_pos]
  -- Apply the result to $a'$, $b'$ and $c'$
    apply this a' b' c'; any_goals assumption
    ¬∑ rcases h1 with ‚ü®k, hk‚ü©; use k
      rw [‚Üê hk, ha', hb', hc']; push_cast
      repeat rw [mul_div_mul_right]
      all_goals norm_cast
    ¬∑ rcases h2 with ‚ü®k, hk‚ü©; use k
      rw [‚Üê hk, ha', hb', hc']; push_cast
      repeat rw [mul_div_mul_right]
      all_goals norm_cast
    ¬∑ repeat rw [Int.natAbs_ediv, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
      apply Nat.div_le_div_right; assumption
      all_goals rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs, Int.natAbs_ofNat]; assumption
    ¬∑ repeat rw [Int.natAbs_ediv, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
      apply Nat.div_le_div_right; assumption
      all_goals rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs, Int.natAbs_ofNat]; assumption
    ¬∑ repeat rw [Int.natAbs_ediv, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
      apply Nat.div_le_div_right; assumption
      all_goals rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs, Int.natAbs_ofNat]; assumption
    ¬∑ dsimp [a', b', c']; repeat rw [Int.natAbs_ediv, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
      rw [Nat.gcd_div, Nat.gcd_div, Nat.div_eq_iff_eq_mul_left, one_mul]
      dsimp [d]; apply Nat.gcd_pos_of_pos_right
      by_contra!; simp at this; contradiction
      rfl; exact Nat.gcd_dvd_left (a.natAbs.gcd b.natAbs) c.natAbs
      any_goals assumption
      all_goals rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs, Int.natAbs_ofNat]; assumption
    all_goals positivity
-- To prove the main goal, we proceed by contradiction
  repeat rw [Int.abs_eq_natAbs]
  norm_cast; by_contra! h'
-- Extend `h1` and `h2` to get two integers $k$ and $l$
  rcases h1 with ‚ü®k, hk‚ü©; rcases h2 with ‚ü®l, hl‚ü©
-- Prove that $a* b * c * k$ and $a * b * c *l$ has the folowing expressions
  have aux : a * b * c * k = a ^ 2 * c + a * b ^ 2 + b * c ^ 2 := by
    qify; rw [‚Üê hk]; field_simp; ring
  have aux' : a * b * c * l = a ^ 2 * b + a * c ^ 2 + b ^ 2 * c := by
    qify; rw [‚Üê hl]; field_simp; ring
-- Prove that $|a|$ is greater than $1$
  have agt : 1 < a.natAbs := by
    by_cases h'' : a.natAbs = b.natAbs
    ¬∑ specialize h' h''; omega
    omega
-- Let $p$ be any prime divisor of $|a|$ and prove that $p$ divides $b$ or $c$
  obtain ‚ü®p, ppr, pdvd‚ü© := Nat.exists_prime_and_dvd (show a.natAbs‚â†1 by omega)
  have : Fact (p.Prime) := ‚ü®ppr‚ü©
  have dvd1 : (p : ‚Ñ§) ‚à£ a ^ 2 * c + a * b ^ 2 + b * c ^ 2 := by
    rw [‚Üê aux]; repeat apply dvd_mul_of_dvd_left
    rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
    exact pdvd
  have : p ‚à£ b.natAbs ‚à® p ‚à£ c.natAbs := by
    rw [dvd_add_right, ‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs, Int.natAbs_ofNat] at dvd1
    rw [Int.natAbs_mul, Int.natAbs_pow, ppr.dvd_mul] at dvd1
    rcases dvd1 with dvd1|dvd1
    ¬∑ left; exact dvd1
    right; apply ppr.dvd_of_dvd_pow at dvd1; exact dvd1
    apply dvd_add; apply dvd_mul_of_dvd_left
    apply dvd_pow; rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
    exact pdvd; simp
    apply dvd_mul_of_dvd_left
    rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
    exact pdvd
  rcases this with pdb|pdc
  -- If $p$ divides $b$, then $p$ does not divide $c$
  ¬∑ have ndvd : ¬¨ p ‚à£ c.natAbs := by
      intro hdvd; suffices : p ‚à£ 1
      ¬∑ simp at this; norm_num [this] at ppr
      rw [‚Üê h, Nat.dvd_gcd_iff, Nat.dvd_gcd_iff]; split_ands
      all_goals assumption
    rw [dvd_iff_padicValNat_ne_zero] at ndvd pdvd; push_neg at ndvd
    rcases le_or_lt (padicValNat p a.natAbs) (padicValNat p b.natAbs) with pvle|pvlt
    -- If the highest power of $p$ divides $a$ is at most the highest power of $p$ divides $b$
    ¬∑ have : (p : ‚Ñ§) ^ padicValNat p a.natAbs * (p : ‚Ñ§) ^ padicValNat p b.natAbs ‚à£ a * b * c * l := by
        apply dvd_mul_of_dvd_left; apply dvd_mul_of_dvd_left
        apply mul_dvd_mul; all_goals rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]
        all_goals rw [Int.natAbs_pow, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
        all_goals exact pow_padicValNat_dvd
      rw [aux', dvd_add_left, dvd_add_right] at this
      rw [‚Üê pow_add, ‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs] at this
      rw [Int.natAbs_pow, Int.natAbs_ofNat] at this
      rw [padicValNat_dvd_iff_le, Int.natAbs_mul, Int.natAbs_pow] at this
    -- Derive a contradiction from division relations
      rw [padicValNat.mul, padicValNat.pow] at this
      any_goals omega
      any_goals simp; omega
      apply mul_dvd_mul; apply dvd_pow
      any_goals rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs,Int.natAbs_pow, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
      any_goals exact pow_padicValNat_dvd
      simp; rw [‚Üê pow_add, ‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]
      rw [Int.natAbs_pow, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
      rw [padicValNat_dvd_iff_le, Int.natAbs_mul, Int.natAbs_pow]
      rw [padicValNat.mul, padicValNat.pow]; omega
      any_goals simp; omega
    -- If the highest power of $p$ divides $b$ is less than the highest power of $p$ divides $b$
    have : (p : ‚Ñ§) ^ padicValNat p a.natAbs * (p : ‚Ñ§) ^ padicValNat p b.natAbs ‚à£ a * b * c * k := by
      apply dvd_mul_of_dvd_left; apply dvd_mul_of_dvd_left
      apply mul_dvd_mul; all_goals rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]
      all_goals rw [Int.natAbs_pow, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
      all_goals exact pow_padicValNat_dvd
    rw [aux, dvd_add_right] at this
    rw [‚Üê pow_add, ‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs] at this
    rw [Int.natAbs_pow, Int.natAbs_ofNat] at this
    rw [padicValNat_dvd_iff_le, Int.natAbs_mul, Int.natAbs_pow] at this
  -- Derive a contradiction from division relations
    rw [padicValNat.mul, padicValNat.pow] at this
    any_goals omega
    any_goals simp; omega
    apply dvd_add; rw [‚Üê pow_add, ‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs]
    rw [Int.natAbs_pow, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
    rw [padicValNat_dvd_iff_le, Int.natAbs_mul, Int.natAbs_pow]
    rw [padicValNat.mul, padicValNat.pow]; omega
    any_goals simp; omega
    apply mul_dvd_mul; any_goals apply dvd_pow
    any_goals rw [‚Üê Int.natAbs_dvd_natAbs,Int.natAbs_pow, Int.natAbs_ofNat]
    any_goals exact pow_padicValNat_dvd
    simp
-- The case when $p$ divides $c$ is similar to the previous case when $p$ divides $b$
  sorry

soln_description:
6.252 .

Notice that, $S_{m}=\frac{m(m+1)(m+2)}{6}$.
Thus $S_{m} \equiv 2(\bmod 4)$
$$
\begin{array}{l}
\Leftrightarrow m(m+1)(m+2) \equiv 4(\bmod 8) \\
\Leftrightarrow m \equiv 3(\bmod 8) .
\end{array}
$$

Therefore, among $S_{1}, S_{2}, \cdots, S_{2017}$, the numbers that are divisible by 2 but not by 4 are $\left[\frac{2017}{8}\right]=252$ in total.
informal_statement:
6. Let $a_{n}=1+2+\cdots+n\left(n \in \mathbf{Z}_{+}\right)$,
$$
S_{m}=a_{1}+a_{2}+\cdots+a_{m}(m=1,2, \cdots) \text {. }
$$

Then among $S_{1}, S_{2}, \cdots, S_{2017}$, the numbers that are divisible by 2 but not by 4 are $\qquad$ in number.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

open Finset

def a (n : ‚Ñï) := ‚àë i in Finset.Icc 1 n, i

def S (m : ‚Ñï) := ‚àë i in Finset.Icc 1 m, a i

theorem number_theory_211318 :
    {i | 1 ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ 2017 ‚àß 2 ‚à£ S i ‚àß ¬¨4 ‚à£ S i}.ncard = 252 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

open Finset

def a (n : ‚Ñï) := ‚àë i in Finset.Icc 1 n, i

def S (m : ‚Ñï) := ‚àë i in Finset.Icc 1 m, a i

theorem number_theory_211318 :
    {i | 1 ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ 2017 ‚àß 2 ‚à£ S i ‚àß ¬¨4 ‚à£ S i}.ncard = 252 := by 
  -- use induction to prove following two statement.
  have aneq (n : ‚Ñï) : 2 * a n = n * (n + 1) := by 
    induction n with
    | zero => 
      unfold a 
      simp
    | succ k ih => 
      have aux : a (k + 1) = a k + (k + 1) := by 
        unfold a
        refine sum_Icc_succ_top ?_ fun k => k
        linarith
      rw [aux]
      calc 
        _ = 2 * a k + (k + 1) * 2:= by ring
        _ = _ := by 
          rw [ih]
          ring
  have sneq (n : ‚Ñï) : 6 * S n = n * (n + 1) * (n + 2) := by 
    induction n with
    | zero => 
      simp
      unfold S
      simp
    | succ k ih => 
      have eq1 : S (k + 1) = S k + a (k + 1) := by 
        unfold S
        refine sum_Icc_succ_top ?_ a
        linarith
      rw [eq1]
      calc 
        _ = 6 * S k + 3 * (2 * a (k + 1)) := by 
          ring
        _ = _ := by 
          rw [ih, aneq ]
          ring
  let f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï := fun x => 8 * x + 3 
  have set_eq : {i | 1 ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ 2017 ‚àß 2 ‚à£ S i ‚àß ¬¨4 ‚à£ S i} = 
    Finset.image f (range 252) := by 
    -- by above we already prove that S n = 1/6*(n*(n+1)*(n+2))
    have aux2 (n : ‚Ñï): S n ‚â° 2 [MOD 4] ‚Üî n ‚â° 3 [MOD 8] := by
      have aux3 (m : ‚Ñï): S m ‚â° 2 [MOD 4] ‚Üî 6 * S m ‚â° 12 [MOD 24] := by 
        constructor
        intro h
        obtain h1 := Nat.modEq_iff_dvd.mp h
        apply Nat.modEq_iff_dvd.mpr
        omega
        intro h
        obtain h1 := Nat.ModEq.dvd h
        apply Nat.modEq_iff_dvd.mpr
        omega
      have aux4 (m : ‚Ñï): m ‚â° 3 [MOD 8] ‚Üî 6 * S m ‚â° 12 [MOD 24] := by
        constructor
        intro h
        rw [sneq]
        have aux : m * (m + 1) * (m + 2) ‚â° 4 [MOD 8] := by 
          calc 
            _ ‚â° m * ((m + 1) * (m + 2)) [MOD 8] := by 
              ring_nf
              congr
            _ ‚â° 3 * ((m + 1) * (m + 2)) [MOD 8] := by 
              exact Nat.ModEq.mul h rfl
            _ ‚â° 3 * (4 * (m + 2)) [MOD 8] := by 
              have modeq1 : (m + 1) * (m + 2) 
                ‚â° 4 * (m + 2) [MOD 8] := by 
                have modeq2 : m + 1 ‚â° 4 [MOD 8] := by 
                  obtain h1 := Nat.ModEq.dvd h
                  apply Nat.modEq_iff_dvd.mpr
                  omega
                exact Nat.ModEq.mul modeq2 rfl
              exact Nat.ModEq.mul rfl modeq1
            _ ‚â° 3 * (4 * 5) [MOD 8] := by 
              have modeq1 : m + 2 ‚â° 5 [MOD 8] := by
                obtain h1 := Nat.ModEq.dvd h
                apply Nat.modEq_iff_dvd.mpr
                omega
              have modeq2 : (4 * (m + 2)) ‚â° (4 * 5) [MOD 8] := by 
                exact Nat.ModEq.mul rfl modeq1
              exact Nat.ModEq.mul rfl modeq2
            _ ‚â° 4 [MOD 8] := by 
              apply Nat.modEq_iff_dvd.mpr
              omega
        have aux4 : m * (m + 1) * (m + 2) ‚â° 4 * 3 [MOD 8 * 3] := by 
          have aux5 : (m * (m + 1) * (m + 2)) * 3 ‚â° 4 * 3 [MOD 8 * 3] := by 
            exact Nat.ModEq.mul_right' 3 aux
          have aux6 : (m * (m + 1) * (m + 2))
            ‚â° (m * (m + 1) * (m + 2)) * 3[MOD 8 * 3] := by 
            apply Nat.modEq_iff_dvd.mpr
            have aux7 :  ‚Üë(m * (m + 1) * (m + 2) * 3) - ‚Üë(m * (m + 1) * (m + 2)) = (2 : ‚Ñ§) * ‚Üë(m * (m + 1) * (m + 2)) := by 
              norm_num
              ring
            rw [aux7]
            norm_cast
            have dvd1 : 8 ‚à£ 2 * (m * (m + 1) * (m + 2)) := by 
              have eq1 : 2 * (m * (m + 1) * (m + 2)) = 
                (2 * (m + 1)) * (m * (m + 2)) := by 
                ring
              have dvdaux : 8 ‚à£ (2 * (m + 1)) := by
                zify
                obtain h1 := Nat.ModEq.dvd h
                obtain ‚ü®k, hk‚ü© := h1
                have meq : (m : ‚Ñ§) = 3 - (8 : ‚Ñï)* k := by 
                  rw [‚Üêhk]
                  norm_num
                rw [meq]
                omega
              rw [eq1]
              exact Dvd.dvd.mul_right dvdaux _
            have dvd2 : 3 ‚à£ 2 * (m * (m + 1) * (m + 2)) := by 
              by_cases hm : m % 3 = 0 
              have dvd1 : 3 ‚à£ m := by 
                omega
              have eq1 : 2 * (m * (m + 1) * (m + 2)) = 
                m * (2 * (m + 1) * (m + 2)) := by 
                ring
              rw [eq1]
              exact Dvd.dvd.mul_right dvd1 _
              by_cases hm : m % 3 = 1
              have dvd2 : 3 ‚à£ m + 2 := by 
                omega
              have eq2 : 2 * (m * (m + 1) * (m + 2)) =
                (m + 2) * (2 * (m * (m + 1))) := by
                ring
              rw [eq2]
              exact Dvd.dvd.mul_right dvd2 _
              have hm' : m % 3 = 2 := by omega
              have dvd3 : 3 ‚à£ m + 1 := by omega
              have eq3 : 2 * (m * (m + 1) * (m + 2)) =
                (m + 1) * (2 * (m * (m + 2))) := by
                ring
              rw [eq3]
              exact Dvd.dvd.mul_right dvd3 _
            exact Nat.Coprime.mul_dvd_of_dvd_of_dvd rfl dvd1 dvd2
          calc 
            _ ‚â° m * (m + 1) * (m + 2) * 3 [MOD 8 * 3] := by 
              exact aux6
            _ ‚â° 4 * 3 [MOD 8 * 3] := by
              exact aux5
        norm_num at aux4
        exact aux4
        -- 6 * S m ‚â° 12 [MOD 24] ‚Üí m ‚â° 3 [MOD 8]
        intro h
        rw [sneq] at h
        -- discuss by_cases the residue of m modulo 8 can only be 3
        -- skip the discussion

        sorry    
      refine iff_iff_implies_and_implies.mpr ?_
      constructor
      intro h
      apply (aux4 n).mpr
      exact (aux3 n).mp h
      intro h
      apply (aux3 n).mpr
      exact (aux4 n).mp h
    refine Eq.symm (Set.ext ?_)
    -- prove the two set are equivalence
    -- namely, {i | 1 ‚â§ i ‚àß i ‚â§ 2017 ‚àß 2 ‚à£ S i ‚àß ¬¨4 ‚à£ S i} = ‚Üë(image f (range 252))
    intro x
    constructor
    intro hx
    simp at hx
    obtain ‚ü®k, hk, hkeq‚ü© := hx
    unfold f at hkeq
    simp
    constructor
    linarith
    constructor
    linarith
    have xmod : x ‚â° 3 [MOD 8] := by 
      apply Nat.modEq_iff_dvd.mpr
      rw [‚Üêhkeq]
      omega
    obtain h1 := (aux2 x).mpr xmod
    rw [Nat.modEq_iff_dvd] at h1
    constructor
    omega
    omega
    -- the other direction
    intro hx
    simp at hx
    obtain ‚ü®k, hk, h1, h2‚ü© := hx
    simp
    have xmod : x ‚â° 3 [MOD 8] := by
      apply (aux2 x).mp
      rw [Nat.modEq_iff_dvd]
      omega
    obtain xmod1 := Nat.ModEq.symm xmod
    obtain h3 := Nat.ModEq.dvd xmod1
    obtain ‚ü®t, ht‚ü© := h3
    have xeq : (x : ‚Ñ§) = (8 : ‚Ñï) * t + 3 := by 
      rw [‚Üê ht]
      norm_num
    norm_cast at xeq
    have aux : ‚àÉ (s : ‚Ñï), t = ‚Üës := by 
      have tge : t ‚â• 0 := by 
        linarith
      exact Int.eq_ofNat_of_zero_le tge
    obtain ‚ü®s, hs‚ü© := aux
    use s
    constructor
    linarith
    unfold f
    zify
    rw [‚Üêhs]
    exact Eq.symm xeq
  rw [set_eq]
  have eq_aux : (image f (range 252) : Set ‚Ñï).ncard = 
    (range 252 : Set ‚Ñï).ncard := by
    simp
    refine Set.ncard_image_of_injective (Set.Iio 252) ?_
    unfold f
    refine injective_of_le_imp_le (fun k => 8 * k + 3) ?_
    intro x y hxy
    simp at hxy
    exact hxy
  rw [eq_aux]
  have eq_aux' : (‚Üë(range 252) : Set ‚Ñï).ncard
    = (range 252).card := by 
    sorry
  rw [eq_aux']
  simp

informal_statement:
For a nonnegative integer $n$, let $s(n)$ be the sum of digits of the binary representation of $n$. Prove that

$$
\sum_{n=0}^{2^{2022}-1} \frac{(-1)^{s(n)}}{2022+n}>0
$$
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

theorem iteratedDeriv_sub_lm.{u_1, u_2} : ‚àÄ {ùïú : Type u_1} [inst : NontriviallyNormedField ùïú] {F : Type u_2}
  [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_2 : NormedSpace ùïú F] {n : ‚Ñï} {x : ùïú} {f g : ùïú ‚Üí F},
  ContDiffAt ùïú (‚Üën) f x ‚Üí
    ContDiffAt ùïú (‚Üën) g x ‚Üí iteratedDeriv n (f - g) x = iteratedDeriv n f x - iteratedDeriv n g x := sorry

theorem Finset.prod_neg.{u_1, u_3} : ‚àÄ {Œπ : Type u_1} {Œ± : Type u_3} {s : Finset Œπ} {f : Œπ ‚Üí Œ±} [inst : CommMonoid Œ±]
  [inst_1 : HasDistribNeg Œ±], ‚àè x ‚àà s, -f x = (-1) ^ s.card * ‚àè x ‚àà s, f x := sorry

open Finset

/-For a nonnegative integer $n$, let $s(n)$ be the sum of digits of the binary representation of $n$. Prove that

$$
\sum_{n=0}^{2^{2022}-1} \frac{(-1)^{s(n)}}{2022+n}>0
$$-/
theorem number_theory_610480 {s : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï} (hs : ‚àÄ n, s n = (Nat.digits 2 n).sum) :
    0 < ‚àë n ‚àà range (2 ^ 2022), (-1 : ‚Ñù) ^ s n / (2022 + n) := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

theorem iteratedDeriv_sub_lm.{u_1, u_2} : ‚àÄ {ùïú : Type u_1} [inst : NontriviallyNormedField ùïú] {F : Type u_2}
  [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_2 : NormedSpace ùïú F] {n : ‚Ñï} {x : ùïú} {f g : ùïú ‚Üí F},
  ContDiffAt ùïú (‚Üën) f x ‚Üí
    ContDiffAt ùïú (‚Üën) g x ‚Üí iteratedDeriv n (f - g) x = iteratedDeriv n f x - iteratedDeriv n g x := sorry

theorem Finset.prod_neg.{u_1, u_3} : ‚àÄ {Œπ : Type u_1} {Œ± : Type u_3} {s : Finset Œπ} {f : Œπ ‚Üí Œ±} [inst : CommMonoid Œ±]
  [inst_1 : HasDistribNeg Œ±], ‚àè x ‚àà s, -f x = (-1) ^ s.card * ‚àè x ‚àà s, f x := sorry

open Finset

/-For a nonnegative integer $n$, let $s(n)$ be the sum of digits of the binary representation of $n$. Prove that

$$
\sum_{n=0}^{2^{2022}-1} \frac{(-1)^{s(n)}}{2022+n}>0
$$-/
theorem number_theory_610480 {s : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï} (hs : ‚àÄ n, s n = (Nat.digits 2 n).sum) :
    0 < ‚àë n ‚àà range (2 ^ 2022), (-1 : ‚Ñù) ^ s n / (2022 + n) := by
-- Define a sequence of functions $f_k$ to be $‚àë n ‚àà range (2 ^ k), (-1 : ‚Ñù) ^ s n / (x + n)$
  let f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí (‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù) := fun k x => ‚àë n ‚àà range (2 ^ k), (-1 : ‚Ñù) ^ s n / (x + n)
-- Prove that $f$ has a recursion formula
  have fsucc : ‚àÄ k, ‚àÄ x, f (k + 1) x = f k x - f k (x + 2 ^ k) := by
    intro k x; calc
      _ = ‚àë n ‚àà range (2 ^ (k + 1)), (-1 : ‚Ñù) ^ s n / (x + n) := by dsimp [f]
      _ = _ := by
        rw [pow_succ, mul_two, sum_range_add, ‚Üê sub_neg_eq_add]
        congr; dsimp [f]
        rw [‚Üê sum_neg_distrib]; apply sum_congr rfl
        intro i hi; simp at hi; push_cast
        rw [‚Üê add_assoc, ‚Üê neg_div]; congr
        rw [neg_eq_neg_one_mul, ‚Üê pow_succ']
        rw [neg_one_pow_eq_pow_mod_two]
        nth_rw 2 [neg_one_pow_eq_pow_mod_two]
        have : (Nat.digits 2 i).length ‚â§ k := by
          by_cases h : i = 0; simp [h]
          rw [Nat.digits_len, Nat.add_one_le_iff]
          apply Nat.log_lt_of_lt_pow
          any_goals assumption
          simp
        rw [hs, show 2^k = 2^k*1 by simp]
        rw [show k = (Nat.digits 2 i).length+(k-(Nat.digits 2 i).length) by omega]
        nth_rw 2 [add_comm]; rw [‚Üê Nat.digits_append_zeroes_append_digits]
        simp [add_assoc, hs]
        all_goals simp
-- Prove that $f_k$ is smooth on $x>0$
  have fcontD : ‚àÄ k, ContDiffOn ‚Ñù (‚ä§ : ENat) (f k) (Set.Ioi 0) := by
    intro k; dsimp [f]; apply ContDiffOn.sum
    intros; apply ContDiffOn.div; exact contDiffOn_const
    apply ContDiffOn.add; exact contDiffOn_id'
    exact contDiffOn_const
    simp; intros; positivity
-- Prove the key result that $(-1)^i$ times the i-th derivative of $f_k$ is always positive for $x>0$
  have key : ‚àÄ k, ‚àÄ x > 0, ‚àÄ i, 0 < (-1) ^ i * iteratedDeriv i (f k) x := by
  -- We proceed by induction
    intro k; induction k with
    | zero =>
    -- Base step
      simp [f, hs, iteratedDeriv_eq_iterate]; intros
      simp only [‚Üê neg_add', prod_neg, card_range]
      rw [‚Üê mul_assoc, ‚Üê mul_assoc, ‚Üê pow_add, Even.neg_one_pow]
      positivity; simp [Nat.even_iff]
    | succ k ih =>
    -- Induction step
      intro x xpos i; rw [funext_iff.mpr (fsucc _)]
      have aux : Set.Ioi 0 ‚àà nhds x := by
        rw [mem_nhds_iff_exists_Ioo_subset]
        use x / 2, 2 * x; simp [Set.subset_def]; split_ands
        exact xpos; linarith only [xpos]
        intros; linarith
      have : (fun x => f k x - f k (x + 2 ^ k)) = f k - fun x => f k (x + 2 ^ k) := by
        ext; simp
      rw [this, iteratedDeriv_sub_lm, mul_sub, sub_pos]
      simp [iteratedDeriv_comp_add_const]
    -- It suffices to show the function $(-1)^i$ times the i-th derivative of $f_k$ is strictly decreasing when $0< x$
      suffices : StrictAntiOn (fun x => (-1) ^ i * iteratedDeriv i (f k) x) (Set.Ioi 0)
      ¬∑ apply this; simp; exact xpos
        simp; positivity
        rw [lt_add_iff_pos_right]; positivity
    -- Apply the induction hypothesis `ih` to show the derivative of the function in question is negative
      apply strictAntiOn_of_deriv_neg; apply convex_Ioi
      ¬∑ sorry
      ¬∑ intro x hx; simp at hx
        rw [deriv_const_mul, ‚Üê iteratedDeriv_succ]
        specialize ih x hx (i+1); rw [pow_succ] at ih
        linarith only [ih]; sorry
      ¬∑ specialize fcontD k; rw [contDiffOn_infty] at fcontD
        specialize fcontD i x (by simp; exact xpos)
        apply fcontD.contDiffAt aux
      specialize fcontD k; rw [contDiffOn_infty] at fcontD
      specialize fcontD i (x + 2 ^ k) (by simp; positivity)
      apply ContDiffWithinAt.contDiffAt _ aux
      have : (fun x => f k (x + 2 ^ k)) = (f k) ‚àò (fun x => x + 2 ^ k) := by
        ext; simp
      rw [this]
      replace this : Set.MapsTo (fun (x : ‚Ñù) => x + 2 ^ k) (Set.Ioi 0) (Set.Ioi 0):= by
        intro x; simp; intro; positivity
      apply ContDiffWithinAt.comp _ _ _ this; exact fcontD
      apply ContDiff.contDiffWithinAt; apply ContDiff.add
      exact contDiff_id'; exact contDiff_const
-- Specialize `key` to $k=2022$, $x=2022$ and $i=0$ to finish the goal
  specialize key 2022 2022 (by simp) 0
  simp only [pow_zero, iteratedDeriv_zero, one_mul, f] at key
  exact key

soln_description:
Scoring: 1 point is awarded for concluding that $r$ is not 2, and another 2 points for determining that $p=2$. 1 point is awarded for the case $q=2$, and 3 points for eliminating the case $q>2$.

A written solution of $(2,2,5)$ earns 1 point even if it is not justified.
informal_statement:
## Task A-2.3.

Determine all triples of prime numbers $(p, q, r)$ for which

$$
p^{q}=r-1
$$
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

/-
## Task A-2.3.

Determine all triples of prime numbers $(p, q, r)$ for which

$$
p^{q}=r-1
$$
-/

theorem number_theory_215307 (p q r : ‚Ñï) (hp : p.Prime) (hq : q.Prime) (hr : r.Prime)  (h : p ^ q = r - 1) : p = 2 ‚àß q = 2 ‚àß r = 5 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

/-
## Task A-2.3.

Determine all triples of prime numbers $(p, q, r)$ for which

$$
p^{q}=r-1
$$
-/

theorem number_theory_215307 (p q r : ‚Ñï) (hp : p.Prime) (hq : q.Prime) (hr : r.Prime)  (h : p ^ q = r - 1) : p = 2 ‚àß q = 2 ‚àß r = 5 := by

  have pge2 : 2 ‚â§ p := Nat.Prime.two_le hp
  have qge2 : 2 ‚â§ q := Nat.Prime.two_le hq
  have rge2 : 2 ‚â§ r := Nat.Prime.two_le hr

  --By checking the parity, we have that r has to be odd and p has to be even, so p = 2.
  have oddr : Odd r := by 
    by_contra noddr
    have evenr : Even r := by exact Nat.not_odd_iff_even.mp noddr
    have re : r=2 := by exact (Nat.Prime.even_iff hr).mp evenr
    rw [re] at h;
    simp at h
    have : 4 ‚â§ p^q := by 
      have : p^2 ‚â§ p^q := by exact Nat.pow_le_pow_of_le pge2 qge2
      have : 2^2 ‚â§ p^2 := by exact Nat.pow_le_pow_of_le_left pge2 2
      linarith
    linarith
  have evenrm1 : Even (r-1) := by refine Nat.Odd.sub_odd oddr ?_; exact Nat.odd_iff.mpr rfl

  have pe : p = 2 := by
    have evenp : Even p := by 
      by_contra nevenp
      have oddp : Odd p := by exact Nat.not_even_iff_odd.mp nevenp
      have oddpq : Odd (p^q) := by exact Odd.pow oddp
      have : Odd (r-1) := by rw [‚Üêh]; exact oddpq
      have : ¬¨ Even (r-1) := by exact Nat.not_even_iff_odd.mpr this
      contradiction
    exact (Nat.Prime.even_iff hp).mp evenp
  
  --If q = 2, then we must have r = 5.
  by_cases qe : q = 2 
  simp [pe,qe] at h
  omega

  --For q > 2, then we will have 3 ‚à£ r, but then r = 3 and we have a contradiction.
  exfalso
  have eq' : p^q + 1 = r := by omega
  rw [pe] at eq'
  have oddq : Odd q := by exact Nat.Prime.odd_of_ne_two hq qe
  have d3 : 3 ‚à£ 2 ^ q + 1:= by 
    have : 2 ‚â° -1 [ZMOD 3] := by decide
    have con: 2^q ‚â° (-1)^q [ZMOD 3] := by exact Int.ModEq.pow q this
    have : (-1)^q = -1 := by exact Odd.neg_one_pow oddq
    rw [this] at con
    have : 2^q + 1 ‚â° (-1) + 1 [ZMOD 3] := by exact Int.ModEq.add con rfl
    simp at this
    refine Nat.dvd_of_mod_eq_zero ?_
    zify
    exact this
  rw [eq'] at d3
  have re: r = 3 := by 
    rw [Nat.prime_dvd_prime_iff_eq] at d3;
    symm
    exact d3
    norm_num
    exact hr
  rw [re] at eq'
  have qe : q = 1 := by 
    have: 2^q = 2 := by linarith
    rw [Nat.pow_eq_self_iff] at this
    exact this
    linarith
  rw [qe] at hq
  absurd hq; exact Nat.not_prime_one

informal_statement:
Suppose that $x, y$, and $z$ are complex numbers of equal magnitude that satisfy

$$
x+y+z=-\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}-i \sqrt{5}
$$

and

$$
x y z=\sqrt{3}+i \sqrt{5} .
$$

If $x=x_{1}+i x_{2}, y=y_{1}+i y_{2}$, and $z=z_{1}+i z_{2}$ for real $x_{1}, x_{2}, y_{1}, y_{2}, z_{1}$, and $z_{2}$, then

$$
\left(x_{1} x_{2}+y_{1} y_{2}+z_{1} z_{2}\right)^{2}
$$

can be written as $\frac{a}{b}$ for relatively prime positive integers $a$ and $b$. Compute $100 a+b$.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

theorem Real.rpow_pow_comm : ‚àÄ {x : ‚Ñù}, 0 ‚â§ x ‚Üí ‚àÄ (y : ‚Ñù) (n : ‚Ñï), (x ^ y) ^ n = (x ^ n) ^ y := sorry

open Complex

/-Suppose that $x, y$, and $z$ are complex numbers of equal magnitude that satisfy

$$
x+y+z=-\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}-i \sqrt{5}
$$

and

$$
x y z=\sqrt{3}+i \sqrt{5} .
$$

If $x=x_{1}+i x_{2}, y=y_{1}+i y_{2}$, and $z=z_{1}+i z_{2}$ for real $x_{1}, x_{2}, y_{1}, y_{2}, z_{1}$, and $z_{2}$, then

$$
\left(x_{1} x_{2}+y_{1} y_{2}+z_{1} z_{2}\right)^{2}
$$

can be written as $\frac{a}{b}$ for relatively prime positive integers $a$ and $b$. Compute $100 a+b$.-/
theorem algebra_610264 {x y z : ‚ÑÇ} {r : ‚Ñù} (xnm : ‚Äñx‚Äñ = r) (ynm : ‚Äñy‚Äñ = r) (znm : ‚Äñz‚Äñ = r)
    (h1 : x + y + z = -‚àö3 / 2 - I * ‚àö5) (h2 : x * y * z = ‚àö3 + I * ‚àö5) :
    ‚àÉ q : ‚Ñö, (x.re * x.im + y.re * y.im + z.re * z.im) ^ 2 = q ‚àß 100 * q.num + q.den = 1516 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

theorem Real.rpow_pow_comm : ‚àÄ {x : ‚Ñù}, 0 ‚â§ x ‚Üí ‚àÄ (y : ‚Ñù) (n : ‚Ñï), (x ^ y) ^ n = (x ^ n) ^ y := sorry

open Complex

/-Suppose that $x, y$, and $z$ are complex numbers of equal magnitude that satisfy

$$
x+y+z=-\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}-i \sqrt{5}
$$

and

$$
x y z=\sqrt{3}+i \sqrt{5} .
$$

If $x=x_{1}+i x_{2}, y=y_{1}+i y_{2}$, and $z=z_{1}+i z_{2}$ for real $x_{1}, x_{2}, y_{1}, y_{2}, z_{1}$, and $z_{2}$, then

$$
\left(x_{1} x_{2}+y_{1} y_{2}+z_{1} z_{2}\right)^{2}
$$

can be written as $\frac{a}{b}$ for relatively prime positive integers $a$ and $b$. Compute $100 a+b$.-/
theorem algebra_610264 {x y z : ‚ÑÇ} {r : ‚Ñù} (xnm : ‚Äñx‚Äñ = r) (ynm : ‚Äñy‚Äñ = r) (znm : ‚Äñz‚Äñ = r)
    (h1 : x + y + z = -‚àö3 / 2 - I * ‚àö5) (h2 : x * y * z = ‚àö3 + I * ‚àö5) :
    ‚àÉ q : ‚Ñö, (x.re * x.im + y.re * y.im + z.re * z.im) ^ 2 = q ‚àß 100 * q.num + q.den = 1516 := by
-- Prove that $x$, $y$ and $z$ are nonzero
  have : x ‚â† 0 ‚àß y ‚â† 0 ‚àß z ‚â† 0 := by
    split_ands; all_goals intro h; symm at h2
    all_goals simp [h, Complex.ext_iff] at h2
  rcases this with ‚ü®xne, yne, zne‚ü©
-- Apply norm function to both sides of `h2` and solve for $r$
  let req := h2; apply_fun fun t => ‚Äñt‚Äñ at req
  rw [norm_mul, norm_mul, xnm, ynm, znm] at req
  norm_num [abs_eq_sqrt_sq_add_sq] at req
  rw [show (8:‚Ñù) = 2^3 by ring, Real.sqrt_eq_rpow] at req
  rw [‚Üê Real.rpow_pow_comm, show r*r*r = r^3 by ring] at req
  rw [pow_left_inj‚ÇÄ, ‚Üê Real.sqrt_eq_rpow] at req
-- Rewrite the norm assumptions to conjugation forms and simplify
  rw [‚Üê pow_left_inj‚ÇÄ _ _ (show 2‚â†0 by simp), req, ‚Üê ofReal_inj] at xnm ynm znm
  simp at xnm ynm znm; rw [‚Üê norm_eq_abs, ‚Üê conj_mul'] at xnm ynm znm
  rw [‚Üê eq_div_iff] at xnm ynm znm
-- Apply conjugation to both sides of `h1` and simplify
  have h3 := h1; apply_fun fun t => (starRingEnd ‚ÑÇ) t at h3
  simp [xnm, ynm, znm, conj_eq_iff_re.mpr] at h3
  field_simp at h3; rw [h2] at h3
  ring_nf at h3; rw [‚Üê ofReal_pow, ‚Üê ofReal_pow] at h3
  norm_num at h3
-- Denote the expression in the goal by $Q$ and prove it equals the imaginary part of $x^2+y^2+z^2$
  set Q := x.re * x.im + y.re * y.im + z.re * z.im with hQ1
  clear_value Q
  have hQ2 : Q = 1 / 2 * (x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 + z ^ 2).im := by
    simp [pow_two, hQ1]; ring
-- Solve for $Q$ and finish the goal
  rw [show x^2+y^2+z^2 = (x+y+z)^2-1/2*(y*x*4+y*z*4+x*z*4) by ring] at hQ2
  rw [h1, h3] at hQ2; ring_nf at hQ2
  rw [‚Üê ofReal_pow, ‚Üê ofReal_pow] at hQ2
  norm_num at hQ2; norm_num [hQ2, mul_pow]
  use 15/16; norm_num
-- Finish the rest trivial goals
  any_goals assumption
  any_goals positivity
  all_goals rw [‚Üê znm]; positivity

soln_description:
To solve the given equation $x^2 - 3x - 4 + (y^2 - 6y + 9)i = 0$, we must consider the conditions for the complex numbers to be equal. This happens when both their real parts and their imaginary parts are independently equal.

So we have:
$$
\begin{cases}
x^2 - 3x - 4 = 0 \\
y^2 - 6y + 9 = 0
\end{cases}
$$

Let's solve each equation separately:

1. For the real part:
$x^2 - 3x - 4 = 0$
can be factored into
$(x - 4)(x + 1) = 0$.
This gives us two possible solutions for $x$: 
$$
\begin{cases}
x = 4 \\
x = -1
\end{cases}
$$

2. For the imaginary part:
$y^2 - 6y + 9 = 0$
can be rewritten as
$(y - 3)^2 = 0$.
This implies that there is only one solution for $y$:
$$y = 3$$

Combining the solutions for $x$ and $y$, we get two real number pairs:
$(-1, 3)$ and $(4, 3)$.

Hence, the number of points is $\boxed{2}$.
informal_statement: The number of points represented by the real number pairs $(x, y)$ that satisfy the equation $x^2 - 3x - 4 + (y^2 - 6y + 9)i = 0$ is __________.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib
import Aesop

open BigOperators Complex

/-The number of points represented by the real number pairs $(x, y)$ that satisfy the equation $x^2 - 3x - 4 + (y^2 - 6y + 9)i = 0$ is ______2____.-/

theorem algebra_8974: { (x , y) : ‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù | (x^2-3*x-4) + (y^2-6*y+9)*I=0 }.ncard=2:=by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib
import Aesop

open BigOperators Complex

/-The number of points represented by the real number pairs $(x, y)$ that satisfy the equation $x^2 - 3x - 4 + (y^2 - 6y + 9)i = 0$ is ______2____.-/

theorem algebra_8974: { (x , y) : ‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù | (x^2-3*x-4) + (y^2-6*y+9)*I=0 }.ncard=2:=by
--We prove that the set is exactly the pairs {(-1,3) , (4,3)}
  have ans:{ (x , y) : ‚Ñù √ó ‚Ñù | (x^2-3*x-4) + (y^2-6*y+9)*I=0 }=({(-1,3) , (4,3)}):=by
    apply Set.ext
--Check their elements are the same.
    simp only [Set.mem_setOf_eq, Set.mem_insert_iff, Set.mem_singleton_iff, Prod.forall,Prod.mk.injEq]
    intro x y
    have aux: Complex.ofReal ( x ^ 2 - 3 * x - 4)=((Complex.ofReal x) ^ 2 - 3 * Complex.ofReal x - 4)‚àß (Complex.ofReal (y ^ 2 - 6 * y + 9) = (Complex.ofReal y ^ 2 - 6 *Complex.ofReal y + 9)):=by sorry
    constructor
--We prove the first side by check the real part and imaginary part.
    ¬∑ intro h
      rw[‚Üêor_and_right,‚Üêsub_eq_zero,sub_neg_eq_add];nth_rewrite 2[‚Üêsub_eq_zero];nth_rewrite 3[‚Üêsub_eq_zero]
      rw[‚Üê_root_.mul_eq_zero];nth_rewrite 2[‚Üêsq_eq_zero_iff]
      ring_nf;
      rw[Complex.ext_iff,zero_im,zero_re] at h
      rcases h with ‚ü®hre,him‚ü©
      rw[add_re] at hre;rw[add_im] at him
      rw[‚Üêaux.1,Complex.ofReal_im (x ^ 2 - 3 * x - 4),zero_add,Complex.mul_I_im,‚Üêaux.2,ofReal_re] at him
      rw[‚Üêaux.2,him] at hre
      simp only [ofReal_re, ofReal_im, mul_zero, sub_zero,ofReal_zero, zero_mul, zero_re, add_zero,‚Üêaux.1] at hre
      nth_rw 1[‚Üêhre]; nth_rw 1[‚Üêhim];ring_nf;simp only [and_self]
    ¬∑ rintro (‚ü®h1,h2‚ü©|‚ü®h1,h2‚ü©);
      ¬∑ rw[h1,h2];norm_num;
      ¬∑ rw[h1,h2];norm_num
--A set consisting of two elements has cardinality 2.
  rw[ans];apply Set.ncard_pair;norm_num

soln_description:
6. Let any $r \in \mathbb{Q}, r \neq 0$, from (2) we know that either $r \in S$ or $-r \in S$ holds. By (1), if $r \in S$, then $r^{2} \in S$; if $-r \in S$, then $r^{2}=(-r) \cdot(-r) \in S$. In either case, $r^{2} \in S$.
Take $r=1$, then $1 \in S$. Thus, by (1): $2=1+1 \in S, 3=1+2 \in S \cdots$ It follows that all positive integers belong to $S$.
Let $p, q \in \mathbb{N}_{+}$, by (1) we know $pq \in S$. Also, from the previous proof, $\frac{1}{q^{2}} \in S$, therefore, $\frac{p}{q}=pq \cdot \left(\frac{1}{q^{2}}\right) \in S$. Hence, $S$ contains all positive rational numbers.
By (2), 0 and all negative rational numbers do not belong to $S$. Therefore, $S$ is the set of all positive rational numbers.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib
open Nat Real Finset Set
noncomputable section

/-6. Let $S$ be the set of rational numbers satisfying the following conditions:
(1) If $a \in S, b \in S$, then $a+b \in S, a b \in S$;
(2) For any rational number $r$, exactly one of the three relations holds: $r \in S, -r \in S, r=0$. Prove that $S$ is the set of all positive rational numbers.-/
theorem number_theory_600123 (S : Set ‚Ñö)
  (hS : ‚àÄ x ‚àà S, ‚àÄ y ‚àà S, x + y ‚àà S ‚àß x * y ‚àà S)
  (hS' : ‚àÄ r : ‚Ñö, (r ‚àà S ‚à® -r ‚àà S ‚à® r = 0) ‚àß ¬¨(r ‚àà S ‚àß -r ‚àà S) ‚àß ¬¨(r ‚àà S ‚àß r = 0) ‚àß ¬¨(-r ‚àà S ‚àß r = 0)) :
  S = {x | 0 < x} := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib
open Nat Real Finset Set
noncomputable section

/-6. Let $S$ be the set of rational numbers satisfying the following conditions:
(1) If $a \in S, b \in S$, then $a+b \in S, a b \in S$;
(2) For any rational number $r$, exactly one of the three relations holds: $r \in S, -r \in S, r=0$. Prove that $S$ is the set of all positive rational numbers.-/
theorem number_theory_600123 (S : Set ‚Ñö)
  (hS : ‚àÄ x ‚àà S, ‚àÄ y ‚àà S, x + y ‚àà S ‚àß x * y ‚àà S)
  (hS' : ‚àÄ r : ‚Ñö, (r ‚àà S ‚à® -r ‚àà S ‚à® r = 0) ‚àß ¬¨(r ‚àà S ‚àß -r ‚àà S) ‚àß ¬¨(r ‚àà S ‚àß r = 0) ‚àß ¬¨(-r ‚àà S ‚àß r = 0)) :
  S = {x | 0 < x} := by
  apply Set.ext
  intro x
  -- Prove: If $x > 0$, then $x ‚àà S$.
  have h_pos_rat : ‚àÄ x : ‚Ñö, x > 0 ‚Üí x ‚àà S := by
    intro x hx
    -- Prove that $r^2 ‚àà S$ for any non-zero $r$.
    have h_square : ‚àÄ r : ‚Ñö, r ‚â† 0 ‚Üí r * r ‚àà S := by
      intro r hr
      have h_cases := (hS' r).1
      cases h_cases with
      | inl h_r =>
        exact (hS r h_r r h_r).2
      | inr h_cases =>
        cases h_cases with
        | inl h_neg_r =>
          have : r * r = (-r) * (-r) := by ring
          rw [this]
          exact (hS (-r) h_neg_r (-r) h_neg_r).2
        | inr h_zero =>
          exact absurd h_zero hr
    -- Prove that $1 ‚àà S$.
    have h_one : 1 ‚àà S := by
      have h‚ÇÅ : (1 : ‚Ñö) ‚â† 0 := by norm_num
      have h‚ÇÇ : (1 : ‚Ñö) * (1 : ‚Ñö) = 1 := by norm_num
      rw [‚Üê h‚ÇÇ]
      exact h_square 1 h‚ÇÅ
    -- Prove that positive integers (as rationals) are in $S$.
    have h_pos_int : ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, n ‚â† 0 ‚Üí (n : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := by
      intro n hn
      induction n with
      | zero =>
        contradiction
      | succ n' ih =>
        cases n' with
        | zero =>
          simp
          exact h_one
        | succ m =>
          have h‚ÇÅ : m + 1 ‚â† 0 := by norm_num
          have h_ind : (m + 1 : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := by
            exact_mod_cast ih h‚ÇÅ
          have h‚ÇÇ : (m + 1 + 1 : ‚Ñö) = (m + 1 : ‚Ñö) + 1 := by norm_cast
          show (succ (succ m) : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S
          have h‚ÇÉ : (succ (succ m) : ‚Ñö) = (m + 1 + 1 : ‚Ñö) := by
            simp [Nat.succ_eq_add_one]
          rw [h‚ÇÉ, h‚ÇÇ]
          exact (hS (m + 1) h_ind 1 h_one).1
    -- Prove that $1/(q*q) ‚àà S$ for non-zero natural $q$.
    have h_inv_square : ‚àÄ q : ‚Ñï, q ‚â† 0 ‚Üí (1 / (q * q) : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := by
      intro q hq
      have h‚ÇÅ : (q : ‚Ñö) ‚â† 0 := by norm_cast
      have h‚ÇÇ : (q : ‚Ñö) * (q : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := h_square q h‚ÇÅ
      have h‚ÇÉ : (q : ‚Ñö) * (q : ‚Ñö) = (q * q : ‚Ñö) := by norm_cast
      have h‚ÇÑ : (q * q : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := by rw [‚Üê h‚ÇÉ]; exact h‚ÇÇ
      have h‚ÇÖ : (q * q : ‚Ñö) ‚â† 0 := by norm_cast; exact Nat.mul_ne_zero hq hq
      have h‚ÇÜ : (1 / (q * q) : ‚Ñö) = (1 / (q * q : ‚Ñö)) := by norm_cast
      have h‚Çá : (1 / q : ‚Ñö) * (1 / q : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := by
        have h‚Çà : (1 / q : ‚Ñö) ‚â† 0 := by field_simp [h‚ÇÅ]
        exact h_square (1 / q) h‚Çà
      have h‚Çà : (1 / q : ‚Ñö) * (1 / q : ‚Ñö) = (1 / (q * q) : ‚Ñö) := by
        field_simp [h‚ÇÅ]
      have h‚Çâ : (1 / (q * q) : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := by rw [‚Üê h‚Çà]; exact h‚Çá
      exact h‚ÇÜ ‚ñ∏ h‚Çâ
    -- Prove that positive rationals $p/q ‚àà S$.
    have h_pos_rat : ‚àÄ p q : ‚Ñï, p ‚â† 0 ‚Üí q ‚â† 0 ‚Üí (p / q : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := by
      intro p q hp hq
      have h‚ÇÅ : (p : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := h_pos_int p hp
      have h‚ÇÇ : (q : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := h_pos_int q hq
      have h‚ÇÉ : (1 / (q * q) : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := h_inv_square q hq
      have h‚ÇÑ : (p : ‚Ñö) * (q : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := (hS p h‚ÇÅ q h‚ÇÇ).2
      have h‚ÇÖ : (p : ‚Ñö) * (q : ‚Ñö) = (p * q : ‚Ñö) := by norm_cast
      have h‚ÇÑ' : (p * q : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := by rw [‚Üê h‚ÇÖ]; exact h‚ÇÑ
      have h‚ÇÜ : (p / q : ‚Ñö) = (p * q : ‚Ñö) * (1 / (q * q) : ‚Ñö) := by
        field_simp; norm_cast; ring_nf
      rw [h‚ÇÜ]
      exact (hS (p * q) h‚ÇÑ' (1 / (q * q)) h‚ÇÉ).2
    -- Prove that any positive rational $x ‚àà S$.
    have h_x_pos_rat : x > 0 ‚Üí x ‚àà S := by
      intro h
      have h_rat : (x.num : ‚Ñö) / x.den = x := Rat.num_div_den x
      have h_den_pos : x.den > 0 := Rat.den_pos x
      have h_num_pos : x.num > 0 := by
        have h‚ÇÅ : (x.num : ‚Ñö) / x.den > 0 := by nlinarith
        have h‚ÇÇ : (x.den : ‚Ñö) > 0 := by exact_mod_cast h_den_pos
        have : (x.num : ‚Ñö) > 0 := by tauto
        exact Int.cast_pos.mp this
      have h_p : x.num.toNat ‚â† 0 := by omega
      have h_q : x.den ‚â† 0 := by omega
      have h_pq : (x.num.toNat / x.den : ‚Ñö) ‚àà S := h_pos_rat x.num.toNat x.den h_p h_q
      have h_eq : (x.num.toNat / x.den : ‚Ñö) = x := by
        have h‚ÇÅ : (x.num : ‚Ñö) = (x.num.toNat : ‚Ñö) := by
          have : x.num ‚â• 0 := le_of_lt h_num_pos
          have : (x.num.toNat : ‚Ñ§) = x.num := Int.toNat_of_nonneg this
          tauto
        have h‚ÇÇ : (x.num.toNat / x.den : ‚Ñö) = (x.num : ‚Ñö) / x.den := by
          rw [h‚ÇÅ]
        rw [‚Üê h_rat] at h‚ÇÇ
        have : (x.num.toNat / x.den : ‚Ñö) = x := by
          rw [‚Üê h_rat, h‚ÇÇ]
          simp only [Rat.num_div_den]
        rw [this]
      rw [h_eq] at h_pq
      exact h_pq
    exact h_x_pos_rat hx
  -- Prove $x ‚àà S ‚Üî x > 0$.
  have h_iff : x ‚àà S ‚Üî x > 0 := by
    constructor
    ¬∑ -- Prove: If $x ‚àà S$, then $x > 0$.
      intro hx
      have h_not_zero : x ‚â† 0 := by
        have h‚ÇÅ : ¬¨(x ‚àà S ‚àß x = 0) := (hS' x).2.2.1
        intro h_zero
        have h‚ÇÇ : x ‚àà S ‚àß x = 0 := ‚ü®hx, h_zero‚ü©
        exact h‚ÇÅ h‚ÇÇ
      have h_not_neg : ¬¨(-x ‚àà S) := by
        have h‚ÇÅ : ¬¨(x ‚àà S ‚àß -x ‚àà S) := (hS' x).2.1
        intro h_neg
        have h‚ÇÇ : x ‚àà S ‚àß -x ‚àà S := ‚ü®hx, h_neg‚ü©
        exact h‚ÇÅ h‚ÇÇ
      have h_pos : x > 0 := by
        by_contra h_npos
        have h_neg_or_zero : x < 0 ‚à® x = 0 := by
          have h_le_zero : x ‚â§ 0 := by simpa using h_npos
          exact le_iff_lt_or_eq.mp h_le_zero
        cases h_neg_or_zero with
        | inr h_zero => exact h_not_zero h_zero
        | inl h_neg =>
          have h_minus_x_pos : -x > 0 := by linarith
          have h_minus_x_in_S : -x ‚àà S := h_pos_rat (-x) h_minus_x_pos
          exact h_not_neg h_minus_x_in_S
      exact h_pos
    ¬∑ -- Prove: If $x > 0$, then $x ‚àà S$.
      intro hx
      exact h_pos_rat x hx
  -- Conclude set equality using h_iff.
  exact h_iff

soln_description:
I. solution. According to the data, $180{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{F}=100{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$, i.e., $1{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{F}=\frac{5}{9}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$.

In the first rounding, the maximum deviation is $\frac{1}{2}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{F}=\frac{5}{18}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$. In the second, the maximum deviation is $\frac{1}{2}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$. Nevertheless, the maximum deviation is not $\frac{1}{2}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}+\frac{5}{18}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}=\frac{14}{18}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$.

Indeed, whole Fahrenheit degrees cannot fall precisely between two whole Celsius degrees. According to the conversion, an entire Fahrenheit degree can only correspond to a fraction on the Celsius scale, where the denominator in the appropriate fractional form is 9. Therefore, in the rounding of Celsius degrees, the deviation is at most $\frac{4}{9}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$ instead of $\frac{1}{2}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$.

Thus, the deviation from the original is at most $\frac{4}{9}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}+\frac{5}{18}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}=\frac{13}{18}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}$.

II. solution. Let $(x)^{*}$ denote the number $x$ rounded to the nearest integer, and let $(x)_{*}=x-(x)^{*}$. Then $(x)_{*} \in[-0.5 ; 0.5]$. Let the temperature in Fahrenheit be $f$, then in Celsius it is

\[
\frac{f-32}{180} \cdot 100=\frac{5 f-160}{9}
\]

The question is, what is the maximum absolute value of $\frac{5 f-160}{9}-\left(\frac{5(f)^{*}-160}{9}\right)^{*}$. This can be transformed as follows:

\[
\begin{gathered}
\left|\frac{5\left((f)^{*}+(f)_{*}\right)-160}{9}-\left(\frac{5(f)^{*}-160}{9}\right)^{*}\right|= \\
=\left|\frac{5(f)^{*}-160}{9}-\left(\frac{5(f)^{*}-160}{9}\right)^{*}+\frac{5(f)_{*}}{9}\right|= \\
=\left|\left(\frac{5(f)^{*}-160}{9}\right)_{*}+\frac{5(f)_{*}}{9}\right| \leq\left|\left(\frac{5(f)^{*}-160}{9}\right)_{*}\right|+\left|\frac{5(f)_{*}}{9}\right|
\end{gathered}
\]

The maximum of the first term is $\frac{4}{9}$, because the numerator is an integer and the denominator is 9. The second term is at most $\frac{5 \cdot \frac{1}{2}}{9}=\frac{5}{18}$, so the sum is at most $\frac{4}{9}+\frac{5}{18}=\frac{13}{18}$. The sought difference is thus certainly not greater than $\frac{13}{18}$.

For $f=32.5$, equality holds, so the maximum deviation in Celsius is $\frac{13}{18}$.
informal_statement:
In America, temperature is measured in Fahrenheit. This is a uniform scale where the freezing point of water is $32^{\circ} \mathrm{F}$ and the boiling point is $212^{\circ} \mathrm{F}$.

Someone gives the temperature rounded to the nearest whole Fahrenheit degree, which we then convert to Celsius and round to the nearest whole degree again. What is the maximum possible difference between the resulting value and the original temperature in Celsius degrees?
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

/- In America, temperature is measured in Fahrenheit. This is a uniform scale where the freezing point of water is $32^{\circ} \mathrm{F}$ and the boiling point is $212^{\circ} \mathrm{F}$.

Someone gives the temperature rounded to the nearest whole Fahrenheit degree, which we then convert to Celsius and round to the nearest whole degree again. What is the maximum possible difference between the resulting value and the original temperature in Celsius degrees? -/
theorem algebra_210486 : IsGreatest {d |‚àÉ T : ‚Ñù, d = |(((T - 32) * (5 / 9 : ‚Ñù))) - round ((round (T) - 32) * (5 / 9 : ‚Ñù))|}  (13 / 18) := by

informal_statement:
Let $\mathbb{R}$ be the set of real numbers. Let $f: \mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ be a function such that for all real numbers $x$ and $y$, we have

$$
f\left(x^{2}\right)+f\left(y^{2}\right)=f(x+y)^{2}-2 x y
$$

Let $S=\sum_{n=-2019}^{2019} f(n)$. Determine the number of possible values of $S$.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

/-
Let $\mathbb{R}$ be the set of real numbers. Let $f: \mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ be a function such that for all real numbers $x$ and $y$, we have

$$
f\left(x^{2}\right)+f\left(y^{2}\right)=f(x+y)^{2}-2 x y
$$

Let $S=\sum_{n=-2019}^{2019} f(n)$. Determine the number of possible values of $S$.
-/
theorem problem_609988 :
    let P (f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù) := ‚àÄ x y, f (x^2) + f (y^2) = f (x + y)^2 - 2*x*y
    let S (f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù) := ‚àë n ‚àà Finset.Icc (-2019 : ‚Ñ§) 2019, f n
    Set.ncard {s : ‚Ñù | ‚àÉ f, P f ‚àß s = S f} = 2039191 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

/-
Let $\mathbb{R}$ be the set of real numbers. Let $f: \mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ be a function such that for all real numbers $x$ and $y$, we have

$$
f\left(x^{2}\right)+f\left(y^{2}\right)=f(x+y)^{2}-2 x y
$$

Let $S=\sum_{n=-2019}^{2019} f(n)$. Determine the number of possible values of $S$.
-/
theorem problem_609988 :
    let P (f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù) := ‚àÄ x y, f (x^2) + f (y^2) = f (x + y)^2 - 2*x*y
    let S (f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù) := ‚àë n ‚àà Finset.Icc (-2019 : ‚Ñ§) 2019, f n
    Set.ncard {s : ‚Ñù | ‚àÉ f, P f ‚àß s = S f} = 2039191 := by
  intros P S
  -- First, let's characterize the set of solutions of the functional equation.
  have hf (f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù) : P f ‚Üî (‚àÄ x, 0 ‚â§ x ‚Üí f x = x) ‚àß (‚àÄ x, f x = x ‚à® f x = -x) := by
    constructor
    ¬∑ intros hp
      -- Letting $y=-x$ gives
      -- $$ f\\left(x^{2}\\right)+f\\left(x^{2}\\right)=f(0)^{2}+2 x^{2} $$
      -- for all x
      have h‚ÇÅ x : f (x^2) + f (x^2) = f 0 ^ 2 + 2*x^2 := by
        simpa [pow_two, mul_assoc] using hp x (-x)
      -- When $x = 0$ the equation above gives a quadratic equation.
      have h‚ÇÇ : 2 * f 0 = f 0 ^ 2 := by
        have := h‚ÇÅ 0
        simpa [two_mul] using this
      -- This equation is simple enough that simp can solve it.
      have h‚ÇÇ' : f 0 = 0 ‚à® f 0 = 2 := by
        simp [pow_two] at h‚ÇÇ
        tauto
      -- Now, substituting `x = ‚àöx` into `h‚ÇÅ` gives a simpler equation for nonnegative x.
      have h‚ÇÉ x (hx : 0 ‚â§ x) : f x + f x = f 0 ^ 2 + 2*x := by
        simpa [hx] using h‚ÇÅ ‚àöx
      have h‚ÇÉ' x (hx : 0 ‚â§ x) : f x = f 0 ^ 2 / 2 + x := by
        field_simp
        simpa [mul_two, two_mul] using h‚ÇÉ x hx
      -- Now we're ready to consider the two possible values for `f 0`. As it turns out, `f 0 = 2` is easily disqualified.
      have hnot2 : f 0 ‚â† 2 := by
        intro h0
        have h‚ÇÑ x (hx : 0 ‚â§ x) : f x = x + 2 := by
          have := h‚ÇÉ' x hx
          simp [h0] at this
          norm_num at this
          rw [this]
          ring
        have := hp 1 1
        simp [h‚ÇÑ] at this
        norm_num at this
      -- This leaves `f 0 = 0`.
      have h0 : f 0 = 0 := by tauto
      -- With `h‚ÇÉ'`, this is enough to characterize the function on non-negative arguments.
      have hpos x (hx : 0 ‚â§ x) : f x = x := by simpa [h0] using h‚ÇÉ' x hx 
      -- Substituting `y = 0` into `hp`, we have `f (x^2) = f x ^ 2`
      have h‚ÇÑ x : f (x^2) = f x ^ 2 := by simpa [h0] using hp x 0
      -- On the left-hand side, we now apply `hpos`.
      have h‚ÇÑ' x : x^2 = f x ^ 2 := by
        simpa [hpos (x^2) <| pow_two_nonneg x] using h‚ÇÑ x
      -- Therefore, `f x` is either `x` or `-x`.
      have h‚ÇÖ x : f x = x ‚à® f x = -x := by
        rcases eq_or_eq_neg_of_sq_eq_sq _ _ <| (h‚ÇÑ' x).symm with h | h
        ¬∑ simp [h]
        ¬∑ simp [h]
      tauto

    -- Now, let's check that the solutions satisfy the equation.
    ¬∑ rintro ‚ü®h‚ÇÅ, h‚ÇÇ‚ü©
      unfold P; intros x y
      -- To handle the right-hand side, we note that squaring the output deals away with the sign stuff.
      have h‚ÇÉ a : f a ^ 2 = a^2 := by
        by_cases ha : 0 ‚â§ a
        ¬∑ simp [h‚ÇÅ a ha]
        ¬∑ rcases h‚ÇÇ a with h | h <;> simp [h]
      rw [h‚ÇÅ _ <| pow_two_nonneg x,
            h‚ÇÅ _ <| pow_two_nonneg y,
            h‚ÇÉ]
      ring
  -- Now, rearrange S into a more useful form:
  have hS f (hp : P f) : S f = ‚àë n ‚àà Finset.range 2020, (f n + f (-n)) := sorry
  -- We construct the appropriate function for all attainable sums.
  have hexists (t : ‚Ñï) (ht : t ‚â§ (Finset.range 2020).sum id)
      : ‚àÉ f, P f ‚àß S f = 2 * t := by
    -- First, express `t` as a sum of a subset of what's available.
    have hA : ‚àÉ A ‚äÜ Finset.range 2020, t = A.sum id := sorry
    obtain ‚ü®A, hA‚ü© := hA
    -- We construct the function such that the sum either cancels or doesn't, as appropriate.
    let f (x : ‚Ñù) : ‚Ñù := if ‚àÉ n ‚àà A, n = -x then -x else x
    -- Specifically, for n within A, we have...
    have hf‚ÇÅ n (hn : n ‚àà A) : f n + f (-n) = 2*n := sorry
    -- And for the rest, it vanishes.
    have hf‚ÇÇ n (hn : n ‚àâ A) : f n + f (-n) = 0 := sorry
    -- Therefore `S` attains the requested value.
    have hS : S f = 2 * t := sorry
    -- Of course, the `f` constructed above satisfies the problem.
    have hpf : P f := by
      rw [hf]
      constructor
      ¬∑ sorry
      ¬∑ intro; unfold f; split <;> simp
    exact ‚ü®f, hpf, hS‚ü©
  sorry

informal_statement: If $a, b, c$, and $d$ are pairwise distinct positive integers that satisfy $\operatorname{lcm}(a, b, c, d)<1000$ and $a+b=c+d$, compute the largest possible value of $a+b$.
formal_statement:
import Mathlib

set_option maxRecDepth 400000
/-If a, b, c and d are pairwise distinct positive integers that satisfy
lcm(a,b,c,d) < 1000 and a + b = c + d, compute the largest possible value of a + b-/
theorem number_theory_610552: IsGreatest {x: ‚Ñ§ | ‚àÉ a b c d: ‚Ñ§, 0 < d ‚àß d < a ‚àß a < b ‚àß b < c ‚àß
lcm (lcm (lcm a b) c) d < 1000 ‚àß a + b = c + d ‚àß x = a + b } 581 := by
formal_proof:
import Mathlib

set_option maxRecDepth 400000
/-If a, b, c and d are pairwise distinct positive integers that satisfy
lcm(a,b,c,d) < 1000 and a + b = c + d, compute the largest possible value of a + b-/
theorem number_theory_610552: IsGreatest {x: ‚Ñ§ | ‚àÉ a b c d: ‚Ñ§, 0 < d ‚àß d < a ‚àß a < b ‚àß b < c ‚àß
lcm (lcm (lcm a b) c) d < 1000 ‚àß a + b = c + d ‚àß x = a + b } 581 := by
  constructor
  -- 581 is possible
  . simp
    use 249
    use 332
    use 498
    use 83
    norm_num
    decide
  -- 581 is the largest
  . intro x h
    simp only [Set.mem_setOf_eq] at h
    obtain ‚ü®a, b, c, d, h‚ü© := h
    rcases h with ‚ü®hd, hda, hab, hbc, h1, h2, h3‚ü©
    rw [h3]
    clear h3
    set l:= lcm (lcm (lcm a b) c) d with hl
    let a':= l / a
    let b':= l / b
    let c':= l / c
    let d':= l / d
    have ha': a ‚à£ l := by   -- show a ‚à£ l
      rw [hl]
      have d1: a ‚à£ lcm (lcm a b) c := by
        have d2: a ‚à£ lcm a b := by
          apply dvd_lcm_left
        have d3: lcm a b ‚à£ lcm (lcm a b) c := by
          apply dvd_lcm_left
        apply dvd_trans d2 d3
      have d4: lcm (lcm a b) c ‚à£ lcm (lcm (lcm a b) c) d := by
        apply dvd_lcm_left
      apply dvd_trans d1 d4
    have hb': b ‚à£ l := by  -- show b ‚à£ l
      rw [hl]
      have d1: b ‚à£ lcm (lcm a b) c := by
        have d2: b ‚à£ lcm a b := by
          apply dvd_lcm_right
        have d3: lcm a b ‚à£ lcm (lcm a b) c := by
          apply dvd_lcm_left
        apply dvd_trans d2 d3
      have d4: lcm (lcm a b) c ‚à£ lcm (lcm (lcm a b) c) d := by
        apply dvd_lcm_left
      apply dvd_trans d1 d4
    have hc': c ‚à£ l := by --show c ‚à£ l
      rw [hl]
      have d1: c ‚à£ lcm (lcm a b) c := by
         apply dvd_lcm_right
      have d2: lcm (lcm a b) c ‚à£ lcm (lcm (lcm a b) c) d := by
         apply dvd_lcm_left
      apply dvd_trans d1 d2
    have hd': d ‚à£ l := by --show d ‚à£ l
      rw [hl]
      apply dvd_lcm_right
    have nel: lcm (lcm (lcm a b) c) d ‚â† 0 := by  --show that l ‚â† 0
      have nel': (lcm (lcm (lcm a b) c) d).natAbs ‚â† 0 := by
        rw [show (lcm (lcm (lcm a b) c) d).natAbs = (lcm (lcm a b) c).lcm d by rw [Int.natAbs_lcm]]
        apply Int.lcm_ne_zero
        have nel2: (lcm (lcm a b) c).natAbs ‚â† 0 := by
          rw [show (lcm (lcm a b) c).natAbs = (lcm a b).lcm c by rw [Int.natAbs_lcm]]
          apply Int.lcm_ne_zero
          have nel3: (lcm a b).natAbs ‚â† 0 := by
            rw [show (lcm a b).natAbs = a.lcm b by rw [Int.natAbs_lcm]]
            apply Int.lcm_ne_zero
            omega
            omega
          simp [nel3]
          omega
          omega
        simp [nel2]
        omega
        omega
      simp [nel']
      omega
    have l_pos: 0 < l := by  -- show 0 < l
      rw [hl]
      rw [‚Üê Int.coe_lcm]
      simp
      by_contra! no
      replace no: (lcm (lcm a b) c).lcm d = 0 := by omega
      rw [‚Üê Int.coe_lcm] at nel
      simp at nel
      simp [no] at nel
    clear nel
    have posa': 0 < a' := by
      apply Int.ediv_pos_of_pos_of_dvd
      all_goals omega
    have posb': 0 < b' := by
      apply Int.ediv_pos_of_pos_of_dvd
      all_goals omega
    have posc': 0 < c' := by  -- show 0 < c'
      apply Int.ediv_pos_of_pos_of_dvd
      all_goals omega
    have posd': 0 < d' := by  -- show 0 < d'
      apply Int.ediv_pos_of_pos_of_dvd
      all_goals omega
    have eq: (1: ‚Ñù) / a' + 1 / b' = 1 / c' + 1 / d' := by
      simp [a', b', c', d']
      field_simp
      rw [show (a: ‚Ñù) + (b: ‚Ñù) = ‚Üë((a: ‚Ñ§) + b) by simp]
      rw [show (c: ‚Ñù) + (d: ‚Ñù) = ‚Üë((c: ‚Ñ§) + d) by simp]
      rw [h2]
    set T:= (1: ‚Ñù) / a' + 1 / b' with hT
    have hda': a' < d' := by  -- show that a' < d', a little bit tricky in lean4
      simp [a',d']
      have o: (l: ‚Ñö) / a < (l: ‚Ñö) / d := by
        apply div_lt_div_of_pos_left
        simp
        omega
        simp
        omega
        simp
        omega
      have j: (l: ‚Ñö) / (a: ‚Ñö) = ‚Üë((l: ‚Ñ§) / (a: ‚Ñ§)) := by
        rw [‚Üê Rat.intCast_div]
        exact ha'
      have k: (l: ‚Ñö) / (d: ‚Ñö) = ‚Üë((l: ‚Ñ§) / (d: ‚Ñ§)) := by
        rw [‚Üê Rat.intCast_div]
        exact hd'
      rw [j, k] at o
      simp at o
      exact o
    have hab': b' < a' := by  -- show that a' < b'
      simp [a',b']
      have o: (l: ‚Ñö) / b < (l: ‚Ñö) / a := by
        apply div_lt_div_of_pos_left
        simp
        omega
        simp
        omega
        simp
        omega
      have j: (l: ‚Ñö) / (a: ‚Ñö) = ‚Üë((l: ‚Ñ§) / (a: ‚Ñ§)) := by
        rw [‚Üê Rat.intCast_div]
        exact ha'
      have k: (l: ‚Ñö) / (b: ‚Ñö) = ‚Üë((l: ‚Ñ§) / (b: ‚Ñ§)) := by
        rw [‚Üê Rat.intCast_div]
        exact hb'
      rw [j, k] at o
      simp at o
      exact o
    have hbc': c' < b' := by  -- show that b' < c'
      simp [b',c']
      have o: (l: ‚Ñö) / c < (l: ‚Ñö) / b := by
        apply div_lt_div_of_pos_left
        simp
        omega
        simp
        omega
        simp
        omega
      have j: (l: ‚Ñö) / (b: ‚Ñö) = ‚Üë((l: ‚Ñ§) / (b: ‚Ñ§)) := by
        rw [‚Üê Rat.intCast_div]
        exact hb'
      have k: (l: ‚Ñö) / (c: ‚Ñö) = ‚Üë((l: ‚Ñ§) / (c: ‚Ñ§)) := by
        rw [‚Üê Rat.intCast_div]
        exact hc'
      rw [j, k] at o
      simp at o
      exact o
    clear posa' posb' posd'  -- now 0 < c' < b' < a' < d'
    have eq2: a + b = T * l := by
      rw [hT]
      simp [a',b']
      field_simp
    have hc1: 2 ‚â§ c' := by  -- we show that c' ‚â• 2
      by_contra! hd1
      replace hc1: c' = 1 := by omega
      have l1: T ‚â§ (1: ‚Ñù) / 2 + (1: ‚Ñù) / 3 := by
        rw [hT]
        have o1: 2 ‚â§ b' := by omega
        have o2: 3 ‚â§ a' := by omega
        replace o1: 2 ‚â§ (b': ‚Ñù) := by norm_cast
        replace o2: 3 ‚â§ (a': ‚Ñù) := by norm_cast
        have la: 1 / (a': ‚Ñù) ‚â§ 1 / 3 := by
           rw [div_le_div_iff_of_pos_left]
           exact o2
           norm_num
           simp
           omega
           simp
        have lb: 1 / (b': ‚Ñù) ‚â§ 1 / 2 := by
           rw [div_le_div_iff_of_pos_left]
           exact o1
           norm_num
           simp
           omega
           simp
        nlinarith
      have l2: 1 ‚â§ T := by
        rw [eq]
        simp [hc1]
        omega
      have contra: 1 ‚â§ (1: ‚Ñù) / 2 + 1 / 3 := by
        calc
          1 ‚â§ T := l2
          _ ‚â§ (1: ‚Ñù) / 2 + (1: ‚Ñù) / 3 := l1
      absurd contra
      norm_num
    have hb1: 3 ‚â§ b' := by omega
    have ha1: 4 ‚â§ a' := by omega
    by_cases ha2: a' = 4
    -- for the cases a' = 4, we show that T = 7/12, l ‚â§ 996
    . replace hb1: b' = 3 := by omega
      replace hc1: c' = 2 := by omega
      simp [ha2,hb1] at hT
      rw [show 4‚Åª¬π + 3‚Åª¬π = (7: ‚Ñù) / 12 by norm_num] at hT
      rw [hT] at eq2
      have ll: l ‚â§ 996 := by
        have dvd1: 4 ‚à£ l := by
          have o: l = a * a' := by
            simp [a']
            qify
            rw [Rat.intCast_div]
            have ne: (a: ‚Ñö) ‚â† 0 := by
              qify at hd hda
              linarith
            field_simp
            exact ha'
          rw [o]
          rw [ha2]
          omega
        by_contra! no
        have l_val: l = 997 ‚à® l = 998 ‚à® l = 999 := by
          omega
        clear * - l_val dvd1
        rcases l_val with u | u | u
        all_goals simp [u] at dvd1; absurd dvd1; norm_num
      have i: ‚Üëa + ‚Üëb ‚â§ (581: ‚Ñù) := by
          rw [eq2]
          replace ll: (l: ‚Ñù) ‚â§ 996 := by
            clear * - ll
            rify at ll
            exact ll
          nlinarith [ll]
      rify
      exact i
     -- for the cases a' > 4, we show that a + b < 581
    . replace ha2: 5 ‚â§ a' := by omega
      have lT: T ‚â§ 8 / 15 := by
        rw [hT]
        have l1: 1 / (a': ‚Ñù) ‚â§ 1 / 5 := by
          rw [div_le_div_iff_of_pos_left]
          rify at ha2
          exact ha2
          norm_num
          simp
          omega
          simp
        have l2: 1 / (b': ‚Ñù) ‚â§ 1 / 3 := by
          rw [div_le_div_iff_of_pos_left]
          rify at hb1
          exact hb1
          norm_num
          simp
          omega
          simp
        nlinarith
      have i: ‚Üëa + ‚Üëb < (534: ‚Ñù) := by
        rw [eq2]
        have ll: (l: ‚Ñù) < 1000 := by
          clear * - h1
          rify at h1
          exact h1
        calc
           T * ‚Üël ‚â§ (8 / 15) * ‚Üël := by rw [mul_le_mul_right]; exact lT; rify at l_pos; exact l_pos
                _ < 8 / 15 * 1000 := by nlinarith [ll]
                _ < 534 := by norm_num
      rify
      linarith
